Reviews.Title: “Just like Asia”
Reviews.Author: colinaz
Reviews.Content: During my time in Asia, I probably stayed at what are still the most luxurious, well-run hotels I've seen in the world. I had never stayed at a Pan Pacific, specifically, but the name took me back, as I'm familiar with the hotel (having been inside) in Singapore. This hotel was like visiting those Asian hotels again. Came up with my wife for a conference. We stayed in a king that had a city view. The location is wonderful. It's right on the harbor and, if you don't get the harbor view, the lounge has big windows that face it. It's a sprawling business hotel, with a ground floor entrance and a lobby/check-in desk two floors up. There's an entrance to the Waterfront SkyTrain station practically out the front door. The room was large. It featured a king bed, a flat-screen TV, a desk, a very large bathroom, a pull-out sofa, and a chair and chaise lounge that faced the large windows. Everything was clean, well-appointed and exactly what I became used to in staying in hotels of similar quality in Asia but so rarely seen in the Americas. I was impressed with the quality of the room and furnishings. I was also impressed with the efficiency of the elevators. I think these are the most efficient I've seen in any high-rise hotel in the world. My nit-picks are really minor, but it's a 4.5-star, so I have to point them out. - When we checked in, we were asked if we wanted a newspaper. We said no but, on that first morning, I opened the door to a newspaper outside. There was no newspaper the subsequent days though. - There was a note on the desk in the room that mentioned the windows of the hotel were being cleaned. The time span given was roughly two weeks with no specifics on where they would be, so we had to be careful about leaving our shades open. I also didn't notice this note until the second day there. It seems like it would have been a good thing to mention upon check-in. - I had consistent problems with the keycard. Instead of inserting the key, you tapped against the door. Maybe it was a matter of my inexperience with this type of keycard, but it always took me several tries to get the door to open. If you're staying Downtown though, then this should be a top choice. It's location relative to the convention center, with its own walkway to it, is ideal if you're in town for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Not complaints but nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: jaipaulmasseysingh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for business. A beautiful building with good eating, a convenient location and beautiful views but no personality or vibe. A perfectly good place to stay and absolutely nothing to complain about but I'll be staying someplace else next time that has an energy to it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jack m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms was clean and roomy. The view was great as we could see the ocean and the mountains. The restaurant offered a very nice brunch. Walking distance to almost everything e.g. cruise ship terminal, skytrain terminal, lots of restaurants close-by.....Parking was about $30 plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but no Energy”
Reviews.Author: SteveMedicoff
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, spacious room, but the Pan Pacific for me lacked any vibe or energy. Everywhere I was in the hotel seemed quiet, subdued and lacked an ambiance that I thrive on. Some may like that, but I wanted to be in a happening and vibrant Hotel, and it was a far cry from it. Some minor service glitches bothered me, like not having the final checkout bill under my door on the final morning, it would have made my checkout quicker. I asked the front desk and was told flatly that you have to ask for that when you check in. A bit strange I thought. Also an issue when I extended my stay for an extra day, they didnt extend my electronic key. After going all the way to the front desk after a long day, they didn't have the sense to say "I'm Sorry". That would have made it right for me. Just a small detail, but they should always work hard to earn and keep those stars.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: Dave N
Reviews.Content: Since the Olympics in Vancouver hotel rates skyrocketed and pan pacific lost my business because of such. They come across pretentious and arrogant. Yes, nice rooms but not nicer than fairmont across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huning
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with 3 friends over the Easter weekend. The beds are comfy and view is the best over looking Coal Harbour, Stanley Park and the mountains. We stayed on 9th floor (8-23 for guests), though we requested high floor which presumably would have even better views. Internet and parking are not included and are expensive (as most downtown hotels). Valet parking is $39/night. Staff are good and the location is the best in Vancouver (not one of). If you like big grand hotels vs small boutique hotel. Likewise, you wouldn't get those services such as turndown. The bathroom is pretty large, but shower and bath is not separated. Each room has a mini-bar with quality drinks (extra $) but it's pretty attempting. We didn't try the food that the hotel as there are so many options in Vancouver. Overall, if there's a good deal, you won't regret this grand 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for Location”
Reviews.Author: abbyford
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 weeks ago with my daughter for a cheerleading competition that was being held at the hotel. One night accomodation for a 'normal' room was $366 and did not include parking. Parking was an additional $35/ day. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The view from our room of Stanley Park was incredible. The staff were friendly. We ordered room service - two meals, no alcohol: $119. I considered using the spa for a massage - all the treatments were highly overpriced. I've stayed at many hotels around the world and for the price I paid for this hotel I was expecting much higher luxury for what I got. You are truly paying for the location of this hotel. I will not return - I can't justify $650 for a ONE NIGHT stay (especially when I leave only an hour away!). I found solace in a $20 mini bottle of wine from the bar fridge in our room. This hotel is nice - but far too expensive. I have a healthy salary - but not one to justify this expense. Look around Vancouver for a better deal - there are nice hotels in the city that won't cost nearly as much as this one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: cbprof
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from March 15-20 for a meeting. The hotel was teriffic! I was fortunate and got to check in early. As a single at the hotel, I felt safe and secure. The hot tub and pool were wonderful, open late and had an excellent sauna. I dined once at the main restaurant near the registration desk and had drinks one night at the hotel bar. Both were fine. The views from the bar were fantastic. The hotel staff was extremely helpul without being imposing.. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: 2PotomacTraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly. Multi-level lobby chops up the property and makes it more difficult to find friends and colleagues. Club floor slow check-in because the staff member was helping someone plan tourism; it would have been much faster to check in at main Reception but they sent me to the Club Floor! Evening hors douvres very average; terrific espresso/cappucino machine that unfortunately broke our first day there. Club floor room nothing special. Next time in Vancouver, we'll try another hotel to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed by the front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: DagFH
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Pan Pacific Victoria during the last day of Feb/first days of March 2012. The hotel itself is nicely situated at the quay where the cruise ships berth (during the summer season from approx May-Sept, which must be a great sight). The Congress Centre (which was built ahead of the Olympics 2010) is situated next to the hotel, and is really a nice, modern architectonical building. Our room was, of course (according to the standard of the hotel), very nice and well-equipped…however – as it was not situated towards the seaside, we missed the great sea view with the snowy mountains in the background. Though, our room at the 16th floor had a nice view towards a part of the bay and the city centre. As we flew on a guided tour at a sea plane one day, we really experienced the best of Vancouver’s beautiful location. The hotels breakfast is very expensive, which made us walk to a very nice Italian coffee shop every morning to have the best of coffee and sandwiches (at a much more reasonable cost). What we did not like about the hotel, was the service at the front desk. The staff was too impersonal, too formal, not friendly at all in a nice way. My feeling was that they seemed to think that we were disturbing them. Not a smile, not a personal touch, not a question – when we checked out – if we were satisfied with our stay/thanking us for staying at the hotel/wishing us a nice day/welcoming us back the next time etc. Very cold, impersonal and machine like front desk staff – according to our experience!. We will really like to come back to Vancouver during the summer season, and to do a cruise from this beautiful city through the magnificent nature (archipelagos, fjords and mountains) to Alaska. However, we will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “With customer service like theirs you may as well stay in a barn!”
Reviews.Author: Vdeee
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night at the hotel and had a few issues with the room. Nothing major but very annoying issues that kept happening throughout the night. We didn't take them up at the time of the issue as we were very tired and exhausted from walking the town. We should of called at the hour they occurred but didn’t. We called down to the front desk and they were very short and rude with us the next morning. We then spoke to the manager on duty, who I was informed is only a part timer and she (Caroline) said she would get right back to us. Never heard back from her still even until today. This is what was the most frustrating. They didn’t care enough to call us back to even tell us that they checked and there was nothing they could do. At check out, I had asked to speak to her and had to wait for 15 minutes before I was told she is in a private meeting and her office door is locked... Sounds like she was on lunch and the front desk was too lazy to figure this out before wasting my time. I had asked the front desk lady to please have her call us and left phone # with her. Nothing! We paid top dollar for a top hotel and they couldn't even call us back. WOW! I let a few days pass to see if maybe her "private meeting behind a locked door" was over and still heard nothing back. Today spoke to Darrin, who is the supposed full time manager and was very angry and frustrated that I had to call the hotel. He basically told me that he was sorry for everything but they can't do anything. He never asked if there was anything that could be done to make us feel satisfied with the 300 or so we blew at the hotel. I used some harsh language as he get basically calling me as I perceived it a liar and then informed me that I am no longer welcome in his hotel. Breakdown of charges: Walk in room rate of 161 +20 for upgraded harbor view. This was their rate not ours. $40 for parking for the night $5 for daily internet for 1 device Plus they wanted to charge us EXTRA for soap and towels but waived that fee. Are you kidding me? Is this normal? Extra for soaps and towels. When asking for toiletries, they had very little of what I needed, like Shaving Cream (yes I know, unusual request for a hotel to have shaving cream....) Funny thing, I am in the service industry. I have had customers yell, scream, curse, threaten violence to me and my family, put voo doo on me and the rest. There are often times that things happen, people have bad days etc. and never once did I tell them to not come back. I asked them to be calm and reasonable and said I understand why they are angry and am on their side to fix the issue. I also always asked the most important question to me, What can we do to fix this issue? This was never once asked. Had it been things would not have blown up. Darrin- I would never stay at your hotel or advise anyone to. It is a beautiful building and that is where it stops! Beds are double in the room not even queen. I wish you the best and hope your hotel ups their training. You guys act like people with 0 education. My wife is an attorney, cousin who I stayed with a doctor and I have an MBA. We are neither rude nor crude. We stay at nice places to get away from life and we often ask for some services. Is that not what the hospitality industry is for? Making our lives less stressful. Enough time wasted on this. Please stay at the Fairmont, Hyatt, Westin or other hotels nearby. Same amenities and far greater service.

Reviews.Title: “Not as awesome as we'd hoped”
Reviews.Author: Travel Addict P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little dated and the rooms didn't have as many amenities as most 5 star hotels do. The fact that parking, even for hotel guests, was $35 a day was a major turnoff for this place. Also, don't expect a fantastic night's sleep. The walls are pretty thin. We had 2 rooms and our friends in the room next to us could hear us talking through the walls. In our room, we were woken up by housekeeping in the room on the other side of us. We could hear them talking and even fluffing pillows! The noise level was less than desirable. This isn't the worst hotel I've stayed in, but I just wouldn't recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “needs some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: traveltoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for my husband's birthday. It was the first time I had ever used priceline so didn't know what to expect. I thought that they would put us in the worst room in the place, but in fact our room seemed to be a little larger than many others on our floor, and had a little alcove type area with a chaise lounge that was nice to have wine in the evening and coffee in the morning. I have stayed in all of the neighboring hotels- the Fairmont Waterfront, the Fairmont Pacific Rim- by far the nicest- and I would say this one comes in third. Both the Pan Pacific and the Waterfront need some updating to their rooms, but the Waterfront's rooms are bigger. They all need to reduce their parking rates!!!! They beds and pillows were comfortable, but I could here the next room. In general I find the Fairmont's have friendlier staff. So, would I stay here again, yes, but for a few extra dollars I would rather go to the Pacific Rim.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: dxb67
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location where you can easily walk to all the major attractions and shopping streets in Downtown Vancouver. The rooms are big and comfortable. The service was great. The only downside was the breakfast (expensive and not much bread choices) but there is a Tim Horton next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: bjr777
Reviews.Content: On the waterfront. Close to great dining. The views are fantastic. We found a reasonable rate (for the area) on the internet. It was well worth. The room was beautiful and the hotel staff was very helpful You can sit in your room and watch the ships come in and the seaplanes take off. The room we had was a deluxe harbour double with a view of the harbour and the mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: rorokimtor
Reviews.Content: My wife whisked me away for a romantic birthday overnight to the Pan Pacific and it was fantastic. The staff were very friendly and professional at every step. We were in room 1910 and had amazing views of downtown and the North Shore (and the outdoor salt water pool!). The package my wife got included champagne, tuxedo strawberries, cake and a lovely rose - all were extremely lovely. Spoiled! The room itself was quite spacious - along with the bed, a desk and office chair, there was a lovely chaise longue and another occasional chair in the room. Plenty of space to lounge around. There was a large flat panel TV on the bureau in the corner, which was nice - if we'd been staying for longer, we would have enjoyed having it. The room was quite close to the elevators, but it was still very quiet and the bed was very comfortable, so we had an excellent night's sleep. The temperature controls in the room were easy to use and very responsive, so we were able to get the temperature down to our usual polar bear levels in no time. The bathroom was the only unspectacular part of the room - it was a little tight and there was no soaker tub, just the standard tub. But the water pressure in the shower was excellent and we both really enjoyed the bath products. We had dinner at the Five Sails restaurant in the hotel - amazing. The package we had included a $50 room service credit, so we had room service for breakfast - it too was very very good. Excellent lattes! My ONLY complaint had nothing to do with the hotel itself - a huge group of rowdy, heavily drinking fraternity kids from Seattle were at the hotel preparing for a booze cruise (because the drinking age in BC is only 19! Wooo! Chug chug chug! OMG, I'm gonna barf!) and they completely took over the outdoor pool and hot tub for a few hours, making it uncomfortable for the few guests (us, another couple) who were there for a quiet swim and who really really wanted a few minutes in the hot tub. Hotel security came out at one point to tell them no alcohol at the pool, but that just made them sneakier. Again, totally not the hotel's fault that their pool was invaded by Girls Gone Wild: Vancouver Edition, but it was still annoying. Overall, I'd absolutely stay here again - for pleasure or business. Excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: happycamper77
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to Vancouver for over 20 years and have found myself returning to this property a lot lately. Not the cheapest rates for sure but probably the most scenic location in Vancouver. I feel immediately comfortable every time I walk into my room. The views are spectacular looking west.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Retreat from the Rain”
Reviews.Author: walkingon_travels
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a Groupon deal for this hotel over Presidents Day weekend 2012. Booking was a breeze. All of the dates we were looking for were available. The usual nightly rate is way beyond our normal trip price range but with the Groupon we were able to enjoy an extra bit of luxury without breaking the bank. Check in was fast and efficient. Our Suite The 23rd floor had amazing views of the city although it was not always as quiet as you would expect. Starting around 8am seaplanes took off in the harbor right below us. Thankfully I had packed our sound machine so it never woke our toddler up. We let our toddler have the living room of the suite. It was spacious enough to hold his travel crib at night and push it out of the way so we could play during the day. The mini bar fridge, although very well stocked, could still hold a quart of milk for early morning kid meals. The bedroom, along with the living room, sported a nice flat screen TV with basic cable. The bed was huge (a King) with enough pillows available to make even the most uncomfortable of pregnant women (that would be me) happy at night. If I needed more pillows it was just a Service One call button away. Unfortunately I pressed that little button a little too late on our first night. The hotel was fully booked and all of the Tempur-Pedic pillows had been checked out. Make sure you call as soon as you check in to reserve one. Every bathroom is bigger than the one we have at home so it isn't hard to impress me. As long as it is clean and in good repair you have pretty much won me over. The bathtub was perfect for our toddler to take a swim in before bed. I loved the multilevel shower flow that helped ease a little pregnancy back pain. My favorite feature was that the door to the bathroom could close in the entire bathroom or just the toilet so other family members could shower or throw some make-up while someone else took care of their business. Entertainment The room’s entertainment was adequate but it did have a few hiccups. While the TVs were very nice, they only had analog cable TV, no digital. This could just be the tech snob in me coming out, although my husband pointed it out so I guess he is the snob not me. If you weren’t in the mood for the cable channel offerings you could also order a Pay Per View movie for an additional cost. The Internet connection was fast enough to do some photo uploads. The most annoying thing was that you could only have one device logged in at a time. I have seen this set up only once before and it was in Vancouver as well. I’m not sure if this is a universal hotel policy in the city, but it was extremely annoying. Free Wi-Fi and Internet access should be just that. If I am a guest, I want everyone in my room to be able to use it. Hotel Amenities Club Lounge- After the comfy bed, the Club Lounge was by far my favorite hotel amenity. There was fresh fruit plus tea and coffee service until 10pm every night. The lounge also served up a very nice breakfast. This saved us a considerable amount of money each day as dining in Vancouver is not cheap. Cereal, bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, meats and cheeses were all available. On top of these offerings there were two hot breakfast items each day. One morning it was mini French toast slices the next there were tiny quiche. We were not able to take advantage of the Happy Hour hor d’ourves as we were usually headed out for dinner at that time. The offering was not substantial enough to replace a meal. It looked very nice though and several couples were taking full advantage of the lounge before they headed out for a late meal. Alcoholic beverages were not complimentary. Spa Utopia- The lowest point in our trip was my visit to Spa Utopia. It came across as being much to corporate for my taste. Everything felt so rushed. Luxury and relaxation were not the main focus. I wasn’t even asked if I liked my service when I was checking out. The only saving grace was the nail specialist that chatted away with me during my pedicure. Outdoor Swimming Pool- We did not get to take advantage of the heated outdoor salt-water swimming pool and jacuzzi on the 8th Floor. It looked wonderful, but it was just too darn cold outside to venture a dip. The Location The Pan Pacific was centrally located right on the water next to the cruise terminal. The hotel is just above the convention center. This made finding reception a little confusing, but it was a great launching point to tackle the city. We were within walking distance of Gastown, Stanley Park (aquarium!) and the food and shops on Robson Street. A bus stop was just a short walk away and taxis were always close by. A food court is located across the street for any immediate snacking needs. Things did close down after office hours in this area, so be sure to check the restaurant hours before you head out. WARNING: Parking is not included in the cost of your room usually. You can get a parking pass from the hotel that gives you 24 hour access and in/out privileges but it will cost you $35 per day to park. Valet parking is also available.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Welcoming, Expensive”
Reviews.Author: GinnyLT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific while helping my elderly father attend a scientific convention. We chose the hotel because of its close proximity with enclosed walkway to the Convention Center, and because the banquet my father was attending was at the hotel itself. The convenience was fabulous. He was able to walk 30 ft from his room to the elevator, then down and out 50 feet from the elevator to the banquet room. Getting to the Convention Ctr was also easy for him with his walker. There were elevators most places. The only hitch was lack of elevator or escalator to the tunnel across the street to the food court and Fairmont Hotel. There are good stairs, however. I also chose the Pan Pacific because the reservation/front desk people were so helpful and welcoming! They continued after our arrival--even left us surprise birthday cake in our room for our arrival. I don't remember mentioning it was my birthday, but must have! Our room was beautiful. We upgraded to a "corner" room to have more space for three of us to move around. It had a nice sitting area for Dad to sit and relax. The view was fantastic of the harbor, Stanley Park, the mountains, etc., but I'm not sure, for the extra $$, it was any better than that of any other room on the water side. It wasn't a corner room as much as an end room. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom beautiful. We ate in the cafe once and in the piano lounge once. Both were delicious and expensive. The service in both was top notch. I would recommend either spot. The concierge and front desk were both wonderful -as you would expect in a hotel of this caliber. Both were very welcoming and helpful. Parking was expensive-$39 per night; but parking is expensive everywhere in Vancouver. Our only complaint was with the valets. When we left, they loaded our suitcases without leaving room for my dad's walker--then couldn't fit it in--so they just walked away and stood a few feet away and watched as my husband had to unload the suitcases and reload them properly to fit the walker in. Wasn't that their job? Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. Be prepared to spend a lot, and enjoy the luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Staying on the ocean and the city at the same time”
Reviews.Author: kardiatraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just on the waterfront of the beautiful and usually wet Vancouver.Rooms are very spacious and as I stayed on the 20th floor the view was spectacular from the city part as from the ocean part every morning was the same cloudy weather. The hotel is very good at all aspects but the best was the breakfast as the options were many and the quality was 5 stars . Pricing is a general matter in Vancouver so the hotel is at normal rates for this great place

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations of a high end hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilyNow
Reviews.Content: Well done, from when we entered, unit we left. Clean room, nice furnishing and, professional service.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of Rates”
Reviews.Author: whitepelican
Reviews.Content: We booked the best rate available on the Internet thinking it was the best deal period. But if you are a BC resident and call the Hotel directly there is a much better rate. No where on the site does it indicate you should call for different rates. In our experience most companies want you to book on line and that rate is guaranteed the best. Before checking out I called the front desk to inquire about the rate difference and was told that was just the way it is. Of course we received a questionnaire from the hotel and again I expressed our displeasure with the rates. Our comments were brushed away with a form letter response. This is not what we expect from a hotel with such high standards for service. Yes, the room was spacious and the bed comfortable but that does not change the fact that the rates are miss leading and the staff attitude is poor. There are great choices of hotels right across the street and with a view too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Views, Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. The views are like none other! This hotel is by far one of my favorites. The rooms aren't cookie cutter and that is what I love. We stayed in a King size room, and the window ran the length of the wall and was at an angle. I will definitely go back to Vancouver and this is the only place I will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice waterfront location”
Reviews.Author: Travellingwhenwecan
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel occasionally for my work, when needed a hotel by the waterfront, close to floatplanes and helijet. For my most recent stay, the bed was comfortable and I enjoyed the chaise lounge for reading. The bathroom feels dated, especially the wallpaper, and the stoned tiled floor was particularly cold on the feet in winter. Although the hotel is non-smoking, my room had a stale odour reminescent of cigarettes. My room also did not have an adjustable chair for use with the desk (the desk was nice and large), which is not the best for a business traveller. The fan for the heating system was quite loud and woke me up at night. Staff were very friendly, and the breakfast room service was delivered just as requested (note: $25 for french toast). I was on a corporate rate so the value was good.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashley B
Reviews.Content: First off I must say I love this hotel, the only reason I dont give it 5 stars is i think its overpriced for what it is. It is clean, has friendly staff and uses AVEDA products. I also like AVEDA. Anyways, you can expect good service here and to meet people from all corners of the globe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, food too expensive”
Reviews.Author: goingtocuba
Reviews.Content: Very nice location and views from this hotel. Our 1 bedroom suite was spacious and very well appointed. Service was excellent. Walls are thin. Just really expensive. Food is expensive and average. Room service is priced beyond any reason. Went across the street to the Fairmont Waterfront for dinner and breakfast as friends were there - better food, and it was less expensive (so that says a lot I think when Fairmont food prices seem reasonable!) There are many lovely options for hotels in downtown Vancouver, I wouldn't recommend this hotel due to the cost, oh and a lumpy mattress.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of average chain of hotel, Seafood chowder was excellent”
Reviews.Author: LonelyPTraveller
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to say about the hotel and it's amenities as it is a typical hotel. Nothing that really caught my eye. Location was not ideal if you you are a traveller who prefers to go around with no car. It was by the water. As for the food, it was great! Or lack of a better word, exemplary...Cafe pacifica restaurant Seafood chowder is a must that one should order. Atlantic LOBSTER & PRAWN with home-made potato gnocchi gratin is something to order too. If we could try all, we would. Service was excellent too. Fast and attentive. We were lucky that at that time they had Opera singers who sang for us while we were eating. I believe that was on a weekend. As we passed by , we saw that they had a buffet section too but we didn't feel like stuffing ourselves. Thinking about their food is making me drool now. Posted some pics! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “OKish”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: Stayed on our way to Victoria - it was OK but nothing special, reception was quite away from our room and had no help in trying to find the room. Would not stay here again there were far nicer hotels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CanVanBC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a greta location on the water. Very central to walking distance to Robson and Gastown, plus a very short cab ride (could walk too!!) to Yaletown. Nice hotel and environment, but the staff could be more friendly especially at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “First impressions”
Reviews.Author: rj_watters
Reviews.Content: Although the first impression is of a very corporate hotel, the atmosphere and friendly staff more than make up for this and add a personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel..but better out there”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is linked with Canada place. I was there in early January. I had booked a junior suite but the hotel seemed to have been overbooked in that category. So they offered to downgrade me!!! OR I had to pay for an upgrade to a larger suite. I had a colleague joining me so I paid the extra CA$ 75 per night to get upgraded to a large suite. The suite was pretty decent size with a large sofa in the living room and a round dining table with 4 chairs. The sofa does not turn into a sofa bed so keep this in mind. They will bring up a bed but once the bed is put in the living area there isn't much place to walk. There is a full bathroom outside and another one in the bed room. The BR is decent size. The biggest problem I had with this room was that as compared to the room size the window was tiny. I have seen bigger windows in a motel. It was unbelievable. Overall I would not stay at the hotel again and surely would not upgrade to a suite. It ended up costing me almost CA$350 per night. Surely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to end a holiday in Canada”
Reviews.Author: ATDUNCRIEVIE
Reviews.Content: My wife & I booked the Pan Pacific as a special treat to end a fantastic 3 week tour of the Rocky Mountains and British Columbia. The Pan Pacific is ideally situated for exploring Vancouver city and is just a few minutes walk from the station where the Skytrain links to Vancouver airport. The location on the waterfront provides wonderful views across the harbour. On arrival the desk staff was pleasant and helpful. Unfortunately when we got to our room it was obvious someone had been smoking in the room. We were offered a "deep clean" of the room but asked to be relocated. We were allocated a different room with a "city view" which was spectacular at night. The room was spacious, and very well equipped although a bit stuffy even with the aircon on full. (The room was south facing and the sun had been shining during the day). There is an excellent shopping mall beneath the hotel with a variety of cafes and fast food outlets if you don’t want to use the hotel facilities. We used the outside swimming pool which is on the 8th floor and this was excellent. We very much enjoyed our luxurious stay at the Pan Pacific and it was a fitting end to a marvellous Canadian holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and well appointed room”
Reviews.Author: Travels4love
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Pan Pacific previously and have dined in their restaurants and used the Spa services as well. I find the service in the hotel to be excellent but not quite as good in the restaurants. Spa Utopia is excellent with very consistent services. The location of this hotel is superb, right on the water with views of the North Shore mountains and Stanley Park. Within walking distance to most everything which is always a requirement for me when staying in a lively city. The temp control in the room was good and operated properly. The bathroom amenities good, the pool area is great and Spa Utopia in the hotel is excellent as well. Vancouver is a fantastic city to visit and is only made better by an efficient airport and a lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmtk767
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, very convenient for events at the conference center across the street

Reviews.Title: “My favorite”
Reviews.Author: Karen U
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my favorite in Vancouver so far, and I've stayed at many. It's got a beautfiul view, many amenties, great location... and it's just so darn nice! The beds are comfortable, the staff is great, the pool is warm and in a great spot, and the rooms are really nice and quiet. And for what you get, the prices are reasonable. It's still my first choice when I want to treat myself and I have a little extra to spend. I've stayed here a couple of times but the last time was right after I got married and kidnapped my husband for a mini honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: fitzgerrell
Reviews.Content: Booked in to a club king room - club floors get use of the club lounge, includes nice breakfast, evening snacks and a drink each day. Room was very clean, bed and linens were great. Nice sized room with a good view. Room had an idapt device charger, quite handy. Location is good - on the waterfront close to Gastown. Access from stairs in the lobby to food court and Skytrain. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view - excellent location - luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vansportsfan
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific really has it all!! I decided to do a staycation pamper weekend to celebrate my 50th Birthday. I checked into the Pan for two nights with my sister who came from out of town. The view from our floor to ceiling windows (20th floor) of the ocean & North shore mountains was breath taking. The spectacular view and beauty of Vancouver (my home city) was somewhat symbolic of the occasion - to appreciate all that is near & dear to me at this stage in my life. If you can find a good deal during the off-season (mid Oct.-mid April) especially the Winter months, you really can get great bang for your buck. The staff is so professional & friendly and really go the extra mile, the thick slice of birthday cake put in the room was a nice touch as was the upgrade to a higher floor deluxe room. The hotel is in a perfect downtown location, next to the convention centre, about 3 blks west of Gastown, 5 blks NE from Robson, 2 short blks west of the Canada Line, Skytrain & Seabus Station. If you come from YVR airport, take the Canada Line ($5 pp) to Terminus Station Waterfront (20 min.) exit on Cordova Street, go to your right 2 very short city blks & turn right at Howe Street, Canada Place Cruise Terminal & the Pan Pacific is right there. If you take a cab, it will take about 50 min. + (depending on traffic) and cost $40+. The train runs every few minutes from about 5am to 1am. The Hotel itself is very elegant, and has a nice restaurant, lounge, high end shops and lots of meeting rooms. They put on a very good but pricey Sunday brunch in the Five Sails Restaurant and have a wonderful spa. The rooms are spotless and tastefully decorated. They have extremely comfortable beds, nice bath products, bathrobes, spacious closet space and the bathrooms are a good size. I loved the room & the hotel and felt totally pampered. Exactly how I wanted to celebrate my milestone birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: SRKC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific, Vancouver for 2 nights in early December. Room was spacious, clean and the bed very comfortable. Free wi-fi was great and the bathrobes and bath products were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and not worth the premium”
Reviews.Author: Snowkarver
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here solo on a business trip. Based on my prior experience with the Pan Pacific chain, as well as its excellent review curve here on TripAdvisor, I had very high expectations for my stay - in fact, I went through the trouble of transferring mid-trip from the Sheraton Wall Centre just to try this property. Unfortunately, it wasn't worth the effort as I definitely preferred the latter. While the front desk staff were courteous and efficient, service was generally curt and not up to the standards I have experienced at other luxury brands. I also found my room to be a surprising step down from the Sheraton - cramped, with a terribly restricted view, and furnished with very bland decor. Although it was fine for an expense-account trip, with so many excellent alternatives nearby in this tourist-oriented city, I wouldn't bother spending my own money to return.

Reviews.Title: “nice business trip made even better”
Reviews.Author: RobertL293
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Vancouver and my first stay at the Pan Pacific Vancouver. I booked a Deluxe Room that had a superb view of the harbor, which handled a steady stream of seaplanes taking off and landing. It was a nice touch. The hotel was nicely appointed and very comfortable despite its size and level of activity. I utilized the hotel's facilities to sponsor a small business reception and dinner that were handled superbly by an accommodating and very responsive and friendly staff. All who attended were very impressed. I definitely plan to return to this fine hotel with my wife on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotel”
Reviews.Author: sb1099
Reviews.Content: This is a typical business hotel with an excellent location convenient to conference rooms, eateries, and the rest of downtown. I was here to attend a conference, I imagine it would be very convenient for people taking cruises, I saw a number of people have the bellboy check the luggage on to the cruise ship directly. I would definitely come back here if I were taking a cruise. I got upgraded to a room with a view which was nice. Beds were comfortable. Room service food was OK.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent pre-cruise choice”
Reviews.Author: ozitravlr
Reviews.Content: We booked a Deluxe Harbour King room because the Deluxe King rooms had been described in a few reviews as having some noise issues as these rooms have connecting doors. Our room was clean and quiet, with a very comfortable bed. We enjoyed the view of the harbour and the seaplanes taking off. They are noisy, but don’t fly at night. Had we been awake very early the next morning we might even have seen our cruise ship arrive. We did see a Holland America ship sail in and dock below our window. Dining in the hotel: There are restaurants in the adjoining mall and Gastown isn’t too far away - but we were tired after a long flight and opted to eat dinner and breakfast in the hotel. It was very crowded, make a dinner reservation if you want to eat in the Pacifica restaurant. We didn’t have a reservation so ate in the bar (same menu but a bit less comfortable for a meal). There is an a la carte option for breakfast but as the restaurant was very crowded the waitress recommended the buffet to avoid kitchen delays. Not a great fan of hotel buffets but this was an extensive one with plenty of choice, replenished in a timely fashion. Staff in the hotel were all pleasant and helpful, and we especially appreciated being able to send our luggage from the room to the ship. Then it was a simple matter to go down in the elevator to the embarkation point at Canada Place. They say they have never lost a bag, and sure enough we next saw it in our cabin, where it arrived before we did. All in all a good place to stay pre-cruise and would recommend it. Tip: If you are a foreign citizen then the embarkation process, clearing US Customs/Immigration, could be lengthy. Overall, it took us three hours to pass though the Vancouver Port Security and US customs/immigration process. If you are a non-US/Canadian cruise passenger staying in the Pan Pacific hotel pre-cruise (and I recommend that you do), be aware of the potential for delays in embarking. Apparently it is worse at the beginning and end of the cruise season, when apparently more foreign passengers are travelling. There was minimal delay for US/Canadian citizens, however all passengers should know that the Vancouver Port Authority screens your hand luggage and will ask you to open your bags if they detect sharp items. It won’t be an issue if you have come straight off a plane, but if you have stayed overnight at a hotel and accessed your sharp items again, then be aware of the possibility. This screening process partly contributed to the delay in embarkation. It is thorough – they even found a small penknife which a British man had forgotten was in his hand luggage (and he had just come through Heathrow).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but typical of a downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adrian M
Reviews.Content: The room was ok but I must admit I only had one with a partial harbour view. Perhaps the full waterfront rooms are nicer. This one was "older" and had a somewhat odd layout. Typical of a downtown hotel, breakfast was extremely expensive and the "exclusice" limo service to the airport was almost double what it cost to drive in from the airport. The location is great, easy walking distance to Robson, restaurants and shopping. If you are choosing I recommend the Loden over this one.

Reviews.Title: “The best of Vancouver in easy reach”
Reviews.Author: greenwayplanner
Reviews.Content: I live in Vancouver and booked the Pan Pacific for an international conference's speakers and guests, and stayed in a suite. The rooms are older now, but the service is still top notch. the outdoor swimming pool is wonderful and staff very attentive. I'd book this hotel any time to have a vacation in my hometown!

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific - pricey but fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Shawny75
Reviews.Content: We got this room through Hotwire. This is the biggest hotel room I have ever stayed in except for once at the Setai in South Beach. Huge room. Fantastic view of Vancouver. We looked at Cruise ships every day and heard their horns. The dining room was also great. The location was the best, we walked everywhere. We didn't go to Mother's day brunch as it was too pricey!!! There is a little mall connected to the hotel by the underground and we ate at McDonalds. It can really rain in Vancouver so take a waterproof coat and an umbrella. Anything downtown is easy to get to because of the Canada Line from the airport, more than convenient and you are not subjected to a taxi driver's driving.

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping in the clouds”
Reviews.Author: victoria_BCLeam
Reviews.Content: Our pre-Christmas trip was very rewarding. We took a 35 minute flight on a Harbour Air seaplane from downtown Victoria to downtown Vancouver... followed by a very short walk to a Convention Centre elevator which whisked us up to street level, a nether short walk- then an escalator ride up to the lobby and then a "guest access only" elevator up to the 20th. Our view of the city and water activity was outstanding... The curved walls made me feel like I was on a cruise ship! The hotel is about a 20 minute walk from Rogers Arena for Canuck fans, next to the Sky train station and Sea bus to North Vancouver, and very close to so many interesting sites, stores, and restaurants. Bottled water was very expensive in the room, there is a cost for WiFi in the hotel, restaurants gourmet and pricey for a family budget. There is a nearby food court, and many restaurants a short distance from the hotel. Loved the bathroom with a huge window, loved the chaise lounge, and the large table work area. This would be the place I would stay any trip to Vancouver. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great job”
Reviews.Author: Bruce Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for three nights after a Holland America Alaska cruise at the end of June 2011. It was very convenient to the cruise ship terminal and the service was impeccable. The room had a good view of the city and little of the water. The concierge desk was outstanding. The only problem and they did straighten it out was the internet access. They wanted us to pay a separate charge for each computer that had access to the internet. That seems a bit excessive and they adjusted the bill accordingly. All in all, a very good experience. The prices are a bit high but Vancouver is a pricey town.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty fancy place for business, would come back for personal”
Reviews.Author: sandyrodge
Reviews.Content: Quick check in, nice room, beautiful view of the city and habour. Easy sky train accessibility to and from Surrey and the airport. Would definately stay there again if I were to come back to Vancouver. Beds were super comfy, shower had a massage option. Water and Bar items were expensive, so were the restaurants. We enjoyed the food court and tiny mall, that was just across the street down the stairs. Nice lounger in the room, and flat screen was nice, however the channel guide was focused on the buying o f movies rather than free TV. the digital was only available for movies, not TV. Overall very good hotel for 119.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great place! A bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel in a really nice location right on the ocean, nice pools and city views are realy amazing. There is lots of shopping and stuff nearby and we had a nice suite room with robes and other nice stuff in it, soaps and everything nice. Have their cesar salad in the dining room, pricy but definitely worth the dollars (even if the canadian dollars are worth more now...was a better bargain a few years back with better xchange).

Reviews.Title: “business trip”
Reviews.Author: KhweziMbolekwa
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a business trip. This has been a favourite hotel. The room was spacious with a desk at which to work and complimentary internet service. The bed linen was great for a good night's sleep. The facilities are well appointed and swimming in the outdoor heated pool late in the evening to unwind was just the ticket to end a long day. The staff are courteous and professional but one needed to ask for courtesies that should have been readily offered. A clearer explanation about the parking at the outset would have been helpful. For less than 2 full days parking the original cost was over $70! I spoke with staff and they kindly made an adjustment for what would have been the obvious parking option. Nonetheless the parking cost is simply prohibitive. The only other negative was the slowness of the their internet 'lite' access. That made working a slower than normal process. Otherwise the accommodations, staff and amenities were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: ZayM
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location and view of the city from this lovely hotel. Staff was very friendly and service excellent. I did find that the rooms need some updating but overall really nice. Close to shopping and all attractions. Great location for conferences and cruiseship travel as everything is right there. I have stayed here many times and will again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: legend53
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights at this hotel over Grey Cup weekend, it has spectacular views, very comfortable, upscale rooms, with great amenities. Large room, Verynice ensuite which is well appointed and great shower heads. The room has safes, robes, free local calls, and continental breakfast, newspapers. Quiet rooms, with housekeepers very efficient The front desk and services were excellent, and inquiry I had was handled promptly. Staff greet you all the time and very friendly and accommodating. Pool and hot tub outside facing harbour. Will stay here again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - noisy float planes”
Reviews.Author: Thornhillite
Reviews.Content: Beautiful (and expensive) hotel overlooking water. Our room faced the float plane dock and from early in the morning to quite late in the day float planes took off and landed very frequently. I wouldn't want to stay in such a location again. Room was well appointed - ate lunch in the lounge - nice service and menu but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: collmm
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice and clean and the hotel provided us with a cot and little travel pack for our baby which was appreciated. We were there for a xmas dinner at the five sails restaurant (fabulous views and great food). Overall the hotel was pretty good. We got a corporate rate which made the room more affordable - I wouldn't have paid much more than we did. Parking was $35 a day. The views on the other side of the hotel facing Stanley Park were much nicer than the room we had this time (we stayed in the hotel a few years ago).Other colleagues found the hotel "quite sterile". The pool is only for over 18 year olds and is outside which was disappointing for us with a baby!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LDC84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last 3 nights of our honeymoon. Its in a great location. We had booked a double room but when we arrived the size of the beds were very small which made it almost impossible to get a good nights sleep. The room was clean and comfortable but the bathroom a little dated. I would not recommend this hotel particularly.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay !”
Reviews.Author: kelleze w
Reviews.Content: Absolutely everything was great and I mean everything.There is not one single minute detail I can think of which did not measure up to the reputation which is well deserved. Staff goes out of their way to make your every whim a pleasure.Absolutely breathtaking views and a suite which rewrites the definition of comfort.Did I mention that heated swimming pool ? Nice to come "home" to after a day in heels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Luvgoodtrips
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights during Grey Cup; perfect location! Go for the harbour/mountain view (who needs a big screen TV?!). Could have parked myself in the window watching the water for the whole time. Especially loved the outdoor pool and hot tub (yes, we used it every day - even in November!). Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy bustling busy waterfront hotel. Superb views from our rooms.”
Reviews.Author: HarryIzzy
Reviews.Content: Really liked the Pan Pacific. Two nights en route to Australia. This was our 2nd visit after a gap of ten years. The place has a great feel to it. Busy with lots of bustle but a happy fun place where people are smiling. Families, couples of all ages, business folk, an interesting and unusual mix of fellow guests. Our rooms were large and well appointed with superb views over the water and a tranquil contrast to the pleasant bustle of the lobby, restaurant and bar area. Reasonable value and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Views, Comfy Rooms & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: What I LOVED about this hotel: The location is fantastic. I can walk off the sea plane and practically right into the hotel which is great for an islander traveling to Vancouver. You can walk just a few blocks to practically any kind of food, gas town, and even Stanley Park isn't far. Some of the best shopping in Vancouver is 3-4 blocks away. Really can't think what might be a better location in Vancouver unless you want to be right by the hockey arena or football arena for an event (that's about 12 - 14 blocks away). We didn't even get what was considered a view room but we had some water view and a great view towards gas town and Burnaby. It was still stunning. My parents were in a different room and did have a view ... and WOW!!! Wow!!! Get a view room if you can. Even if you can't you will be awe struck by the views from the 5 sails restaurant and the lobby bar and restaurant. I can't say enough about that. Awesome even on grey days. We were there for a conference in the convention center and while you have to change elevators it's still very convenient as it's connected to the convention center. I didn't love the convention space but that's for a different review. The rooms are spacious and comfortable in every way. The layout is very smart and ensures you don't hear much noise from the hallway - which is so important for a light sleeper like me! The gym was smaller but had a window looking out onto the water which is so nice ... when I was there a sports team was using the gym at the same time as me and it was a little crowded (although you can't complain about 7 or 8 pro athletes training around you!! haha!!). It was hard to find floor space to do any stretching or push ups. But they have all the equipment anyone can need. I would suggest bringing a water bottle because they just have these little cone cups which are a pain for big water drinkers like me! What I didn't love about this hotel: Unfortunately I was going to fly but ended up driving and parking was $30/day and the parking lot is a frigging nightmare!!! It's massive. Make sure you stop at the front and get the concierge to take your stuff. Don't try and haul it all in from the parking lot because you'll probably end up parking 1/2 a mile from the door like we did and trolleys aren't allowed down there so we had to make 2 trips. YUCK. Better yet - get valet parking so you never have to experience the parking lot. And Sunday brunch was $50/person. Those are probably the only two complaints I had about this place - that and the staff at the restaurant at the lobby level were SOOOOO slow and not at all interested in helping you. We ate their 3 times and they were consistently bad at service and attentiveness. The only staff in the hotel that seemed to care less. Overall this is a FANTASTIC place where your comfort is taken care of and you can feed your eyes with some of the greatest views you'll find in the downtown Vancouver area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views; Great service”
Reviews.Author: RGT6416
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel 4 times per year and have never been disappointed. I try to always stay on one of their executive floors, either 22 or 23 and request a view room. Although often cloudy and damp, the views are still terrific, especially watching the seaplanes land and take off. They even provide binoculars in each room for better viewing. During the summer months this hotel is often the home for Alaska cruise passengers, so the lobby can sometimes be a bit hectic. The check in for these floors is at the concierge desk on the 23rd floor, a nice touch that gets you away from any lobby congestion. All of the concierge staff members are extremely helpful and somehow seem to know your needs without asking. The included continental breakfast is fine, especially when combined with the views of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Mother4
Reviews.Content: Awesome place, awesome food but abit expensive for room service. Loved every minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: OmTaif
Reviews.Content: We have just came from our trip for 1 week long stay in pan pacific hotel...it was a nice hotel big but the room was nothing special...we had a problem with the TV and they told us to unplug and plug in everytime u want to watch TV! we were not happy with this. It is very expensive and you have to pay for every single thing in this hotel the parking was around $35 a day and breakfast was not included....the location is nice. I will never come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal in every way”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights for a conference. The hotel is easily accessible by the airport train so why taxi it if you're not in a big hurry? Check-in is up a couple of escalators from street level but from the street level, I wasn't aware of how many floors up I needed to go; maybe I missed the sign downstairs. The check-in staff was friendly, fast and efficient. The public areas are a part of the ship terminal and some convention space, so it's a little tight because of the open atrium. Yet, the beauty of it left a good impression on me. The room was what I believe to be a standard room but actually like a mini-suite with a separate sofa and chair sitting room with TV and plenty of space to spread out. It was far from cramped quarters like most hotels. There is a mini-bar area and the only fault was that one of the overhead bar lamps was out which made it hard to see the coffee and tea maker. There was a pay snack box which I did not use. An in-room minibar was also provided but I did not partake. The bed was huge and comfortable with nice support and superior quality sheets and soft bed coverings. Also, there was a nice desk area with pay internet connection with a nice view, if distracting while working. The view from this room was towards the east and not as picturesque as probably the west view towards the more scenic side of Vancouver (in my opinion) looking across the harbor and of the peninsula hills. Still, it had a nice water view on the left side and downtown view on the right side. The bathroom was spacious with separate soaking tub and shower stall. The vanity and sink area was nice as well with adequate lighting. The bath products were nice - I want to recall that they were Pan Pacific label but can't remember for sure - but definitely not the high end brand names like other comparable-rated hotel properties. The elevators were fast and no long waits like a lot of multi-story properties I've stayed at. There a several bars and restaurants that looked very inviting and with a good selection of seafood and turf, but can't comment on taste or quality from these establishments. I did not eat in any restaurants from the regular menu; however, the conference food was of high quality and presentation, and the ballroom wait service was extremely good and quite professional in their service approach. Didn't try room service as well so no comments. The hotel was definitely up there in the upper end of the four star properties but not solid five star; still, most travelers will not be disappointed. An upper end four star property is a nice compliment as far as North American hotels are concerned. I would stay here again for the excellent and professional service, great location along the water, and the ease of accessibility from the airport. If it wasn't for the burned out light bulb that needed replacement, I might have given five circles in all categories.

Reviews.Title: “A gem on the harbor”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Vancouver at the Pan Pacific, and it was just wonderful. Most comfortable bed of our entire 2 week trip; great views of the city and harbor; and a great location for exploring Vancouver. We'd stay there again next time we're out that way!

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: EvaMagdalena
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, it was pleasant and nice, but after reading the stellar reviews I was really looking for the WOW factor. Didn't find it. I usually book my hotels on Hotwire so after it was revealed that my "mystery" hotel was the Pan Pacific at $121/night -- I was over the moon! Our room overlooked the rail yard/downtown but after we discovered that the window was leaking we were transferred to the Harbor view. Unfortunately it rained for the three full days so the view was more of a melted blah. The bed was very comfortable but the room was more on the small side. Overall, if you're getting a great deal to stay here, then definitively book it for the experience and hopefully you'll get nicer weather to appreciate the view, but I don't know if it's worth the original price. Next time I'd rather go with Sutton or the Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious...”
Reviews.Author: mkoroll
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful place to stay if you are in Vancouver....the rooms are very luxurious with great views of the city. Also, the pool and hot tub are outside with great views of Burrard Inlet. Avery enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views, location and BEDS”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: A group of us attended a conference at the Pan Pacific last week and we were all very impressed with the hotel in general, but the beds, the location and the views were all awesome. All of us had a different room on a different floor and they all had their own unique features and view. Three of us had an amazing view of the harbour and the other two had high floor city view rooms with partial harbour/water view. Our room had a couch and chair with a desk facing the window which was nice for the times when I had to work on my laptop. All the others rooms had different layouts(bathroom layouts, angled walls, desk chair placement, etc.), which seemed a little weird, but was interesting. One of the best things about the rooms were the beds. It was very nice at the end of a long day to just spread out and relax in the comfy beds and watch the big screen LCD with the lights twinkling across the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, dog friendly, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: lizwalters
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay. Room and service were good. Staff was very friendly to our dog. Whirlpool and pool were great. Lovely views. Perfect location. Five saile restaurant was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: vickycrocks
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay in this lovely hotel before taking a cruise to Alaska. Our Pacific view room was perfect and the only negative was not wanting to sleep in as the view was to stunning to miss! On a personal note, I dropped my money purse in the elevator and within seconds a member of staff had called our room to return it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed”
Reviews.Author: Yago1
Reviews.Content: When you travel as much as I do the bed is everything. The Pan has great beds and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: D H
Reviews.Content: A perfect experience all around. Gorgeous view, luxurious bedding, and great attention to details right down to the quality toilet paper!

Reviews.Title: “A Vancouver Must!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha L
Reviews.Content: The view & location of this property was absolutely stunning. I consider this hotel an icon on Vancouver's waterfront. This was my fourth time back to Vancouver and I am so thankful that I stayed at The Pan this time. I think what impressed me most though was the attention to detail that is evident in every facet of the property. From the front desk service levels, to the small details in the room - I mean even the shampoos, lotions & toilet paper were of a very high quality. My husband & I will certainly be staying here on our 5 time back!

Reviews.Title: “yes, it is lovely...”
Reviews.Author: TheSchindells
Reviews.Content: I stayed here alone one night as part of a conference. Dinner was very nice, and the room was lovely. The bed was wonderful. I really liked the bathroom amenities and extras. I have no complaints about this hotel - everything worked, everything was lovely. Check-in and check-out was warm and friendly. Parking costs a second mortgage. I had dinner in a smaller restaurant in the hotel, near the lounge - a lovely meal, warm and friendly service. We normally choose smaller boutique hotels, but it was a pleasure to have an opportunity to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: NickChick
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for a perfect vacation! View from any angle at this hotel is breathtaking. Can't say enough how wonderful this location is!

Reviews.Title: “missing the small details”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel33_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this beautiful hotel. The hotel is situated at the Cruise Terminal. It has magnificent views of Stanley Park and the Harbour. You can't ask for a nicer location when visiting Vancouver City. The only things that I can say were missing were the small details. One bag of chamomile tea in the room when we arrived. I left a note and a tip for the attendant and did receive 2 bags the next day. The following day left a tip and no note and received only one bag of chamomile tea again even though it was clear we had used 2 cups and both tea bags. The only other issue was that the toilet paper was the least expensive type that I have found in any hotel. Overall the Hotel is the nicest place to be Vancouver but they just forgot the small details. Having said this however I would still go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Neat "cruise ship" ambience, 4* in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ssimmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Pan Pacific for a business engagement. It is known as the cruise ship terminal and "old" convention center (a new one just next door). When I lived in Vancouver, the bar in the lobby was the "go to" place for after-work or lunch time business drinks, and still is- great view and ambiance. The rooms are pretty vanilla-standard-as-you-would-expect - good, not exceptional 4* large hotel chain. Great choice if you are attending a convention or if a good price for downtown Vancouver site-seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: brinley82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip and I was really impressed with the overall quality of the hotel, the excellent location, the unparalleled views, and the room decor. I usually stay at the Hyatt when in town but I'm glad I decided to give this one a try, for a number of reasons: -location is less congested with less pedestrian traffic so its easier to get in and out of -there is a convenient location to an underground food court -there is a starbucks in the lobby -the restaurant has amazing views of north and west vancouver I stayed in a standard king rooom and it was spacious with floor to ceiling windows, modern decor, a nice new tv, and most importantly a CLEAN and well appointed bathroom with lots of towels, gleaming fixtures, and good water pressure in the shower. This will be my new go-to hotel for trips to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for family of 5”
Reviews.Author: iluvcoffee
Reviews.Content: My family of five, 2 adults and 3 kids stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver for 4 nights in September. We booked a Premier Corner Double which accommodates 5 people. There are not many hotels that will accommodate this number so this was definitely a draw card. After a 14 hour flight from Australia we were greeted by Black Gloves Private Transfers. We booked a Lincoln Navigator 7 seater with trailer and they also provided complimentary car seats for the 2 x 4 year olds. We had 3 carryon bags and 3 suitcases all weighing about 20 kgs each. I booked a trailer thinking that there would not be enough boot space, anyway I realised that the trailer was not necessary. We arrived at the hotel around 9am and check in was not until 4pm. We were very fortunate as they had a room ready for us! After our long flight with 3 lil kids we were extremely grateful for the early check in. The room had 2 double beds and was suppose to have a sofa bed as well but instead it came with a chaise lounge. After a call to reception they quickly delivered a single roll away bed which was very comfortable. Also, the kids all got their own bath robes for the duration of the stay. What a fabulous idea! We utilised room service for dinner for 2 of the nights and the food was plentiful. The kids really enjoyed their meals (kids meal includes a main, drink and dessert for around the $14 not including taxes) and the room was large enough to eat comfortably. We also had the buffet breakfast and the food was fresh but sometimes you had to wait for the fruit to be replenished and the waffles to be cooked. Gastown was a short 10 minutes walk away and we also went to see the Olympic torch which was a leisurely 5 minute walk away. Outside the hotel there are a number of tour bus companies that offers a hop on and off tour around Vancouver. We chose Fun City Sightseeing as this was the only company that didn’t charge for kids. Great for us $$ wise and the kids enjoyed the bus. We enjoyed staying at Pan Pacific, we never had any problems with the service and it is a great location for kids, plenty of room outside the hotel for the kids to run around and see all cruise ships. My only gripe, free Wifi should be offered to all of the hotel rooms. We went to Starbucks located just outside the hotel for the free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: plumber22
Reviews.Content: We were going on a cruise out of Vancouver. We found this hotel and were told they would take our luggage directly to the port for us, so we thought it was perfect. Well they only will take your luggage if your ship is leaving from the port right there. Well our ship the Norwegian Star was leaving out of Ballantyne port so we ended up taking 2 taxis with us to the port. It was ok but this time the taxi driver tried to get us for extra money. This happened to us in New York before we had mom and Aunt Shirley take a cab and John and I did. Mom's cab got there almost 20 minutes after us and they charged them double our cost. This time John and mom went in one and got there is like 7 minutes and myself and Aunt Shirley got there in 20 minutes and said I thought he was abusing us and he said no but when we got to the port John was furious that our driver went way out of the way to triple charge us. So I just did not give him a tip. Watch out. Anyway back to the Pan Pacific it is absoultly wonderful. We had great rooms in a corner so they connected to each other and were huge. Beautiful views of the city and in a great location. The only thing we did not like was the restaurants were way out of line in prices. But you can walk down these stairs in the hotel and go to a underground food court and get very reasonable priced items.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-par city accomodation”
Reviews.Author: BCTraveller604
Reviews.Content: Nicely decorated room, but quite small. Once your bags are there, it's hard to move around. Not much area to sit, except an uncomfortable weird chair. Bathroom was basic. Staff weren't very friendly, and certainly weren't smiling. They even asked my guest for picture ID! They didn't offer to take our bags, or assist us. They didn't tell us there was a pool, no idea until we checked out the next day. Parking was incredibly far away, at a very busy, dimly-lit parkade. At least an 8 minute walk. Mini fridge was hard to get at - in a tv built-in and at my feet. At least the bed was very comfortable with nice linens.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnificent Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: sneadNaples
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this fabulous hotel. From check-in to check out our entire experience was wonderful. My husband and I stayed at teh Pan Pacific for four night pre cruise and booked the concierge level. The nice thing about staying at this hotel is there is an elevator that takes you directly to the cruise terminal for boarding. The rooms were not large but more than adequate. Service was 5 star and the concierge floor was such a great floor to be on. There offerings were one glass of wine or drink of your choice beverage. The appetizers were wonderful as well as the buffet breakfast. The hotel is situated in such a convenient location that enabled us to walk and catch bus transportation. Vancouver is such a beautiful place with such great walking areas near the waterfront and great outdoor restaurants. A must do is the double decker bus and tour of Stanley Park, as well as Gas Town. We can't wait to return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “It Was a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Corey G
Reviews.Content: It was a great choice.....awesome view of the snow covered mountains (in July) and of the sea planes landing. Easy to walk to Gas Town and restaurants. Great pool for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: james c
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for whale watching trips though if you like it quiet during the day/early morning - don't go on the harbour side as the sea planes are alomost constant. Good fun to watch them take off and land thouygh - we didn't mind - the views more than made up for it. Nice outdoor heated pool and hot tub. Massage I had was ok but perhaps its worth paying the extra for a registered masseur. The entrance to the hotel was a little dissappointing though as you feel like you're walking into a convention centre or shopping mall rather than a 5 star hotel as you have to go up two floors to the main lobby - I guess it is a buisiness hotel really.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views!”
Reviews.Author: LVonthemove
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel on the water at the cruise ship dock. Great location and easy walk to most places in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel location for a one night stay before a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Nancy
Reviews.Content: After a short ride from the airport we arrived. The woman at the front desk was so helpful and concerned that we would enjoy our stay. The room was comfortable and overlooked the water. The best part was all we had to do was call to have our luggage brought down to the ship in the morning. It was so convenient. We woke up early in the morning to see the cruise ship arrive. I highly recommend staying here before a cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Best Views!”
Reviews.Author: suzysunshine
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pan Pacific and couldn't have been happier. The huge picture window was like a living, moving, changing work of art that we never got tired of looking at. Also, the hot tub and heated rooftop pool was a bonus and quite enjoyable in the 60-degree weather. Great location, very comfy bed, great staff and concierge...would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: tony_travel86
Reviews.Content: Lucked out on hotwire and received the pan pacific. Have stayed there some years back, but I found the hotel was great then, and even better now! Staff was friendly and like no other. They went out of you way for everything. Rooms were beyond clean, and amenities were great. The spa was great, and wasn't too over priced. Location is next to none. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “a place to stay again”
Reviews.Author: schmumues
Reviews.Content: still our favorite hotel in vancouver with a fantastic view and located close to all downtown attractions

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not great”
Reviews.Author: TessDublinIreland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed in the Pan Pacific for a week as part of our honeymoon in July. There are many positive points to this hotel. The location is excellent - right on the harbour front, beside all the tourist buses which take you to the main attractions, Gastown around the corner and many lovely restaurants and coffee shops nearby. We had a spectacular panoramic view from our harbour room. It was clean, nicely presented but the double beds were very small by any standards. You had to pay for most things, wifi, two bottles of water which were placed in the room. For the price we paid without breakfast, there could have been more extras. We ate in the restaurant in the main lobby once. The lobby feels a bit like the inside of a shopping centre with escalators coming up from the conference centre below. We might have hit the Cafe Pacifica on a bad night but the service was very poor and incredibly slow. The food itself was fine but we decided not to eat in the hotel again. All in all we had a lovely stay but I would stay here for the views and location rather than the hotel itself. It needs a bit of renovation to update the lobby, bar and restaurants. The Fairmont across from it looked more upmarket and grand but the views in the Pan Pacific are marginally better.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel just outside downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Spotted-Jaguar
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this hotel at the start of our Canadian holiday and we were not disappointed with it. A large, well-appointed bedroom with an equally impressive bathroom. Elemis toiletries in the bathroom and a set of scales. Very comfortable beds. A magnificent view over Vancouver harbour. Situated about 0.5 mile from the centre of Downtown, adjacent to a Metro station, it is very well positioned right on the waterfront.
