The Sails restaurant was excellent, again with impressive views over Vancouver harbour. The only downside? Their breakfasts are very expensive ($23 + GST for continental). Much better value can be found in the food court alongside the building and directly accessible from it.

Reviews.Title: “Port and Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Aprilp2412
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right at the cruise ship port. If you are going on a cruise it is probably a really good place to stay. The hotel is nice, but since its at the port and has the convention center there it is really busy. It has people all over the place. We were there for two nights on our honeymoon and its not really the right place for that. At night you have to take two escalators up to get in the elevators by the check in area for "security" reasons. It was silly because the people were not paying attention anyway. Also, they do not provide fee wi-fi. The hotel is located in a nice area, easy walking to Gastown.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gioia26
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! The view from our very large room was phenomenal! I could relax in the room, open all the curtains on the complete wall of floor to ceiling windows, and truly enjoy the magnificent view! The service and food were great! The restaurants in the hotel had excellent cuisine but high prices. We really enjoyed our stay. Our hotel had the cruise ship dock underneath it and was connected to the historic walkway along the shore. This was a great place to walk!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good views”
Reviews.Author: brewster69
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific hotel has an excellent location for cruise passengers leaving from Canada Place. We had a wonderful 3 night pre-cruise stay. The entrance to the hotel is somewhat confusing and upon first arrivng doesn't strike you as five star hotel. The decor in the hallways, guest rooms and bathrooms are somewhat dated and I imagine haven't been updated since the hotel opened. There is kind of an 80's sheek feeling to the hallways and the guest bathrooms, although some fixure have been updated the bathroom sink, tub, toilet and tiles are very old and dated. I would have expected better given the cost of the rooms. The soap and shampoos are wonderful. The pool facilties are great and the view from the hotel is excellent. We chose not to dine at the hotel because of the cost. We found several much less expensive options for breakfast at the food court directly accross the street and we didn't even have to walk outside. The hotel should look at thier food prices because they are out of line with the area restaurants, not just the fast food chains at the food court. Overall we liked the hotel because we had a comfortable bed with a nice view from our room. If we were placed in a different location, we might not have liked it as much. As other reviewers have mentioned this hotel is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: souzou
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks and it was a perfect base for exploring Vancouver and BC. Location is excellent; situated above the Conference Centre (must be perfect for those visiting a conference on business) and cruise ship port, a 5 minute walk from Waterfront station (for skytrain - all lines, or seabus to North Van) and less than 10 minute walk to Gastown or Robson St. The room was a city view with great views into town, a good size, very clean and with comfortable beds. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Only negatives were the cost of minibar/room service and that the pool was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient, Breath-taking Views”
Reviews.Author: Laura_in_Victoria
Reviews.Content: I came here on business for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I had a city view room --supposedly less desirable than a harbourview room, but I thought it was pretty amazing. Even the gym had a bit of a view, which was a nice treat. I used to live in Vancouver, and I have to say as a former resident that this hotel does the city proud. It's also in a location that exposes visitors to a range of Vancouver icons -mountains, ocean/ harbour and seawall, the railyards. My only complaint was that the restaurant menus seemed a bit pricey when there are so many interesting and reasonably-oriced options all within a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Thecoffeeshop85
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, nice rooms and great pool. Staff is very professional and friendly. Room service is awesome, but a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but maybe a little lacking”
Reviews.Author: R1andR2
Reviews.Content: The views are wonderful, the location great, and the assistance with the cruise ship terminal is outstanding. The rooms were clean and nice, but pretty standard. The hotel is large, well maintained and clean. I found the staff, however, not to be interested in your needs. If you went up to some one and asked a question, they were friendly and helpful. But, if they saw you struggling with your suitcase, they were happy to let you walk by. The resturants operated pretty much on the same level, and were a bit overpriced. Would I stay there again? Yes. For the value, location, view, etc., it was very nice. I just think a 5 star should be more interested in my needs, and be a little less standard in the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ewilkens
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrific. It should be #1 in trip advisor. The views from the rooms are spectacular. As a matter of fact it is hard to leave your window. One day I saw at the same time... 4 sea planes leaving, 8 row boats, and 3 ferries. The service was great. Loved the Starbucks right next door. The location is perfect for walking everywhere in the city or getting on the hop on hop off busses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kjunk5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the perfect place, you can walk pretty much anywhere. We walked to Stanley Park one day and the next went to Gastown, which is basically right around the corner. We walked everywhere! It has amazing views from the hotel restaurant and hotel bar. Loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Family Cruise Nirvana”
Reviews.Author: TGwynn19
Reviews.Content: Although we have a family home in Vancouver, we stayed here the night before our Alaskan Cruise and it was fantastic. My daughters (8 year old twins) loved the pool and the spectacular views and I must say I have to agree with them....the restaurant there served THE BEST Mac n Cheese EVER. The terrific service of having the bellman take your luggage when you check out and check it onto the cruise ship for you was wonderful and incredibly easy. If you are taking an Alaskan Cruise and particularly if you have not visited the incredible city of Vancouver before, this hotel is really convenient to many of the best things to see/do in town: The geourgeos Marine Building (and the wonderful Dim Sum in the restaurant on the bottom floor), the picturesque Sea Wall and the stunning Stanley Park and Aquarium. The rooms were great: large, clean, and with everything that you could need or want already provided for you. The service was fantastic. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver, but especially to those taking a cruise and, in particular to a family taking a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Good ~ but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: BJW84
Reviews.Content: The Pan is in the most gorgeous location in Vancouver. It is a lovely property but starting to show its age a bit (aren't we all?). It is well appointed and very clean, with lovely bathrooms (older tubs) but lovely tiles and amenities. Gorgeous bedding, but down pillows are as flat as pancakes :) There for business~ so check out is annoying as you can check out in room but then have to go to front desk for copy of the bill...not efficient. I am a fan of the Fairmont chain, but stay here when I can't get a room at Farimonts.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: sidewalk1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific in May. Very well situated right at the pier for the Cruises to Alaska and also a good location for the Land Sea Air Tours bus to Whistler. Only thing that struck me as a little odd was that the lobby is upstairs, but it really made no difference as far as efficiency etc was concerned. They also have excellent shops on the lobby level - well priced jewellery, clothing and collectibles. The bar/bistro area serves lovely lunches and has an excellent view. Be sure to visit the Bill Reid Gallery (Canada's premier native artist/carver/ designer) the variety and quality of his work is exceptional. Take in the Vancouver Symphony Orchestra who perform at the Orpheum as well as The Chan Centre. Both buildings very interesting and a world class orchestra.

Reviews.Title: “Great View Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: PhilipGreenwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan Pacific August 2011. I was working late and did not feel like making the trek home to the suburbs that evening. I did not have a reservation. I went to the beautiful lobby to the check in. When they saw my ID I received a locals rate (ID required!) without even asking. They treated me very well and found a room for me. I have to admit this was probably no small task as it is right in the middle of cruise ship season. However they were able to accommodate me. I had a basic room with a basic view. I called down to see what else they had. For $50 more I was upgraded to a fantastic and I mean fantastic room with a view of the North Shore Mountains. Even as a local I am impressed with the stunning view. It is well worth extra dollars to get a harbour view. The move was seamless. I did not have any toiletries with me so I went down to the gift shop and was not gouged for toothpaste and a toothbrush and some deodorant. Seemed like good pricing for downtown. The bed was extremely comfortable. When I woke up the next morning I had the sun rising over the mountains and two cruise ships docking to the pier on the hotel. It was almost surreal. One was a beautiful Disney Cruise Ship and the other a very elegant Royal Carribbean. I did not want to get up and go to work! I could have lived there. Unfortunately that view in a condo would be $2,000,000. So the one night experience was worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great view, Too bad about the weather...”
Reviews.Author: Frireland2010
Reviews.Content: What cruise ship? Why had a harbourside room that had an incredible view. I thought cruise ships might cause a ruckus in the early morning hours, but we never heard a thing. In fact, my daughter and I enjoyed watching all the work that goes on while docked. The room was very clean and quiet and as expected. We found the staff very courteous and helpful with everything from ferry information to restaurant tips. The only downside was Vancouver was still fighting off its worst winter/spring in decades so we only used the outdoor pool once. We did walk to rent bikes and go for a spin around Stanley Park and there's a lot more within walking distance. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible service!”
Reviews.Author: dreambigVictoriaBc
Reviews.Content: Everytime I stay at the Pan Pacific in Vancouver, I am amazed at the incredible service. The hotel staff and front desk especially go out of their way to make my stay the best one ever. If something isnt right, then there is always an extra they offer to make up for it. I cant say enough good things about this hotel and really appreciate all the lovely people who work there and truly serve the community of guests that come to visit. Thanks Pan Pacific - you are top of the line!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CrownRidgeBB
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely three night stay prior to our Alaskan cruise. The room was spacious, the amenities lovely, and the location perfect. We were able to walk to restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. Public transportation was easily accessible. Reserved the room through Hotwire, so the price was right too!

Reviews.Title: “Its modern, its on the waterfront, its 5*,”
Reviews.Author: The-Clitheroe-Kid
Reviews.Content: All the mod cons you would expect from a 5* or similar, nothing overfriendly or personal, its a hotel like any other in a big modern city. I used it because it was next to the cruise terminal and in the center of town and would recommend it to anyone who likes this type of sterile modern hotel. We had a very nice room and could watch the sea planes and boats in the harbour. I have no complaints but would prefer boutique hotels with character. I was dissappointed that after spending a few nights here prior to the cruise and checking out, that on passing back through for a few hours on my return a few days later that their customer service had now really ceased. I could not even purchase a day pass for some form of access to the pool area that I had used freely as resident to await my flight home. Although I understand resident-non resident, a smaller hotel group would have understood better what customer service was all about. Hence I would now not use Pan Pacific Hotel wordwide in my future travels. How strange that such small things can have an effect, was I really asking for that much, perhaps I was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: feibeesi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night. Location is right at the harbourfront next to the convention centre. The hotel actually sits on top of Canada Place where cruise ships bound for Alaska docks. I had a room facing the mountains of West Vancouver with a view of Stanley Park...........absolutely stunning! Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: thyme4travel
Reviews.Content: The warm hospitality and helpfulness of the valet and desk staff was exceptional. I could have just sat all day and looked out the windows at the amazing and glorious views. The romance package was very nice for our 40th anniversary; our room was nicely appointed with lovely bedding. Great buffet breakfast! Super location. Very clean. For the price, I would have expected our room to be a little bigger, but the incredible view made up for it. The swimming pool was a plus. We'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: FloridaorVermont
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning on a wonderful Holland America cruise ship.... stood in a long line for customs and then walked a very short distance to the hotel. A nice bellman took our luggage and we went upstairs to check in.. Very quick and easy but couldn't get into the room until noon so we purchased 2-day tickets on the Vancouver trolley. Take both - the red line and the blue line to get a 2 hr tour of the city streets, Stanley park, the market place and more. we got back to the hotel in the afternoon and found our room with the luggage already in it. Good news that all 4 bags found us. The room was a large king room on the 15th floor facing the city - great views and an exceptionally clean and well equipped room. it was worth the price. Never ate at the Hotel.. too many other interesting places to eat in town - but we did have drinks at the lounge and watched the sun come down over the water... what a view. plenty of cheap places to eat across the street in the underground mall if thats what you like. We took in the Steam works Brewing Company - good beer and food, and the Lions Den Bar (slow service and expensive food). Great place to stay while in Vancouver . we hope to be there again. took a $30 taxi to the airport (30 Minutes) which seems to be the easiest way to get there if you have luggage.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline76
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice.....both times in conjunction with taking a cruise. Very clean hotel, great location as it sits on top of the cruise port. Close to shops restaurants and coffee bars. Great water views. Restaurant is very good, very pricy but everything in Vancouver is. It was worth the money. Try to get a higher floor for great water views. They have a small shopping area in the hotel but I found better deals in town. Rent a bike for the day and explore the national park and aquarium. Homeless, or street people, as our doorman called them, come out right before dark and tend to sit by shops in the downtown area but we never felt unsafe at all.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: barbara l
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice, the staff helpful we stayed 3 nights left the luggage there and came back to get it for the cruise and they were very efficient the location is excellent specially if you' re going on a cruise overall we really liked it

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Gorgeous Views!”
Reviews.Author: LConwell
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights before our Disney Cruise to Alaska. The hotel itself is beautiful and a little glamorous. Our room had a huge window that showed our view of the water and the mountains...fabulous! We would watch the sea planes taking off and landing right outside our window. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but it was very pricey. However, they had an underground tunnel that took you right to a food court, where there were many affordable options for all of us, including a Starbucks! The staff were very courteous and helpful. I would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Oceansmith
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful. Nothing at all to complain about. Breathtaking lobby. Very nice rooms with view of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “We had such a romantic and relaxed stay before catching our ship for the Inside Passage Trip.”
Reviews.Author: evaporatorz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and friendly city, wonderful hotel with friendly and helpful staff, the perfect location for those who want to be at the hub of inexpensive public transportation and beautiful views. This hotel is also located at the dock where the cruise ships dock so, the hotel staff will gather your bags and deliver them to the ship for you! Use your AAA membership for a better discount on your stay at the hotel. Also, make sure you visit Stanley Park, a great way to see all the park is to rent a bicycle from Spokes, a few blocks from the park... Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Perry59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver for 3 nights prior to a cruise to Alaska. The cheapest way of getting from the airport to the hotel is to get the train (the Canada line) from within the terminal building to Canada Place which I think is the end of the line. The Fare is 2.50 Canadian for an adult, or 1.75 for a senior. Canada Place is just around the corner from the hotel. (turn right at the front entrance of the station, follow the footpath as it swings to the right and the cruise terminal is in sight.The hotel is right there.) The hotel can be booked through Booking.com for good discount prices. Our room on the 18th floor was very large with a great view of cruise ship terminal and the harbour. The room was spacious with very good facilities. Outside the hotel a number of city tours start there, across the road is a shopping complex with a food court, accessible from a door inside the hotel. A lift in the hotel took us right down to the basement which was the entry point to the cruise check-in area. Another feature of the hotel was the outdoor swimming pool on the 8th floor. Also there was a very large and hot Jacuzzi which was open until late and which we enjoyed after touring around the city. For anyone going on a cruise from Vancouver I would strongly recommend staying at the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Gateway to Alaska”
Reviews.Author: circe64
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Pan Pacific hotel prior to departing on an Alaskan cruise. It is located direclty on Canada Place which is the most convenient location as the terminal from which the ships depart is there. The hotel has an elevator which takes you right to the pier. We reserved a standard room, but it was on one of the higher floors, had ample space, and was beautifully appointed. It was certainly of a higher quality than the usual standard room. The linens are luxurious as are the feather pillows. Wonderfully fluff y towels and plenty of them. My only disappointment was the robes that were provided. They were polyester, and I expected them to be cotton. The hotel has a restaurant with outdoor seating which looks directly on the water, and they provide lap blankets if it gets chilly. This is a great place to stay if you want to be close to the water or if you are departing on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for cruise ship boarding!”
Reviews.Author: MarilynJean
Reviews.Content: The room and view were lovely. The restaurants in the hotel were pricey but there are a wide variety of food choices from food court (below the hotel) to restaurants in the surrounding area. There's also a Starbucks in the food court and one just next to the hotel, both of which take the Gold Card. We made the trip to Granville Island for shopping and looking and it only took a few minutes taking the bus ($2.50 CD exact change) just a short walk from the hotel. I'd give the hotel 5 stars if they had free wifi, but they don't - anywhere. Luckily, Starbucks is a WiFi Hotspot. Nice offering was the selling of postage stamps in the gift shop where postcards can be bought, stamped, and mailed. It was wonderful being able to just drop down the elevator onto the platform where the cruise ship boarding took place. Airport transportation is provided for a fee by Black Gloves Transportation.

Reviews.Title: “You ONLY get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Oakvillites
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for 4 nights Sept 1-4. We booked on hotwire so paid about $150 per night per room. We had a pretty good idea that we would get this hotel so checked it out well before booking. However, we did not know some things: 1). If you book through hotwire, you will never get harbor view, only city view (we knew this) but also you will never get a king bed, only 2 doubles (did not know that) 2) parking is $35/day - yikes! 3) Internet is extra and outrageously priced If you are taking a cruise (we were not), this hotel is directly connected to the cruise terminal so is very convenient. However, compared to other 5 star hotels like either Fairmont hotel or the Four Seasons, service was below average. If I had paid regular price for the rooms, I would have been much more disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Was I the only one hearing the Sea Planes and Cruise Ships Noise?”
Reviews.Author: toohip2cool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights. Yes - the Hotel is beautiful and the view from the Harbour View Room was spectacular...however the noise emanating from the sea planes that start flying early in the morning (all day) and the cruise ships really made our stay miserable. Besides the blast of the ships' horns (sometimes up to seven times in a row - at 6:00 a.m. !) we could hear the bells that ring inside the ships (yes we could hear them) and the announcements that were made every 15 minutes directing passengers to disembark. Maybe there is a quieter side to this Hotel - I don't see how - but maybe...as the reviews are great. For the money we spend - I don't think it was worth it. Service was ok - staff a bit aloof - but we stayed here on the back end of our cruise so that may have skewed my opinion on the service. We stayed here thinking that after a long cruise, this would be the perfect place as we could walk from the terminal to the hotel and we wanted to pamper ourself a bit before heading home - wow - what a mistake. I don't think the Fairmont across the street fares much better. Splurge on a cab - stay towards the center of the city - the views in Vancouver are spectacular where ever you stay - if you book a room high enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: robsmom
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had two separate stays of 2 and 3 day. Great views of the harbor from our second room. Neither room was cheap, but the extra cost for the view was really worth it. Excellent breakfast buffet. The best eggs Benedict I have ever had. Hard to do that on a buffet. The location is perfect for picking up any tours and for just seeing the city.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT view !”
Reviews.Author: Mytmoss
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 very fun days in Vancouver and I stayed at the Pan Pacific mainly for the view. What I found out that I loved was its proximity to many fun activities. I stayed one one of the concierge floors, 23rd floor. I had a city view which was magnificent. I would have preferred a harbor view, but it would have been another $40 per day. Included with the concierge floor was breakfast which included most items, but you will not be getting bacon and eggs. Small little bagels and lox and hard boiled eggs were great along with an assortment of many other good tasting food. Also included was one alcoholic beverage between 5 PM and 7PM. There was a nice selection of choices including wine, beer, hard drinks and drinks like Kahlua and Baileys. You can also have soft drinks, however you were not able to take them back to your room lest you be charged for a mini bar drink. I found this rule very odd, so it goes. Having a concierge on the floor was great as you can work them them on booking your activities and they took care of everything. They could also do exchange of US dollars to Canadian dollars. The hotel had a number of restaurants and I chose one that had outside seating with a beautiful view of the harbor. The food was good, but be prepared for sticker shock on the prices. A cheeseburger and ice tea was $35 with tax and tip. After than trauma I did venture out to see what other choices I had. There were lots of restaurants nearby. Next door was a Starbucks and that was nice. I also found that there was an under street passage to a food court. While I would never consider the food court food fine dining, the prices were decent. There was a McDonalds and many other specialty food choices. Overall it was an excellent experience and I would recommend the hotel. While it seemed to be geared to professionals there on business, it was obvious that there were many people there just visiting also.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: imawinelover
Reviews.Content: Our experience was nothing but first class from the moment we pulled up. The staff were very friendly and the room was absolutely gorgeous !

Reviews.Title: “YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific before our Alaska cruise. We sprung for a harbor view room for 3 nights, and enjoyed every minute. The hotel is convenience to the cruise ships and other Vancouver activities. While expensive, it's worth it. The rooms are beautifully furnished, the service first class and the restuarants offer a wide variety of food.

Reviews.Title: “Great for overnight before the cruise”
Reviews.Author: Bob_plus_Four
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed overnight before departing on the Disney Wonder. Excellent quality Hotel literally in the same building as the cruise terminal. The bellman took our bags from the room and we next saw them in our cabin on the ship. They also let us store the bags for the day after the cruise without charge. Great location for downtown Vancouver near public transportation. Bell staff very helpful with directions, recommendations and cabs. Extensive information center across the street. Lots of sightseeing buses leave from the front door of the hotel. Comfortable, good sized room very nicely appointed. Dining in the hotel looked pricey but many restaurants are within walking distance. Views from the hotel are spectacular - water and mountains on three sides. Note: we had EXCEPTIONAL value because we took the reservation hotel-name-unknown from Hotwire for $136 a night. Even at a higher rate, this hotel would be great for someone wanting high end accommodations as convenient as possible for a cruise ship departure.

Reviews.Title: “deluxe partial sea view - more like basic view of industry”
Reviews.Author: whalemans
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find that there is a $35 dollar a night parking fee - I expected to pay but this is excessive Moved rooms as the first stunk of smoke - even though it’s a no smoking hotel. Deluxe - not at all, there is no atmosphere to this hotel, the room was very basic, the shower had no pressure and I was completely underwhelmed with the basic standard of decor. As for the partial sew view, well on opening the curtains all I saw was the freight train station, massive cranes, industry and dirty buildings! Oh sorry if I looked really hard to the left there was a strip of water – taken up by the cruise ship! I just felt robbed and I think its wrong to describe this as a partial sea deluxe room. The stay was completed by a dip in the pool , it was a nice day good weather , got to the pool at 1120am – NO SUN – some clever person built the swimming pool on the wrong side so it was windy, cold and in complete darkness in August at 1120am . When I checked out 2 days early having had enough I commented on this and the girl said the sun wasn’t high enough yet? By my guessing the pool had no sun between 10am and 4pm due to the building in the way. They also charged me twice for parking which I haven’t had back on my credit card yet 11 days on Just don’t go there , disappointing and liars about the room and costs only good thing was the bed was good

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: lynncast
Reviews.Content: This hotel absolutely did NOT disappoint! The rooms were nice, location terrific, service fantastic and the food was great too. Highly recommend staying at this hotel when you go to Vancouver!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again- great location”
Reviews.Author: unicorn123
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on business for a conference. Hotel is attached to convention center, quite convenient. Also there is a cruise ship dock on the bottom floor. Room on the 16th floor was nice enough. View of the harbor, enjoyed watching sea planes take off. 2 classes of internet offered Super high speed for $14.95 and slower speed for $4.95. I tired the expensive option first night and it was real fast. Then i went with the slower speed for two nights and it was adequate for email and browsing the NEWS on-line. Did not eat diner int eh hotel, went out each evening, also conference provide other meals- so no comments on the food. Cab was $35.00 from YVR.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting better service”
Reviews.Author: C0dyEllis
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my fiance and I for one night before she flew out the next day from Vancouver. I wanted it to be a special day so I went on Hotwire as nearly everyone I know does on last minute trips these days. I opted for the more expensive of the two choices between 4 star or 5 star hotels on hotwire, just to ensure that there would be great service and no chance of any problems. I mean 4 stars are still usually really great. Pan Pacific was the hotel we ended up with. When we got to the desk I was excited because it was very nice in the lobby and a great location. The first thing I heard was the guy beside me was offered a free upgrade to the harbour side which is an amazing view and it looked like it made his day. So I figured maybe I'd see if we could get one too. So the woman working looked us up and checked us in and pretty much gives us everything before saying "Oh by the way your room has two double beds" I'm thinking oh they'll just switch that since we're obviously a couple. Nope apparently there are no queens or kings available to us. Confused I asked why and she basically made us feel like second class customers because we booked on hotwire. Getting frustrated I assumed that she didn't have enough experience with this type of situation and a manager could help. The manager was even more condesending of our hotwire booking status and again there were only double beds available to our "type" of booking. After some discussion it became apparent that there were actually some king bed rooms but that we would have to upgrade to it for a $40 fee. Now I'm thinking why didn't I just get the 4 star room that wasn't on the water because it would have the same view for half the price and I would get to sleep beside my OWN FIANCE! After going in circles with the manager and the first girl snickering that she was right about us being lesser clients I paid the money and didn't get any upgrades and spent an hour getting back into holiday happy mindset. I was just expecting better service from a hotel like this. And if it really bugs you that people use hotwire to book your rooms DON'T PUT YOUR ROOMS ON HOTWIRE. Is this what 5 start service looks like? I was surprised. Oh free room internet isn't available to us "hotwire" folk either.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with a View!”
Reviews.Author: Steve74017
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice. We had a view of the harbor and loved watching the float planes take off and land. They can be a bit noisy early in the morning, but we got up early anyway to see the views of the mountains and take in some daily sight seeing. Very good location within easy walking distance of several excellent restaurants. Also close to the bus route so you can get around without renting a car. Very cheap bus rates. We took the bus out to the college to see the First Nation Museum which was fantasitic. Round trip was only $4 each. We were there during the anniversary of the Olympics so we got to see the celebrations and the lighting of the Olympic torch. What a treat. We would highlyi recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: LovestoTravel919
Reviews.Content: This was a very beautiful hotel in a superb location with gorgeous views. Walking distance to most sites. It is connected to the cruise port so a lot of cruisers obviously stay here and it is a huge property but that did not deter from it's charm. The staff was friendly enough but a little reserved as it seems they usually are in most high end hotels. Restaurants on site and many more nearby. The room was large, clean and comfortable but the view was the highlight. We enjoyed sitting by the window on the harbour with the hills across the way and the mountains in the background and watching the seaplanes come and go. We loved this hotel and the beautiful city of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Harbor View v. City View”
Reviews.Author: Godzilladude
Reviews.Content: For the wife's milestone birthday, she had said she wanted to see Vancouver. So I quietly arranged a trip. After pricing everything out separately, I checked Travelocity, and had several options for three nights of hotel, effectively for free! I finally decided to spend the money, and go for Pan Pacific, as I really wanted a room with a view. I ended up paying only about $100 a night for a Harbor View Room, normally more like $400/nt. I really himmed and hawed about whether to get a "Harbor View" room, or, a "City View" room and hope for an free upgrade, as is often mentioned here. As I was prepaying, I figured I better hedge upward and got the Harbor View, whatever that meant. And that turned out to be the correct choice, as no upgrade. Maybe because of a Travelocity pre-purchase, maybe just no rooms available, I dunno. What they don't make clear on the website, is what "City View" and "Harbor View" actually mean. After all the hotel is a wedge out on a pier, all the rooms are 8th floor or above, and you can see harbor and city from pretty much all the rooms. The difference is, I found out, the Harbor View rooms are on the west side, the City View rooms are on the east side. The ones facing west get to see the pretty Coal Harbor area, the Yacht Club, Stanley Park is only a mile or so away staring right back atcha, high rises condos and hotels all lit up in town, Capilano Bridge in the distance all lit up at night, and lots of water, with mountains in the distance. The view is just spectacular! The rooms that face east, "City View", you can still see the bay and lots of mountains in the distance, but you're looking down on the container docks, the rail yard, the SeaBus dock, and fewer high-rises in the city. So, Harbor View if you can afford it. The view from our room, out two 6'X6' windows, was just wonderful, by far the nicest view I have EVER had at a hotel room. All the staff we met were very helpful and friendly. I actually stumped the Conceirge with a basic question about mass transit, which was a bit surprising. They do have a summary sheet with bus directions to most of the major tourist attractions, something one might want to call ahead for when making plans. The deck on the harbor side of the lobby is just great as well, never crowded, several stories up. and had most of it to ourselves most of the time, to just sit back and watch the world go by. The LOCATION of the Pan Pacific is also wonderful if you are planning on sightseeing without a car. The Canada Line train runs direct from the airport to Canada Place, only a block or two to walk to get to the hotel, not five minutes. Most all the public buses and shuttle buses you might want to catch are within a block or two. And the SeaBus to go over to North Vancouver is right there. Walk out the hotel and right onto the Sea Wall for a beautiful walk over towards Coal Harbor and Stanley Park. Almost every other hotel is town is blocks from the waterfront. NONE can match the views of being high up, out on the pier. The bed was excellent, and I'm picky. There is an underground shopping area connected directly to the hotel (and many other hotels, no doubt), that includes a decent inexpensive food court, with McDonalds, Tim Hortons, some Chinese, fresh fruit and bagels, pizza, etc. Downsides, not much. They nickel and dime on Internet WiFi access ($2/hr, $6/day), which is just silly nowadays. Ditto for water in the room. I won't pay $37 for a basic breakfast buffet. And they don't have their own shuttle to go anywhere. So, walk a block or two and wait five minutes for the bus, on occasion. Still, the best mass transit access in the city, I would wager, being so close to Canada Place. Absolutely, positively, we will stay here next time we are up that way. And we will be back, what a great city. My reviews of restaurants and attractions are also getting posted, if you want to see any details of those.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and awesome views!”
Reviews.Author: JAG710
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime location to walk to any district. It's more on the corporate side of things in its looks and functionality, but overall a good hotel. The views cannot be beat as it overlooks the Vancouver Harbor where the sea planes take off and land throughout the day. Plus you get the full mountain view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lamarinapete
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in 5 hotels in Canada and this was amongst the best. We ate in the 5 Sails restaurant it is not cheap but an unforgettable experience. Just one negative comment this was the only hotel we stayed at that did not give free wireless Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Ray C
Reviews.Content: This is truly the best hotel in all of Vancouver. The views were incredible, the service was fantastic, the accessibility to various modes of transportation was the best, and the restaurant had exceptionally good food. We plan to return some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: baygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-Alaska cruise. After a long day of travel, this was a wonderful respite. The soaring lobby and dining areas give a gorgeous view of cruise ships and Vancouver harbor. Our room was sooo comfortable that we hated to leave. But, then, transferring to the cruise ship was so easy. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: CETacLady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip and loved it! Can't say enough nice things about the experience, the check in was easy, the room was immaculate, the facilities were top notch. It was a 5-star price, so you are getting what you pay for, but everything was great. The bed, the amenities, the high end snacks in the mini bar, haha. The rooftop swimming pool and the locker room was also really nice, with showers and a dry sauna in the womens locker room (I'm assuming there was one in the mens locker room too). We went swimming and watched the float planes take off down below, which was really neat. Concierge made great recommendations within walking distance for breakfast and dinner. We did not eat in the hotel, so I can't comment on the restaurants, but the hotel was great!! Highly recommend if you are looking to stay in this price range! Like all hotels in this price range, everything costs - parking, wifi, snacks, everything is an added charge, so be sure you're up for that!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting and everything was top notch!”
Reviews.Author: disney_fam_10
Reviews.Content: Was able to get a beautiful King Suite on Travelocity at a very economical rate!! Loved the room and the view. The Hotel is lovely and located directly above Canada Place. All we had to do was get on an elevator and head to our cruise. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: budgiecapetown
Reviews.Content: The food in the hotel seemed pricy so we did not eat there except for one breakfast. However, if you are going on a cruise, you could hardly choose a better hotel as the elevator goes down to the cruise terminal. We just called the bellboy for our luggage and the next time we saw it was in our cabin on the ship. We just walked to the floatplane terminal for our trip to Victoria. All the tours seemed to start from here (or just across the road) and we could walk to the restaurants on Robson street. You are also right next to the tourist centre where you can book numerous tours (e.g. train to Whistler). There is also entrance to the more informal "underground" diners. (Starbucks etc.). The huge outdoor TV screen attracts sports fans, especially for the ice hockey play-offs, so it's central, convenient and trendy. Location, location, location is the keyword for this hotel. Rooms were satisfactory (with great views) although the interleading doors were a problem when next room occupants decided to put on their tv and talk very loudly at 3am. (One night only) .However, service was excellent. The Skytrain from the airport was nearby. Overall, we are very glad that we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary Stay...”
Reviews.Author: scratchcat
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Pan Pacific Hotel in Vancouver - check out my blog post on their site....http://roomwithaviewblog.com/

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMJLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good location to visit Vancouver. Within close walking distance to Gastown. Room was clean and quiet. My kids enjoyed the "roof top" hotel swimming pool and the view was awesome. The fitness center was equally impressive. For snacking, there was a underground food court a block away. Parking was a bit expensive. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Outkast96
Reviews.Content: Nice newer hotel a few blocks from gas town on the water front. Hotel has a beautiful view of the water front and sea planes. Great access to dinning and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the localion and view”
Reviews.Author: turaguides
Reviews.Content: Ideal location with expansive views of the cruise ships and harbour. Handy for Gastown and a bike ride around Stanley Park. Pool is open most hours which is great if you get in late and need to let off steam. Nice place for morning jog or walk around the marina. Food hall accross the road.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: bguilbo
Reviews.Content: Clean, updated rooms with awesome views, comfy beds and great staff make the Pan Pacific Vancouver a great place to come back to year after year. Fantastic (albeit pricey) breakfast buffet and a location that can't be beat certainly place this hotel amongst the best in the country.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but there are better places which are cheaper”
Reviews.Author: Starkraving
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night and didn't make full use of the facilities, but here is my experience: Not too impressed with the service. We arrived carrying heavy suitcases but nobody at the door acknowledged us or offered help. Lugged the cases up two escalators to reception. The room was okay, but no better than a 3 star and was pretty bland. Had a view of a flat roof with quite a lot of weeds, but could see some of Gas Town and North Vancouver. On checkout, nobody helped with the bags or bid us farewell, apart from the receptionist. Glad i was only staying a night. Club Intrawest and the Westin Grand are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Tastic”
Reviews.Author: Satisfied49
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver for 3 nights in early July 2011. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out our stay was great. The very friendly Irish lass at the check in counter was gracious enough to upgrade us to a harbour view room on the 17th floor and we had an amazing view of the harbour, mountains and Stanley Park. My son thought it was pretty cool that the cruise ships docked right next to our hotel and we even took a walk alongside one to check it out. The beds were super comfortable and the room was very clean and a decent size. The hotel is in a pretty good location near gastown and Robson street. There's a great food court right across the street and a starbucks attached to the hotel. Excellent hotel all around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kpcdk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after our cruise. This hotel was lovely and an easy walk from the ship to the check-in desk. We left our bags with the bell captain and they were delivered to our room when it was available, shortly after lunch. We walked everywhere, be sure to visit Stanley Park. The pool was on the small side with very little seating area, but the view is great. Very easy walk to the sky train to the airport-ask the bellman to point you in the right direction. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: bobsmum123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as the start to our Canadian Rockies trip for our silver wedding anniversary.We arrived dishevelled and tired after a very long flight to be met at reception by a very helpful staff member who made checking in so easy.Because we're Brits we needed a cup of tea straight away but no kettle when we got to the room,within minutes of asking one was bought up with extra teabags.The hotel is stunning so elegant and peaceful considering how large it is.The service is fantastic,very friendly and nothing is to much trouble.Buffet breakfast was brilliant and the views from the breakfast room and patio mean you hang out breakfast as long as possible!,which again is no problem for the staff they make no attempt to get you to hurry up.The room was lovely with a huge bed.It was a fantastic start to what was a great trip.I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful waterfront hotel right in the city”
Reviews.Author: earlyearlytravel
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a city view room but when we checked in we were asked if we would like to upgrade to a waterfront room. We did and were so glad because we had spectacular waterfront views of the bay with boats sailing by and also the mountains beyond. We even saw our cruise ship leave from the dock on its next voyage. And since we were there July 1st, Canada Day, we even enjoyed the fireworks right from the comfort of our room. The room was immaculate and spacious. The king size bed was very comfortable and the linens were luxurious. The bathroom was good sized with all the amenities and also immaculate. All the staff including check-in, concierge, housekeeping and security were friendly, efficient and very helpful. We enjoyed afternoon cocktails on their outdoor patio which also overlooks the bay and we had an excellent dinner at their Five Sails Restaurant. Our dining experience that night was one of the best we had throughout our two week vacation. We came to the Pan Pacific direcly from our Alaskan cruise and it could not have been any easier to get there. It is located in Canada Place which is the pier where the ship docks. Once you pick up your luggage from the ship, you go out the door, across the walkway and into the hotel. I would recommend this hotel for just that alone but am happy to recommend it for all the above mentioned reasons too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Calgarians
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver hotel for 5 nights and it was just lovely. The staff and the room were fantastic! I do recommend this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mommyoftwo25
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the hotel for one night. We flew in the day before for our Disney Alaskian Cruise. Check in process was great and room was nice and clean. The biggest pro of the hotel in the location. It is connected to this fantastic pier that I believe was built and/or remodeled for the WInter Olympics a few years ago. You imbark on the Disney Wonder at Canada Pier which is literally accessed via the elevator in the hotel. You take the elevator down to the garage level and walk less than 50 feet to the door to get to the cruise check-in terminal. Could not have been easier which was key with two small children (ages 4 and 7) and four giant pieces of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but they ding you for all the extras.”
Reviews.Author: galianoboy
Reviews.Content: This was my third or fourth stay here on business. This time I stayed a week. The hotel is generally wonderful, with stellar views of Vancouver. The rooms are expensive, which is understandable. What I object to is the highway robbery for basic extras. High-speed internet (wireless or dsl) is $20 a day. Breakfast is $28 per person. Bottled water in the room is $5. It all just seems a bit chintzy when you're already dropping hundreds of dollars per night for the room. But if you're okay with all of that, I recommend this hotel. Stunning views, big, clean rooms, comfortable beds, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Best view of Vancouver is from Pan Pacific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Pan Pacific Vancouver for three nights. We were surprised to be checked in at 10:30 a.m., and we were fortunate to be put into room 1834, a corner room with a remarkable view. There were sailboats and yachts. We watched seaplanes land and take off right below us, ferries glide back and forth on their routes, and cruise ships appear when we woke up and majestically sail away in the late afternoon. Location Super-central. We took the SkyTrain from the airport (a credit card works in the ticket machines, and there is lots of space for suitcases) to Waterfront station and wheeled our suitcases to the hotel. We understand that construction of Canada Place, including the Pan Pacific Hotel and East convention center was built on the Canadian Pacific Railroad Pier site using Japanese money at a time when the city was short of cash. Now it is the center of activity for conferences, cruise ships, and a wonderful hotel. The hotel is within a short walk of Gastown and downtown. On the advice of the concierge, we caught a #50 bus to the shops on Granville Island, but we found the merchandise and prices to be better in nearby Gastown. It is a short walk to the seaplane terminal where a short Harbour Air tour of the nearby mountains and valleys is a good value if it is a clear day. Room Our room was large, clean, and well appointed with coffee maker, refrigerator, and huge flat screen TV with many channels. The curtains blocked out the morning light, although it was a temptation to leave them open at night because the view was so inspiring. The Pan Pacific Hotel is designed to look like the superstructure of a huge ship. The large windows looked like ship's windows, rounded at the corners. Rooms ending in "34" had the best view in the hotel with the “living roof” of the West Convention Center, Coal Harbour, Stanley Park and Lion’s Gate bridge on the left and the bare edge of the container terminal on the extreme right (see photo taken from seaplane). The snow-capped mountains of the northern range extended through each of the windows with the buildings of North Vancouver lining the shore. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and there was a sofa. I counted eleven wall plugs (including two in the bathroom) that were not being used. Restaurants Every superb hotel needs a superb restaurant. Five Sails was superb. We recommend the Austrian ravioli and their ice wines. The other two restaurants, the Cascades Lounge and the Cafe Pacific use the same basic menu--we had wild salmon at the former and spinach infused curry chicken at the latter, and we could not recommend either one. We would rather go to the food court under the Fairmont hotel. Don’t miss Five Sails for the view and the food, though (see photo). Quiet enjoyment Usually we do not want a connecting door but we had one in room 1834, and it was never a noise problem. The only commotion was the sound of a party two floors below on a narrow terrace. The occasional sound of neighbors on both sides was not distracting or irritating. Internet Thank goodness we were GHA Discovery members. On check-out, our bill was three pages long until the cashier took off the Internet charges (free to members) and reduced the bill to a half a page. Both wi-fi and LAN were reliable and fast and available all over the hotel, which was convenient for use of smart phones. Services All of the staff were capable and friendly and helpful. The concierge is super-busy, but it is well staffed by one or two people, and staff are helpful and friendly when you get to see them. Doormen did not force themselves on us. Lifts were quiet and fast. The shops in the hotel had a good selection of merchandise for sale. We had the idea they were catering to passengers on cruise ships who had little time to shop. They provide great ball point pens in the rooms and at the reception desk. For comfort and service, the Pan Pacific Vancouver was absolutely outstanding. We cannot imagine a better all-round hotel value in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! The view is worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: drox
Reviews.Content: In July 2011, I stayed here for an ASEE Convention.First, the drawbacks: 1. The hotel was very expensive, and 2) the Internet could cost nearly $20/day. Positives: The Pan Pacific is breathtaking. I would splurge to stay here! The cruise ships dock daily. A 5000 person cruise ship parallel parking is a sight to see! The room was relaxing and so quiet that I had no sleep issues. The conference center is very close and there is glass walkway that goes by the ships on the lower level. I had pancakes and coffee for $25. Yes, they were the most expensive pancakes I have ever eaten. But they were awesome 5-star pancakes! Vancouver BC was a neat place that should be on every one's Bucket List!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Perfect Location if you are taking a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Daisyss
Reviews.Content: We (family of three) stayed three nights in an amazing one bedroom suite over looking the harbour. We watched the float planes and ships from our window. and enjoyed superb food in the restaurants. The price for this extravagance was ugh, but reasonable for what we got. Aprox 550 a night. The key is to pay in advance -non refundable and you get a discount. This is truly a five star hotel. We left on a cruise after three nights and never had to leave the building. You are RIGHT there. It was wonderful, really wonderful. When something went wrong with a airport pick up, the sub contractor limo company fixed it right away AND did not charge us AND gave us a city tour.

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for holiday couples”
Reviews.Author: JohnM8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in May /June 2011. The following is my review in simple terms: Travelling in from the airport is easy. Board the Canada Line and get off at Canada Place. The hotel is 8 minutes walk with caes. Ask for directions. Location: great...most places an easy walk. Hotel: not for leisure people as you will be driven crazy by the hordes of people attending conferences. The conference centre is partly in the hotel and adjacent to it. Restaurants: poor. Bar similar Staff: very good and attentive Rooms: nice, but dowdy and creamy. dreary. Poor views unless you get the bay side. Most will be offered roomns overlooking a railway yard. Breakfast: go to ma & pa places within minutes walk away Cost: high My opinion: avoid.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for cruise ships, otherwise avoid”
Reviews.Author: HarrisFamilythree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in July on a month long trip to Canada and the Westin Bayshore for another 2 nights the week later. The Pan Pacific room was very nice but the hotel was huge, impersonal, and they were really not interested in helping us get our internet working. After about 6 phone calls we got it for about 2 hours then it went down again and was not available the rest of the evening or next day. The free buffet included in the AAA room rate was just ok. I would not return since the service experience really did not meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy to have stayed here”
Reviews.Author: Grim-SA
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the end of a 3 week vacation in Canada. The location is VERY convenient to the downtown area, Skytrain station, restaurants, Sea wall walkway and tour bus departure points. The hotel gave us a free upgrade to a harbor view room on the 21st floor with a stunning view....Very happy! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...we'd go back in a heartbeat---puppy included!”
Reviews.Author: nearnorthduo
Reviews.Content: From the time the valet took our car and delivered out luggage until the time we checked out four days later things were fantastic. All hotel staff were welcoming to the four of us and even more so to our 5-month old Golden Retriever who was treated like a king. Centrally located at Canada Place on the Vancouver waterfront we could not have expected better treatment. The hotel is close to the SkyTrain Station, the Sea Wall bike/walking trail that leads up to Stanley Park and many of the Vancouver neighbourhoods that one might choose to visit. Super clean rooms (we are sticklers for the clean) in a well cared for and kept hotel. Worth staying at if one needs a place for a vacation or a business stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and views that are to die for!”
Reviews.Author: Melibi
Reviews.Content: Our room was a harbour view on the club floor. The view was amazing and the club floor staff were very efficient. The breakfast offered was good and the evening appetizers were also tasty. They allow club floor guests one alcoholic beverage per day. The room itself was decorated nicely but nothing outstanding. The views made up for the standard decor. The location was within easy walking distance to many attractions and excellent shopping. The hotel offers an incredible spa and salon, excellent fitness centre and salt water pool. There are numerous restaurants and lounges as well as a Starbucks on site. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: DominicParamore
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel experience I have ever had -- disgusted at the service I received and when I tried to address my concerns with management I was brushed off completely. I even tried to talk with the GM about the service, but my call were left unanswered. Cannot believe a service company like this even exists -- shame on them.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: ssigman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific before embarking on a cruise. I had read many of the reviews and arrived with some trepedation. I have to say we were all very pleased. The room was much larger than a typical hotel room, beds were heaven, and everything was in pristine order. Many prior travels expressed concern about service - ours was perfect. From bellman and check in to room service everyone was great. We were only there one night but I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming in for a cruise. The tip that one person wrote about having the bellman take the bags directly to the cruise in the morning was pricless.

Reviews.Title: “Great for cruises!!!”
Reviews.Author: hiviolet007
Reviews.Content: This property is RIGHT ON the cruise terminal! The bell staff will even take your bags right from your room to the ship! We were in a Deluxe Harbor King (350 sq.ft.) room on the 16th floor which had a gorgeous view of the bay and the pool area. We stayed 2 nights - a Thurs. ($291.75 CAD) and a Fri. ($321.75 CAD). Yes, it's pricey!! There really is a lot to see in Vancouver! We didn't have much time and didn't rent a car or use public transport. I have heard wonderful things about the train system though. We wandered around Gastown which is just a 5 min. walk from the hotel. The harbor area is beautiful and you are right at the edge of all the city life. There is plenty of high end shopping and the Canadian dollar is really strong now. Prices are quite high. Sorry, I didn't take more pics of the room! A couple more things...The float planes start running fairly early and they are pretty loud. I sleep with earplugs and I heard them. Had to pay for internet which always irks me!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, very convenient for cruising”
Reviews.Author: shutterbug285
Reviews.Content: They took care of all the luggage and even brought it down to the cruise terminal for us. I had a laptop they stored for me while we took A tour of the city before boarding the cruiseship

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: bergerman
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the late review. My wife and I stayed at this hotel in April for 4 days and had a absolutly wounderful time. We were there to visit our son. Its the perfect location, right in the downtown core and close to pretty much everything downtown. We had booked this trip through TravelZoo so room was supposed to be pre-selected. When we arrived and were given our room on the 18th floor we immediatly noticed a odor. Smelled like wet carpet or simlar. We decided to put on air conditioner and leave it to see if it would go away. We after about 3 hours seemed to be worse so we went to front desk. They were very helpful. First gave us a room on 8th floor near the pool which we rejected due to constant noise. Then offered a 21st floor room with harbor view. Well it was super. Great views of harbor and a little of downtown. We didn't eat much at the hotel except for breakfast as there are many other places within walking distance. Its a bit pricey but given where you are you expect that. The lounge at night is the perfect way to end your day. Great views of the float planes coming and going as well as the cargo ships. We had a very nice time. Staff excellent from waiters to front desk. I would certainly recommended this hotel for a weekend getaway if price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conferences and/or cruisers”
Reviews.Author: Sarasingh
Reviews.Content: Although I know it's reputation is unsurpassed, having stayed at the nearby Fairmont Pacific Rim I have to say this hotel is pretty pedestrian. The hotel is connected to the convention centre and to the cruiseship port in downtown Vancouver, so if you are traveling to do either of those, this hotel would be perfect. However, if you are staying for pleasure there are many, many, many choices that provide more value for money. This hotel is dated and huge, and it has sort of a aged feel to it, but not is a classy way. There are hundreds and hundreds and hundreds of rooms, and coupled with the escalators, the cruiseships parked nearby (visible from the restaurant), and the conference centre check-in place located in the downstairs lobby, it all amounts to feeling like you are staying in an airport.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: Nitzanm4
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel in August, 2010 for another holiday. The hotel itself is built in a very interesting way. It blends in with the harbour, while disguising the shape of a ship. The hotel is not too big, or too small. The rooms are decent in size, and they are also very clean. You can get a view of the city, or a view of the harbour. Regardless of where your room is located, there is a pool on the 8th floor that is outdoors. You can see the entire harbour and some of the city as well. I recommend this hotel, to anyone that doesn't have a really tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel before or after a cruise”
Reviews.Author: travelinherb
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2 day stay at the Pan Pacific Vancouver Hotel after an Alaskan Cruise. Upon debarkation it was a short walk from the cruise area to the hotel. A bell attendant was waiting to take our luggage and we went up to the hotel registration desk. Check-in was quick and our room was available early. The room was very large with a beautiful view of the city. We did not opt for the pricier harbor view; next time we might. The location was excellent for touring Vancouver. A short walk to Gas Town and easy accessibility to mass transit and tourist buses. There was an inexpensive food court across the street which was accessible from the hotel lobby by an underground tunnel. The TI was also just across the street. This is an absolute top of the line hotel. The staff, the rooms, the lobbies, everything about the Pan Pacific Vancouver was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to end a cruise - but pricey”
Reviews.Author: StaySaneInCrazyTimes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location for for cruisers who finish their trip in Vancouver. Once you clear customs, you walk your bags across an enclosed area and you are there. Hotel staff takes your bags up to the room for you. The hotel screams luxury. Soft beds. Fine linens. Because we were traveling with our two teenagers, we opted for an upgraded room. This was a good decision because the room was spacious and the view of the harbor with the mountains as a backdrop was spectacular. But then, for $500/night, it should be spectacular. What we did not appreciate was the dearth of included amenities. We opted for the family package which included the breakfast buffet. However, one would have expected wi-fi to be included. It was not. One would have also expected a hotel shuttle. There was none. We also noticed that the line at the front desk is often very long. Perhaps some process improvement would help in this area so travel weary guests are not standing in line before being able to check in or out? Also, if you want quiet, ask for a higher floor. The pool is on the 8th floor. It is open till 10 for kids and midnight for adults. We were on 10 and the pool noise was loud.

Reviews.Title: “They hold money that you did not spend for 5 business days after departure”
Reviews.Author: lnp000
Reviews.Content: I checked out on Sunday and on Thursday they are still holding my money. They say $100.00 per night. Don't use a debit card. My daughter and son in law used a credit card and they couldn't get away with that. I have had hotels put a hold on a card before but it is released within 24 hours of the check out date. Not this place. I just called them and they told me they hold your money for 5 business days. Also they are holding $696.38 and my bill was $472.54 for 2 nights. Thats more than 100 dollars per night that they are holding.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best hotel I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: RecessTime
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location and a great room all made for an excellent stay. Upon arrival at the hotel I was promptly greeted by a porter who offered assistance with my luggage. I had arrived at the hotel well before the scheduled check-in time but the reception desk clerk was pleasant, friendly and accommodating. While my room was not ready she offered to call me on my cell as soon as my room was available and checked my luggage so that I could sight-see in the meantime. Within an hour or so I received a call back indicating my room was ready. I appreciated their timeliness and effort to accommodate. My room was on the 12th floor and I had opted to upgrade my room to a harbour view. Well worth it. The room was large with a great view of the harbour and exceptionally clean and well appointed with a large flat screen TV. The bed was very comfortable with good quality linens. When leaving the room I was pleasantly greeted my housekeeping personnel. It is clear that the employees take pride in this establishment. I did have dinner on the patio at this hotel and while the view was great the food and service on the patio was mediocre at best. That being said there are plenty of dining options in the area and I would most definitely return to this hotel when I'm in town next.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a City rife with the homeless”
Reviews.Author: JonAmerilaw
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days here and the hotel by far had the best views of the water and was adjacent to Gastown. Staff was wonderful. If you are staying in Vancouver this is the the hotel to be in without question. Would stay in this hotel again if only it was not in Vancouver. This city does indeed have beautiful views and side trips to Victoria to see Butchart Gardens) are worthwhile as well as doing the whale watching from Vancouver (thru Wild Whales) and seeing the Caplano Suspension Bridge and zipling at Grouse Mountain.. But be aware that this city is overrun with the homeless and the police make zero effort to move them. They are everywhere. You simply cannot walk a block with out being approached by at least 3 of them and some are not happy at all when you walk by without giving them something. We have never seen anything approaching this problem in North America and it ruined our trip. A local resident told us that other municipalities in Canada actually bus them here as the weather is more pleasant year round and that way they don't die off during the winters. The city is like a checkerboard, one street is safe and pleasant and the next one is sparsely occupied but one thing is consistent.... you will be approached by the homeless regardless of where you are and that is a real problem and makes the whole area feel unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: Julie_in_Austin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for two nights before our recent cruise. It was a perfect hotel for our needs. Our rooms were spacious, spotless and very comfortable. The concierge desk was a great resource for restaurant and local travel recommendations. It was a great location for sight seeing in Vancouver and it was thrilling to wake up and watch our ship pulling into the pier the morning of our cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, rooms ok, selective service”
Reviews.Author: Big_D_Nanaimo_BC
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a concert so just the one night. I booked the inner harbour deluxe view room. I had not stayed there since they opened for Expo 86. I luved the hotel when it opened. Two weeks before I was to check in I had to change plans and attend my fathers funeral back east. I gave my tickets and hotel to my daughters. I gave their names in advance to the front desk and asked they use my credit card (on file). When they arrived they were not treated welcome. There was confusion as to who they were and were quickly re-accommodated to a "street-city view". In addition they demanded a credit card. My daughters indicated the room was nice, but no ocean view and the service was just not there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great view. No free internet - no free parking.”
Reviews.Author: EKGK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific hotel for 4 nights, checking in on Canada Day (1st of July). The hotel is beautiful – slightly dated, but still luxurious. We stayed on the 11th floor and were upgraded to an ocean facing room. We had the best possible view you could ever get. Our rate didn’t include breakfast, but there are so many restaurants on Davey street (20 minute walk from hotel) and in Gastown that I actually preferred sampling a different restaurant every day than paying an extortionate amount to eat at the hotel. Plus if you dont want to spend a lot of money, you cant beat Tim Hortons donuts and sandwiches. The gym was perfect, with brand new equipment, treadmills, a rowing machine and plenty of swiss balls. The outdoor swimming pool and Jacuzzi were also very nice, albeit quite small and always busy. But we managed to enjoy a dip or two. The Aveda products in the barhroom were really nice and the bed was very comfy. The bathroom is huge but the shower is not that great – it’s not a power shower. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean. We loved Vancouver and the hotel’s central location helped. We went to Stanley Park, the Aquarium, English Bay, Davey Street, Robson Street, Gastown, South Main, Kitsalano, Granville Island. It helped that we have friends living in Vancouver, so we got to see quite a few places. Pan Pacific is pricey, but we found a good deal online. One downside is that there’s no free internet. Also no free parking for guests of the hotel, which made us change our plans about renting a car. The hotel is in a safe area, but walking around downtown Vancouver, you do come across lots of homeless people and drug addicts – mostly harmless, yet it’s astounding how many homeless people live on the streets. Lots of good cheap sushi restaurants all over town. Particularly the restaurants on Davey street were amazing and affordable. Very good Japanese, Greek, Italian restaurants scattered all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel; need better mattresses”
Reviews.Author: Onmessage1
Reviews.Content: I will echo all the positive comments about this hotel. We were especially pleased with the level of soundproofing. Not a peep from those around us or from outside, even with crowds. One point for improvement: the hotel needs more "heavenly beds." These were OK but really hard - more of what you would find in a European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jajagoeswell
Reviews.Content: Quiet and sparking clean rooms were given to us on the 8th floor. We booked 3 rooms for 6 adults through Hotwire. We are very happy with the room though the view may not be that great. For the price we paid, it is a deal ! Internet is about $ 15.00 and is extra.Parking is $39.50. Down at the basement, there is a food court where you find Starbucks, Subway, Mrs. Lee's bakery,McDonalds. To our surprise, Mcdonalds also takes the US dollar for payment. The hotel is walking distance to Gastown. I think it caters mainly to the cruise ship passengers.Nevertheless we would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5-star”
Reviews.Author: B_and_N_and_5_kids
Reviews.Content: We (two adults, five kids) stated in a 3-bedroom Residence Suite for 4 nights (July 2011). The suite has an odd layout - one large living room with full ktichen and dining area led to a good sized bedroom, which led to the seoncd bedroom, then the third. 3 1/2 baths total. Good points: excellent location (right on the waterfront in the cruise ship terminal), very good rooms, very good staff, room service excellent, kids loved the pool. Needs some work: housekeeping staff was way too eager to make up the room, which made us feel rushed out the door, some nights we had turndown service, some nights not, soundproofing could be better, internet service was unreliable, All in all, a wonderful hotel, just not quite up to the standards of the Farirmont Pan Pacific just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for convention center, lovely views!”
Reviews.Author: crewfox
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while attending a conference taking place at the Vancouver Convention Center, and I was very pleased with the location of this hotel. It is in the same building as the East Wing meeting rooms, and just across the square from the West Wing meeting rooms (the larger section of the convention center). There is also an underground walkway between both wings and the hotel, should the weather be uncooperative to walking outside. (The only hotel that is marginally closer to the west wing of the convention center is the Fairmont Pacific Rim, which is across the street). I also enjoyed the hotel itself - my room was a king Harbor view room, and it was spacious and comfortable. In addition to a comfy bed and large work desk, I had a side chair and chaise lounge, next to floor to ceiling windows with a terrific view of the harbor. I did find that the desk chair was uncomfortable, as it was too low for me and wasn't adjustable. I had to stack a few pillows on the seat to be at the right height. The bathroom was large, comfortable and very clean. Marble floors and wide counter space around the sink, plus a separate room with door for the toilet. I appreciated the Aveda bath products which were very nice. The in-room coffee service was good (tasty coffee), and includes fresh milk and cream at no charge in your mini-bar. What a great touch, for a "real" coffee drinker! There's also a starbucks right next to the lobby of the hotel, in case you need a more complex coffee fix. I ordered room service breakfast 3 times during my stay, and it was punctual and tasty, if a bit overpriced, but it's room service...don't we expect a huge service charge by now? Finally, I found the service overall at the hotel to be excellent. Very friendly staff all around, including helpful concierges that made a good recommendation for a nearby sushi restaurant that was terrific. (Too bad another concierge's recommendation for a casual "Mediterranean" wasn't as good.) The staff in the lobby bar was super friendly and treated us very well over the course of a week while we had numerous business meetings there. Overall, I recommend the hotel both for business and leisure travel. It's great if you're working at the convention center, as well as if you are departing on a cruise as it is located directly on top of the cruise departures dock, as other reviewers have mentioned. Also excellent and easy access to the SkyTrain (local metro) - Waterfront station is only 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sir67
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to say much bad about this hotel. Admittedly, I got a great deal with Expedia's Unpublished Rate program - $152/night instead of the published $320-400/night.
