Parking is a bit expensive but that's Vancouver. Great location and views. Great breakfast in the restaurant on the lobby level. Clean, comfortable rooms and beds. Beautiful open air pool on the 8th floor, maybe a little small. Internet is not free however you have the option of renting as little as an hour or by the day or week.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Vikingcity
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location as we had just arrived in port from a week long cruise from LA. We just walked through the hall to the adjoining hotel and were met by a super friendly young hotel bellman. He took our luggage and kept it for us until checkin, as we arrived very early in the morning. We met family who took us an toured the area which we found to be very beautiful and clean. When we arrive back at the hotel we were quickly checked in and found that they had upgraded us to a harbour view rooms. They were clean, big and roomy and our bellhop was still there and gave us great directions to go out and walk around to see more of the downtown area. We felt safe as we walked around the area and went for dinner in one of the great restaurants. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “pre cruise to alaska”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl0707
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at night due to a flight delay, the hotel was easy to find from the airport via cab about $25.00 The lobby and registration was beautiful. The young man at the desk was friendly, helpful. Very easy to register, our luggage was brought up within minutes, also very pleasant. The hotel is attached to the convention center, hub of almost everything, the bus tours are out the front door. Easy to walk around, the views and ease of the area was safe, with plenty to see, eat and enjoy. We would return to pan pacific for our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rlennon1
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful location to stay at while in Vancouver, whether you're attending a conference or just wanting to explore. Both the building inside and rooms are elegant and comfortable. While it can be a bit of maze when you first come in, but the elevator will take you to the lobby quickly. Walking outside, you're on Vancouver's beautiful and historic waterfront. As a location, it would be hard to find better. If you're there for a convention, you're essentially inside Canada Place and next door to the newer convention centre. It's also a short walk to Stanley Park or Robson Street. As a bonus, it's only steps away to both Starbucks and the skytrain link that will zip you to the airport faster than any cab. My only minor complaints were a few coughs and conversations from the next room that carried surprisingly well through the adjoining door. The bathroom floor is also shockingly icy cold and it'll jolt you awake if you're not prepared. Otherwise, the rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. To sum it up, while this hotel isn't cheap, by Vancouver standards you'd really be hard pressed to find better for this price.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dohertys53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after finishing an Alaskan cruise. We had a harbor view room. The harbor is mesmerizing. The beds were comfy and we had the softest robes I have ever seen. Aveda products in the bathroom. The hotel is a convenient location to downtown and Gastown (which is a cool shopping and eating district)

Reviews.Title: “Starting place for a cruise”
Reviews.Author: DonkArizona
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before an Alaska cruise. Wasn't sure about booking this hotel since we have never been there before but sure glad we did. This hotel is at the cruise port, Canada Place. The hotel was fantastic and the views of the harbor and snowy mountains was breath taking. Busy place for float planes to take off and land too. The rooms were excellent, very comfortable. Lots of places to eat within walking distance as we didn't have a car. Our luggage was delivered from our room directly to the cruise ship and then to our room on the ship without us touching it. Walked down stairs and checked on the ship. Next cruise out of Vancouver we won't even look for any other place, this will be it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in excellent location, perferct for pre cruise”
Reviews.Author: BourneTravelling
Reviews.Content: Excellent welcome on arrival. We were given a lovely harbour view room. The dining area and bar were been entertained by an excellent duo of opera singers, lovely pool with views over harbour. Our luggage for the cruise was collected from our room delivered to the Terminal and we did not see it again until we got in to our cabin, all for a tip to the porter. It's location meant that we couold have a great stroll around. Very quiet on our floor. Would stay here again for Central Vancouver. )One improvement could be the introduction of free internet. Cheaper chains such as Sandman and Best Western offer it, dissapointing that an upmarket chain does not

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience, I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: slsbusinesslou
Reviews.Content: I have been at the pan pacific for the past 2 weeks and it has exceeded all of my expectations. The staff is friendly the service is second to none and the whole atmosphere was great. The room was clean and quiet, I had a wonderful sleep waking up refreshed every morning. I really liked the lounge to wind down in. Thank you Pan Pacific!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: Anjelica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific the night before our Alaskan Cruise. Overall its a nice hotel with beautiful views but it was not family friendly (more below). We booked this hotel in July 2010 for our May 2011 stay. We booked the Family Getaway Package (which included 2 rooms and a few amenities). Good: - Even though we were not in a suite we had a view of both the city and the waterfront. It was a very nice view. - Breakfast Buffet at Cafe Pacifica was very good - Hotel is in a great location and within walking distance of many restuarants and stores Not so Good: - Upon check-in worker behind desk felt it was their duty to come around the counter and scold my children by telling them to "To Be Quiet". Let me state I am a big believer in child discipline and sometimes I am hard on my children to a fault (they are currently 8 and 4) but they were not demonstrating any obnoxious behavior that would warrant an employee to come around the corner and scold them. This really left a bad taste in my mouth. - Bell services decided to use my camera bag as a door stopper when delivering our luggage to our room. Seriously, of all the things to use a door stopper you use the bag with some of the most expensive equipment. - Our package included breakfast in the cost of the rooms. Upon returning home I found they charged us $107.xx for breakfast. After a call to the hotel they resolved the issue within an hour (still waiting on the refund to post to the CC). Not a service issue but would have been nice category: - No Internet without pay - I'm not stating this is the hotels fault but it seems that in this day and age to pay for internet at most high end hotels seems a bit much. - The rooms seemed a little dated with the furniture - I expected rich coloring furniture - instead it looked more (in my opinion) like furniture I would find in most Florida rooms. Again not an issue with the hotel per se..... - The package we booked included a free movie, cookies and milk for the children, juice/soda and popcorn for the adults. You had to call down to order the food items - While it was nice I thought the cookies would have been "homemade" instead they were packaged "semi-cheap" type cookies. The feeling I got from the whole tray they brought up was "nice thought, not that great implementation". The hotel does seem "stiff" even for a 4-5 star hotel. I did not feel it was overtly family friendly. I won't stay there again with at least the children. The next time I am in Vancouver I may try the Fairmont across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Location Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: travelmomHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this wonderful waterfront hotel before departing for an Alaskan cruise. Our party of ten, including several seniors and two small children arrived around 1:00 p.m. with a stunning volume of baggage. The bell staff patiently assisted us with dividing up the bags into groups for each of our four rooms, which we assumed would not be ready as they had advised us of a 4:00 check-in time. As we entered the lobby I was struck with fear at the piles and piles of baggage there and could only dread what was to come. Fortunately one of our four rooms was ready immediately so that we could drop of our hand baggage and lo and behold when we got to the room the proper baggage WAS ALREADY THERE. As they called us to notify that each room in turn was available (the last at well before 4:00) the baggage was there in every instance, before we arrived! As a family we have stayed at many hotels and resorts from the best in the world to Motel 6 and I have NEVER seen such an efficient baggage operation. There are many major, five star hotels that could send their entire staff to have a lesson from the Bell Staff at the Pan Pacific Vancouver. Three of our four rooms were even adjacent to each other. Add to that the fact that the rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable, plus the stunning views and convenient location - all in all a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant room and amenities”
Reviews.Author: TheRanj
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here a couple of years ago for a festival that was being held in the convention centre downstairs. The room was very elegant and had some great sheets/view of the harbor looking towards North Vancouver, and the spa (Spa Utopia) is one of the best downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view with spacious accomodations”
Reviews.Author: momof2girls1999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! Spacious room with large separate living room/dining room area. HUGE bathroom with separate 1/2 bath. Ordered room service which was delicious, hot, quick and they set the table for you, tablecloth and all. The view of the harbor was perfect! Watched the sea planes land and take off and the cruise ships come and go. Very interesting to watch!

Reviews.Title: “If you are taking a cruise from Vancouver, consider staying at the Pan Pacific the night before.”
Reviews.Author: nittoToronto
Reviews.Content: After a brief visit to Tolfino, we were taking an Alaskan cruise and decided to splurge for one night at the Pan Pacific as we were arriving in Vancouver mid afternoon the day before. Best decision ever! Beautiful room and such comfortable beds. We actually watched our ship arrive and dock from the room. Hotel staff were very accommodating and provided the luggage tags for our ship as ours had not arrived before we left Toronto. All the bags were delivered directly to the ship. No hassle, no fuss, no bother ....that made the price well worth it. Sometimes you have to spoil yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Be Pampered in Beautiful Surroundings!”
Reviews.Author: sarleo
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver several times before and I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. After our Alaskan cruise we stayed four more nights in a harborview room that was nicely decorated, clean, comfortable and quiet. The veiw of the mountains (including Mt. Baker) from the room was beautiful, along with the ships, helicoptors, trains and the city. The bathroom had double sinks, a great shower with upscale toiletries, and was spotless. Housekeeping was friendly and helpful. My favorite area of the hotel was the pool deck! It is on the 8th floor (although I think it is higher) and has a spa and a heated pool with plenty of lounges. The view of the city and harbour was incredible. I love watching the sunset from the pool. The area was clean, as was the water. There were plenty of towels and there are locker rooms with showers and saunas. The concierge got us 7pm Saturday night reservations at a great seafood restaurant on a holiday weekend when we called at 5pm that evening. He was helpful with many things, as was the bellman when we left in the early hours of the morning. We ordered room service and the fruit plate I ordered was filled with blackberries, rasberries, strawberries, slices of different types of melon and more. It was fresh and tasted so sweet. I love the Pan Pacific and I wouldn't stay anywhere else- I have been so spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and very convenient for cruise passengers.”
Reviews.Author: pepcingin
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service and knowledgable concierge desks. The room was very nice, roomy and comfortable. It overlooked the harbor with beautiful views, especially at night. It had access to a seawall where you can go for a walk or jog. We didn't use the pool, spa or restaurant. It was very convenient, coming off a cruise because it is attached to the cruise docks. Once you go through Customs and collect your luggage, the porter from the cruise terminal brought everything to right outside the hotel which was a quick walk in the same building. From there, the hotel porter took the luggage and stored it until our room was ready. In the meantime, we went sightseeing and when we came back to the hotel, all of our suitcases were in our rooms. We were 2-3 blocks from Gastown and about 5 blocks to the Lookout Tower which had very nice 360 degree views of Vancouver and the harbor. We only had 1 day there but plan to go back. There is so much to see. You need at least 1 day just to visit Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: avwood
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and exteremly convenient for Alaskan cruising. It is the only waterfront hotel with direct access to the cruise terminal dirctly beneath the hotel by elevator. Great staff, obliging and so polite.

Reviews.Title: “On my top Ten hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty525
Reviews.Content: Arrived a couple of days before cruising to Alaska, and had nothing but top notch service from beginning to end. We loved it so much we stayed a night extra at the end of the cruise. Beautiful hotel, VERY convenient if you are going to cruise as they will handle your luggage and take it to the terminal. One less thing to worry about! Will definitely stay here again! If sleeping in is a concern, beware of the water planes taking off! Get a city view room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Owly13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to Alaskan cruise & can't rate it highly enough. Beautiful hotel and very handy with the Skytrain from the airport taking you right to the Waterfront which is a few minutes walk & also a few minutes to the cruise departure area & lots of restaurants, bars & shops. Nice pool area & would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JoeyCray
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights prior to boarding the Disney Cruise ship. The hotel is truly a five star service. Although it was built over 30 years ago, it is well maintained and very clean. The staff are very friendly and professional. I like the bell service which took our luggage from our room and send them directly to the cruise ship. Very convenient if you are going on a cruise ship.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, good location with little charm or character”
Reviews.Author: 1owenoke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a deluxe king bay view room with beautiful views of the harbor for $450 per night for 2 nights. The room was comfortable and well maintained, offering a luxurious stay with marble bathroom, comfortable bed and entire wall window with great views. However, it was definitely a small room with little leg room around the bed. The hotel is huge/gigantic and right next to a convention center, actually the first entry lobby IS a convention center so the feeling is very business like/commercial and it is definitely not a boutique/charming hotel. the traffic and crowd probably explains the poor concierge service (attitude from a man at concierge and waiting on the phone for 30 min to get a movie theater suggestion). Otherwise, great choice for location to nearby restaurants and shops and high quality area in general. Not a honeymoon place though...Breakfast buffet is good too, but again a bit commercial.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyPearl47
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel post cruise and just loved it. The view from our room was spectacular, the bed was ultra comfortable, the size of the room very spacious with not only an arm chair, but a comfortable chaise longue set up for gazing out at that beautiful view. There is a very nice spa and pool on the 8th floor that also looks out over the view. The room amenities are very high quality with Aveda bath products and a spa robe made of some material that was so soft and fluffy. The property is very conveniently located next to the Waterfront train station and the Sea Bus. The cruise terminal is right out the front door, so you can't get any closer. There are numerous cafes and restaurants nearby. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxurey hotel”
Reviews.Author: RINSO84
Reviews.Content: We stayed to cruise at this hotel it is located at the cruise terminal. Great hotel very friendly staff. We elected to upgrade to a harbour executive room. Great view, included free WIFI, breakfast in the executive lounge, free newspaper, free canapés in evening, plus dedicated check in/out and booking excursions, but Canada style the drinks are via honesty bar, (Singapore is free) The bath robes are the best ever, even better the Raffles, super soft. Would we stay again most defiantly yes. Expensive but one is spoilt by all the touches.

Reviews.Title: “Second time in 2 months big improvement!”
Reviews.Author: lynnwilltravel
Reviews.Content: Having done a review back in February - not a great stay at that time but now I must say that they have greatly improved on their service. I can recommend this hotel for a stop over, cruise, or conference. This time we stayed in a harbour facing room. The staff had indicated that there were a few conventions going on... a car show and cheerleading competition. This hotel is the hub of activity if a few events are occurring on the same dates. This is a convention centre and you need to keep this in mind. Vancouver is a busy city and there are alot of things to see in the greater downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Twenty-five years of class but also of a couple of missteps”
Reviews.Author: M-man11
Reviews.Content: Anyone with mobility issues should be advised to insist on a shower, as none of the baths are equipped with grab-bars. With the side of the tub rather high, stepping into or even assisting someone with difficulties can be treacherous. I hesitate putting this at the beginning of a review, but I am rather insistent that grab-bars be installed in ALL tubs to prevent accidents. Fortunately there are many wonderful aspects of the Pan Pacific to help temper the shortcomings. I have rarely encountered such convivial staff, from Navneet Bains to the morning host in the Club Room. Not only were they cordial, but they provided a wealth of helpful information and guidance. Well done! Yes, we opted to splurge on the Club Level, availing ourselves of great views from an adequate-sized room. I can sympathize with one reviewer who claimed to be able to watch life from the windows without ever leaving the room. Elevators are extremely fast and quiet, and one can bypass the lobby by entering from the bottom floor, conference level. Many amenities from plush robes and slippers to exotic toiletries are standard features at the club level, although only ethernet cables are available in the room for those bringing their own laptops. For those of us preferring to use the computer downstairs, the charge is CA $6.80 for twenty minutes. Is this gouging? The complimentary goodies on the Club Floor are excellent, with an expanded continental buffet breakfast, snacks throughout the day, and evening hors-d'oeuvres (not really enough to fill up on for a meal). One glass of wine or one bottle of beer per guest is complimentary. Cocktails are extra. Be prepared to pay the 12% tax on everything, with an additional 3½% added on the hotel bill. All check-ins and check-outs are handled in the Club Lounge, and the host (or hostess) will print--for free--boarding passes. We've been to Vancouver several times and even stayed at the Pan Pacific twenty years ago. We will gladly return although wish that something could be done to safeguard individuals when entering the tub. FLASH! Aqua Riva, across from the hotel, is shutting its doors forever after June 30, 2011. A CA $25 three-course prix fixe is offered at dinner, and all full bottles will be offered at 30% off. A chain enterprise of some sort will likely take its place.

Reviews.Title: “A Couple of Dings, otherwise Great”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel009
Reviews.Content: We scored through Hotwire to get a Thursday-Friday night stay at $141/night. Got a 16th floor room looking eastward toward the ferry, heliport, and Gastown. Great location, good directions from staff of where to go (although it IS a longer walk than 20 minutes to the Totems in Stanley Park!!). Everything was superb except for a couple of niggly things. Why is it that the most expensive hotels INSIST on charging for intenet access while lower priced hotels do not? And secondly, $35/day parking is outrageous. On a rainy day, where else would they expect you to park? Otherwise, very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but it should be for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nelly59CR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pan Pacific for a couple of nights in May 2011. It's an impressive hotel in a good, central location. Our room on the 20th floor was clean and well presented and had a fabulous view towards Stanley Park. My main issue with the hotel was that, being effectively part of the conference centre, there always seemed to be a lot of people around, most of whom presumably had nothing to do with the hotel. To me, this seemed to create an unusually impersonal atmosphere, even for a large and generically anonymous city hotel. I don't know if we managed to secure a particularly poor deal (it wouldn't be the first time), but despite the fact that it cost us a lot to stay here, the price didn't include breakfast, we still had to pay for internet access and it cost us about £25-a-day to park our car. The car parking is perhaps not unreasonable given the hotel's location and there are lots of places round about to have breakfast, but I can't remember the last time I stayed in a hotel that didn't have complimentary wi-fi. Still quite impressive though.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property with great service...”
Reviews.Author: LAEWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was an absolutely gorgeous hotel, and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay there. The hotel was exceptionally clean, and the service was friendly and prompt. If I visit Vancouver again, this is where I would stay. My only wish is that the hotel had more dining outlets for breakfast and lunch - there was really only one (Cafe Pacifica), which can get tiring if you're there for an extended period of time, which I was. The food was still top-notch, though. The pricing was a bit expensive, but it made sense for such a high-end property. The location is a bit outside of things, being adjacent to the new convention center, but there was plenty within walking distance as well. And don't let its "convention hotel" exterior fool you when it comes to the spa - the spa was really very nice. A real gem in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: senssl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, clean, nice views. We were on the Pacific Club Flor, with it's own check-in, concierge, evening hor d'oerves, and breakfast. The location is wonderful - near downtoen, Stanley Park, Gastown. We would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jun_r
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during valentine weekend. We flew to Vancouver on a whim and lucked out with an excellent hotel that turned out to be very close to public transport. We got around Vancouver without a car as the hotel connects to Vancouver's Skytrain. Great restaurants all around, great location.

Reviews.Title: “i feel lucky to have stayed there.”
Reviews.Author: cindyb27
Reviews.Content: from the first interaction with the smiling, helpful doorman, to the last with the maid with the cleaning cart, what a fantastic place to stay. it was spotless. the rooms were large. good views, and quiet. close to anywhere you want to be. large well lit parking garage. only there for a night, so didn't use any amenities. classy.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Property”
Reviews.Author: AvalancheChief
Reviews.Content: There is just something about the Pan Pacific in Vancouver. The common areas seem to be influenced by a cruise ship, the rooms are very well appointed, the restaurants are excellent, and the location is very good. All of the individual pieces are "above average," and yet coupled with world class service it becomes one of the best properties in Vancouver. The Opera Italian Buffet tends to be booked out weeks in advance, but is overwhelming in its choices, preparation, and singing that resonates through the large open lobby. The breakfast provided in the top floor private club was equally good. But every time I've stayed at the Pan Pacific I've found there is just something incredibly relaxing about the property. Is it the views of the mountains and the Lion's Gate bridge? Is it the whisper quiet rooms with fuzzy white bathrobes and every amenity you could ask for? Is it the perfectly comfortable beds? Is it a staff that will respond to every request with grace and a smile? Or is it all of it??? You can pay more for a hotel room in Vancouver, and you can certainly pay for less, but if you're looking for a relaxing base of operations where you could spend a lazy Sunday morning eating room service breakfast before wandering down to Stanley Park? There is no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: CAWorkingMom
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Vancouver on business and hauled my family with me. We got a great deal on a room. We got a harbor view room. It was huge with 2 double beds and a stunning view of the water. Bathroom was very nice. All in all, beautiful hotel. Modern feel. Staff was average. Did their job, polite, didn't go out of their way to make you feel warm or welcome. Maid service, however, was outstanding - fast, efficient. One day, we were out for, maybe, 1 hour for lunch. During that hour, housekeeping somehow realized we were out and tidied everything up. Don't know if it was luck, or what. Restaurant is pricey but you got a buy one, get one free buffet breakfast which I didn't use, but I heard was decent. There is an underground food court at the metro complex next door. There are also several nice restaurants in the area: sushi, Dim Sum, and Japa Dogs stand! Great location for convention center, which you can access without leaving the hotel. You have to walk 2 -3 blocks to get to the train.( ie, station is next to hotel, but you have to wangle your way down a series of walkways so it winds up being a bit of a haul if you have luggage.) Also not centrally located, so not much to do in the immediate area, but downtown is a short walk away (10 minutes or so). Free Internet if you are a pan Pacific member.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable quality and good price point”
Reviews.Author: ashleyogloff
Reviews.Content: We often stay here when spending a night in Vancouver- they offer good deals during the off-season and have industry rates if you work in the hotel industry. The hotel is in a great location with amazing views of the city or the ocean and mountains- it's clean, quiet, and has great helpful concierge at the front desk. Overall we really like staying here, it's a place we know the quality and service is reliable! Only complaint is the cost of parking per day!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Mungo888
Reviews.Content: My first time in Vancouver. What a beautiful city. I was here for a conference and as such the location was perfect as the conference centre was attached. For business, most of the companies I met were within walking distance. Shopping was also a shortish walk away. The room was very good and clean and the bathroom was reasonable. Not top end 5 start but not far from it either. I prefer walk in showers and modern bathrooms - this was not that but was clean. The bed was excellent. The ceiling height I found a little low. The view was absolutely incredible - it made the hotel. The common parts/lobby etc were also wonderful - big windows and spectacular views. Breakfast (included) was excellent. Recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business stay!”
Reviews.Author: CAGOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my recent four-night stay for business in Vancouver. Like most hotels, there are premiums to pay for extras, but there are lots of good quality basics - Aveda toiletries, robes, real milk and cream for coffee. And if you join the rewards program at no cost, you have free Wifi and bottled water. The rooms are spacious and the beds very comfortable. The thermostat is very responsive which is not always the case even in good hotels. The location is unbeatable always a joy to visit Vancouver. The Artegiano cafe chain is a great choice for breakfast and lunch and there are several near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, amenties fall short and are over priced.”
Reviews.Author: StHyde
Reviews.Content: My wife had a conference at the convention centre and liked the convenience of this hotel. The rooms are in the process of being re-done and ours had recently been updated. The bed was comfortable and the linens quite nice. We were a bit concerned when we could here the guy next door talking on his telephone; however we didn't have any problems getting a good nights sleep. Although the A/C kept coming on all night (it was set at 20C and the outside temperature was around 2C). Once we arrived in the room we were disappointed to learn that the (wired) internet access was $18.75/day. Parking (no in & out) turned out to be $35/day. The Flat-screen HDTV was really nice, unfortunately there was no HD content provided. We have stayed at the Fairmont across the street in years past and definitely recommend looking there before the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “not what it used to be...”
Reviews.Author: voyageurbear
Reviews.Content: I used to consider the Pan Pacific as one of the most comfortable hotel in Canada. I was traveling for business and was booked in a lower rate room. That's fine and I travel enough not to expect a suite for this rate. This however does not justify the glacial tone of the person working at the registration desk, the booking of a room where the noise of the elevator engine could be heard day and night. Bed was very comfortable, thankfully. Bathroom is certainly in need of renovation, amenities were the bare minimum for a motel room. If you compare for similar rate the Fairmont Pacific Rim is a much better value for money and really comfortable I had to phone management to get something fixed on my account, since the registration desk personnel would not help and was totally dismissive. Finally the cost of WiFI is prohibitive.

Reviews.Title: “Top ten view + top ten room”
Reviews.Author: steve_randomno
Reviews.Content: I previously gave this hotel a very positive review a few years ago and have stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver every winter for several years. Vancouver has seen a lot of new hotels appear during the run up to the 2010 winter games and so the Pan Pacific doesn't represent the most up to date Vancouver offering in terms of the design of it's showcase common areas, which are starting to look a little dated. However, it still provides extremely good service, exceptional rooms, and unbeatable views. This January, we stayed for three nights in a pacific pearl room. This is one of the best rooms I have stayed in. I suspect it has recently been renovated as it was spotless. It was huge, had very high quality, stylish furnishings and fittings. There is a massive, very comfortable bed (queen I think) and bed-linen is of a noticeably high quality. Bathrobes and two sets of slippers are supplied. The bathroom features a high quality modern style sleek marble finish with double hand basins, a separate dresser, separate w/c, large walk in rain effect shower with side jets, and a large bath with a sliding opaque window should you want to relax and enjoy the view. The view of the mountains harbour and Lions Gate bridge is of the best views from any hotel room in the world. One morning we reported a problem with the temperature range of the shower which was fixed by the time we returned that evening. A notable improvement affecting this hotel since the winter games has been the adjacent areas to the east. The once very run-down and tacky areas around gas-town have been transformed into a collection of interesting bars, clubs and shops posed to supplant the once hip Yaletown. Whilst the design of the common areas of the hotel could do with being brought up-to-date with the competition, the Pan Pacific still offers excellent service and quality in an unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable in the best way. Even in winter without skiing.”
Reviews.Author: gloria2886
Reviews.Content: I took the advice of others and did not buy anything extra during my 4 night stay. What an awesome hotel matching the awesome location with one of the best views of any metro city in the world! Save up and definitely have dinner at the restaurant within the Pan Pacific- 5 Sails. Unbelievable food and service and did I mention the view? Room was huge and quiet enough. Top line bedding. I would definitely remember this place and hope I can return one day. Fantasticly romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment - Poor service for money”
Reviews.Author: lynnwilltravel
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. Our first experience in 2001 was fantastic. Our recent stay was okay- in regards to the room. The service was not acceptable. The reception was distracted and seemed uninformed regarding our reservation. Too many details were left for us to explain...For the type of hotel that it is the service should be a lot better. I cannot recommend it because of the huge lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “awesome, exceptional location and staff”
Reviews.Author: AussieGal
Reviews.Content: Very modern but warm and welcoming hotel. Staff were very helpful, especially Phil, one of the doormen. Gave us great tips on good restaurants and even when moving on to Victoria gave us sight seeing suggestions. The hotel is within walking distance to ferry, train station, bus at front door, shops and many good restaurants. Would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor value - there are many better choices nearby”
Reviews.Author: Rick735
Reviews.Content: The location is nice, service only OK. Be ready to pay a lot for everything, as little is included in the rate, then what you do add on is very expensive. For this price all aspects should be excellent, but it wasn't. Also I had the unfortunate timing to be there when a large company had a two day meeting there. They filled the bars, and restraints, the service level declined and the hotel became very noisy. Very unpleasant. My advice chose one of the higher rated hotels across the street, and one that caters to travelers not large groups.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and over-priced.”
Reviews.Author: Barefeet2011
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is wonderful - I could go on and on. The beds were comfortable without question and the rooms were spotless. That's why I gave them the positives that I did on the overall rating. However, that's where the positive ends. I was told that their regular breakfast buffet wouldn't put available due to the fact that the hotel wasn't full enough and that instead, I could take advantage of their menu. So I did - however they took the opportunity to take advantage of me by charging me $7.00 for orange juice. Charge me more for something when it's worth more, prettier, more rare, or it required great effort to produce. Orange juice doesn't fit that bill. The rest of the breakfast was the same crazy song and dance with me leaving with a $38 charge just for a morning meal. Sad. As I checked out, there were two receptionists - TWO. It was like pulling teeth to get them from leaning on the wall behind the desk to walk up to me to help check me out. Forget a smile and anything to leave a positive impression - maybe they were too busy and they had too many guests in the hotel. Oh wait...didn't they already tell me that there wasn't? Never again. I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced room with overpriced "extras"”
Reviews.Author: TCU_2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan Pacific for a conference, and felt ripped off. The internet is horribly expensive, and then I found out on the last day of my stay that it should have been free because it was a conference hotel (it would have been nice for them to tell me that when I checked in instead of telling me the internet daily rate if it hadn't been included in my room). The drinks at the hotel bar are horribly expensive as well. However, there are soem great views, and it was an easy, inside walk to the convention center. It's also not a bad walk from the subway station. That said, if I had another conference at the Vancouver Convetion Center, I'd probably stay at the Fairmont across the street from the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “What an absolute rip off!!!”
Reviews.Author: chrisbandjenniferb
Reviews.Content: Spent New Years eve their and felt like I was ripped off BIG Time. We payed $260 per night and was suprised to see 1) Elevators were not working. 2) Water was $3 / $5 per bottle. 3) Drinks were $7 und up in the in room mini bar. 4) Local calls were $2 each. 5) Only 3 towles in the room. 6) No vending machiens on site. 7) The pool and hot tub are packed and tiny. 8) Parking is $39 per day! ... and I could go on and on. I cant figure out how this place got so many positive reviews ...must of been from MLA's and other government officials with fat expense accounts. When we checked out 4 out of the 6 people in front of us complained about their bills or stated that they felt that they were being gouged. I dont know who rated this as a 5 star hotel ...they should be fired, it's a 4 star at the most. I WOULD NOT RECOMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE PERIOD!!!

Reviews.Title: “Should have been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: shannibear011
Reviews.Content: I don't think the cleaning staff had ever heard of a hand tool on the vacuum cleaner. Could write my name in the dust on the back of couches and along the edges of the walls. Looking for a lost ear ring behind the bed resulted in a forced view of even more dust, candy and condom wrappers. on the bright side, the staff was nice, and my dog has a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with amazing View”
Reviews.Author: TeeL69
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific is a wonderful hotel. we stayed here for 3 nights while exploring Vancouver. The room was great. It had everything what you expect from a luxury hotel. The bed was very comfortable. From our bathroom we had a amazing view of the lake where every once a while a water-airplane started and landed. The location is very good and you can walk to down town. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Malagababy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night for an office Christmas party. We had a room with a king-sized bed, facing the inner harbour. Beautiful room, excellent view and plenty of room for us and our 7 month old daughter and all her paraphenalia. The bed was great, and the hotel was quiet. My only complaints are minor. I know mini-bar fridges are supposed to be loaded with overpriced drinks, but there was almost no room for our baby's food. Also, the hotel charges $14.95 a day for internet, and $1.95 per LOCAL call. This hotel is high-end...so you'd think they could at least have free local calls. All in all, it's a beautiful place to stay and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service”
Reviews.Author: Judy94
Reviews.Content: Helpful & pleasant staff. Decent rooms. The only thing I would change are the carpets. They look worn and don't fit in with the rest of the decor which looks in much better shape.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great!”
Reviews.Author: pc8862
Reviews.Content: If you are going to the Convention Center downtown Vancouver this hotel is next to it. It has a tunnel you can walk to the Convention center without getting wet. The Skytrain (Waterfall station) is 50 feet away from the hotel. From the Vancouver international airport to the hotel cost somewhere around 8 .00 CAD a trip per person & about 15 minutes. It cost 40.00CAD for the taxi. I paid 160CAD a day with no breakfast for a King room with a city view. I requested a quite room when I was checking in with the front desk (Japanese young lady). She said without any smile, “the rate you paid you would have to pay only 40.00CAD more to get a quite room; and your room is next to the elevator.” I told her I sleep lightly and she said “I don’t know how sensitive you sleep, or you can pay 40.00CAD I can move you.” After that attitude I was not going to request anything else. They do have in the room free WIRELESS internet and also have a good exercise room and with free bottle(s) water there. If you sign up of their Loyalty Program you will get the Free Wireless internet & a bottle of water a day. I didn’t use their pool area due to the rain. One of my colleagues stayed across the street at the Four Seasons for 166.00CAD at the same time and their room size is bigger with harbor and city views. On top of it, when they checked in a staff member took them to their room to explain and introduce the room to them. For 6.00CAD more (instead of $40.00CAD) I will definitely check in to the Four Seasons before I book with the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: Neil100
Reviews.Content: I wanted a relaxing, peaceful break for my wife and I for a couple of nights that felt a bit special and that is exactly what we got. We booked a Premier King room with a harbour view. On the 17th floor, we had fantastic views of the inlet, Stanley Park, north shore, Convention Center etc and it was just blissful to sit in the chaise longue and breathe it all in. The bed was really comfortable, the room very clean and we had no noise disturbances. The reception staff could have been a bit less formal for my liking and I think that wifi should be included in the room price considering how much you pay, but those are minor quibbles. Great hotel and recommended

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights while on a business trip with Mr. BT2. We got a deluxe city view room at the Canadian Provincial rate. Room was larger than normal with an extra desk area in addition to the sitting area, on the 21st floor. Very quiet room - lovely city lights view, every amenity one could think of. In room coffee was outstanding. They brought up fresh cream for the coffee. Shower had a rainshower head with great water pressure. Gym was small but high quality with refrigerated bottles of water and complimentary headphone use. Valet parking was prompt. Wifi was spotty but the room had ethernet which worked like a charm. Bathroom had a cool door that either shut for main bathroom or shut the toilet area off from the rest of the bathroom. Room was all done in clear birds-eye maple - very nice. Robes were large and soft chenille - much nicer than the standard terry. HVAC worked very well. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location for the convention center”
Reviews.Author: pickybiz
Reviews.Content: Attached to the convention center and beautiful views of the bay. Not bad at all for a convention hotel, although the carpet is showing some wear and tear. Otherwise very clean and comfortable. Great food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: lshopsonline
Reviews.Content: I travel to Pan Pacific Vancouver every November to attend a conference. It's a real treat. Conference hotels can often be run-down and dated. That's not the case with Pan Pacific Vancouver. It is a great location for business travellers and tourists. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The food (at the bar) is a bit pricey but it's outrageous for hotel standards. The room was nice and clean; the bed was super comfortable for a good night sleep. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to holiday”
Reviews.Author: AlitNorthamptonUK
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay for a few days to unwind after a long flight and before going on a cruise. The rooms were lovely with wonderful views of the harbour and all it's activity, with some city view into the bargain. Vancouver is a lovely to explore. Everyone is friendly, helpful, smiling, polite. Staff at this hotel are no exception. Breakfast was very good over a long period of time in the mornings and the buffet was regularly topped up by willing staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...Would highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: pmckenn1
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Pan Pacific was perfect. Our room was ready when we arrived even though it was much earlier than the check-in time. The hotel is beautiful! We had a wonderful view of the harbor from our room. The hotel is very centally located. If you sailing on a cruise from Vancourver, the hotel will deliver your luggage directly to the shp for you. Breakfast at the Cafe Pacifica was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for cruise passengers”
Reviews.Author: abbafan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights pre cruise at the Pan Pacific. I booked through Hotwire for $135 a night and was very pleased to get this hotel. We were cruising out of Canada Place so the location was perfect. On the morning of our cruise we called the bell desk and they sent someone to our room to take our luggage down to the cruise terminal right under the hotel. We did not need to accompany it as long as the luggage tags were attached.It was super convenient, we just checked out at our leisure and took the eleavtor down to check in for our cruise when we were ready. As an added bonus we could see our ship form our hotel room window. The room was nicely decorated with lovely fluffy bathrobes and a chaise lounge in the window overlooking the port. All the staff we encountered were very polite and helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are many dining options within walking distance.We went to The Bread Garden on Robson Street for a reasonably priced breakfast with free wi-fi. Also it is very convenient for Stanley Park where we rented bikes. We would certainly stay here again especially if we can get a deal on Hotwire!

Reviews.Title: “OVER-RATED”
Reviews.Author: GoTrainsBoatsPlanes
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location but lacking in atmosphere. Too big and part of convention centre. Felt cold. Ludicrous prices in bar and charge for mineral water in room. One would expect that to be complimentary in such a top-rated hotel. Also charge for use of internet. Staff not particularly friendly. Some good little shops on site.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: atwater5122
Reviews.Content: It is said that because of the large amount of Hong Kong immigrants before 1997 and the recent rapid capital infusion from the corrupt Chinese government officials, everything in Vancouver is over priced. This hotel was an exception for me. I booked a few nights at this hotel through Hotwire and I guess the price I paid was less than ten percent of their published rates. After staying there, I felt the price I paid was what the hotel is worth. First of all the check-in process was painfully long. They had three or four people at the front desk and there was a long line of guests waiting to check in. The front desk workers took their time to upsell, start from taking reservations, and eventually tell people that their rooms were not ready and went out to move the guests' luggages themselves to a storage room. When it was finally our turn, we were not surprised that we had to wait for another two hours to get into our room because they were not ready yet. The hotel is located on top of a cruise pier and it must be very convenient for cruise goers but not for us. The only available parking was valet parking and that made the getting in and out very difficult. It was raining all the time during our stay and there was nothing to do inside the hotel, except an outdoor swimming poor which resembled a pool on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: rgscotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific for three nights in September. Fantastic hotel with a great location, Especially if you are going on a cruise as its on the cruise terminal. Parking is a bit on the steep side at $35 per day, we actually opted for Valet parking as only $4 more. Check-in is on the second floor and we were served quickly by a lovely lady who got out room sorted. We had a inner harbour view which had views to the mountains in the distance. Room was a great size, two queen beds, one of the largest bathrooms ive ever had in a hotel. Pool is located outdoors on the 8th floor, there is also separate male and female saunas. Fitness room and Spa located on the lower floors C1 i think. I was surprised that the hotel did not provide free WI-FI, as many other hotels i've stayed in during my trip did. Location wise, you are only a few blocks from Gas town, Robson Street etc so very easy to get out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Vancouver - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansGumbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three days before our cruise to Alaska. It is in a great location - at the cruise terminal and steps from great downtown dining and shopping. When it is time to go, the bell captain transfers your luggage for you to your stateroom. You walk down to the terminal and board your ship; your luggage is there in your stateroom when you get there. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service & In Need of an Update”
Reviews.Author: Welly9355
Reviews.Content: Not what we expected from a 5 star hotel.... Our room was dated, small and felt like an old apartment I once lived in. The pool was overrun with kids and towels making it hard to find a seat and ordering food/drink was out of the question unless you picked up the phone (at 5 star prices I would expect someone to be tending to the guests on a hot, sunny afternoon). The final disappointment came when we requested a one hour late checkout so that we could pack up upon returning from our conference. The best they could do was a half hour past their noon checkout. They would not budge on this. Again...not what I would expect from a hotel of this caliber where presumably satisfying the customer is of utmost importance. Overall we were left wishing we had stuck with the Four Seasons or the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but not quite 5*.”
Reviews.Author: Tobocop
Reviews.Content: This is generally a high calibre hotel, we loved the great location and large modern rooms. Paying the upgrade for the Pacific Club lounge is well worth while. This means you are on the 22nd or 23rd floor and get breakfast, hors d-oeuvres, tea, coffee and soft drinks, free local calls and internet acces if you have your laptop. The views from the Pacific Club lounge are amazing. The view from our room (2227) was of the harbour and moutains but part of the view was of the docks which where not the most appealing. All staff we dealt with where very helpful and professional. The hotel pool is quite small but has great views and is a good place to chill out. The hotel is very close to downtown, gastown, Waterfront station etc and the Sea Wall walk to Stanley park, do go to the Tourist Information office which is across the street as they are extremely helpful particularly Jim. Lack of Wifi could be a problem for some travellers and the cost of internet access seemed very high to us. We had free internet access but could not utilise it because of not having our laptop with us. Not the most impressive hotel lobby, be aware if moving luggage to or from your room that and the lift doors close incredibly quickly, Very much as the feel of a convention hotel and this means it does not have a true wow factor is probably closer to a 4.5 star than a true 5 star hotel. Contintental breakfast in the Pacific Club lounge was good, only had lunch once in the hotel's Cascade lounge and it was fine

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: citybreak01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 5 nights in August and we were more than happy with our stay there, the location is excellent, it's right on the waterside and close to shops, bars & resturants, our room was on the 18th floor, it was very comfortable and we had a great view from our room, I cannot comment on the quality of the food as we did not eat in the hotel due to the cost as we found the food and drink was quite expensive, however we did use room service once and it cost us 29 dollars for a club sandwich!! The staff were very helpful and courteous and the hotel itself is kept very clean, we did not have time to use the pool in the end but we did pop up there to have a look and that also looked very clean and well kept. I would recommend the Pan Pacific to anyone and would not hesitate to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, awesome views & fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: VW42
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, great location to enjoy sight seeing around Vancouver. Only downside was no Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic views, wonderful. friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: BigTripGuy
Reviews.Content: Although not generally a fan of large "convention" hotels, the Pan Pacific in Vancouver was a great experience during our 3-day stay. The property literally juts out into the harbor, so most of the rooms have nice views of the water. We woke up the first morning to discover a huge cruise ship had bearthed on the bulkhead right below us, and the continual activities in the harbor (e.g., sea planes landing, yachts, ocean vessels moving) were really interesting. The property is "right in the middle" of activities in the downtown Vancouver area, with plenty of sights, restaurants, etc. within easy walking distance. Although the hotel is part of a convention center (Canada Place), and is pretty caverous, its modern nautical flair architecture is pleasing. The staff was universally friendly. As an example, when the rooms we reserved were not available, we were upgraded into a luxury suite. After the first night the kids preferred to have two separate rooms (which we had reserved), and the staff cheerfully moved us into those. All of our rooms were very nice with great views. The buffet breakfasts (complimentary with our package) were fabulous. One of the bellmen (Peter, I think) was especially friendly, giving us friendly (and accurate) advice on restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: golfnut15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern right on the waterfront which is convenient to pretty much everything.The cruise ships (mostly) leave right from the hotel . For Holland America they take your luggage directly from the room to your room on the ship. The boarding is on the bottom floor of the hotel. CAVEAT:: Be sure you book a waterfront view, but be careful that one side of the hotel looks over the commercial docks, while the other side looks over Stanley Park. Be sure to get a higher floor since floors 9 & 10 (lowest room floors)have obstructed views. Breakfast is very good but expensive. Easily $100 for 4 adults and 2 children.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: koko269
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 1 night at the Pan Pacific for our wedding anniversary and it was wonderful. Check in was quick and the front desk person was very friendly and said Happy Anniversary to us. We also received a little chocolate gift in the room which was a thoughtful touch. The room and washroom were clean and tidy. The room looked a little dated compared to the newer/trendier hotels, but that's ok. The view was the best part. At night or in the morning...it was so beautiful! The lights, moutains, water, buildings, float-planes and boats was breath-taking. If you stay in a hotel in Vancouver, you should definitely stay here. We then went to Spa Utopia and had relaxing massages. My favorite spa in Vancouver. Gorgeous setting, wonderful facilities and amazing service. After the spa and dinner, we decided to use their rooftop pool. Love it! It was a warm night and it was very romantic to swim and use the hot tub under the stars. There were plenty of towels out for guests to use and the whole pool area was very clean. We had brunch the next day at Cafe Pacifica and it will always be my favorite brunch. They definitely have the best brunch buffet in Vancouver. A little pricey, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good, view, pool, brunch and a warning.”
Reviews.Author: DavidzLi
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Four Seasons or Opus, however due to some major conferences and event both of them were fully booked. So I picked Pan Pacific, despite some warning about it being a cruise ship hotel (it is on top of the Canada Place, a national landmark where most of the Alaskan Cruises depart). But it definitely was a surprisingly pleasant stay. 4 things I have to mention. 1) The View: Upon reaching its lobby level, the beautiful view of the Vancouver harbor, Lions Gate Bridge, and the mountains range to the right of it dominated my view. Harbor facing side of the lobby had a 5 floor high uninterrupted and expansive glass wall. And I booked an inner harbor view room with basically the same stunning view. The room was large with a king and a lounge chaise. Clean, comfortable with a decent bath room. 2) The pool: it is said to be the best pool and jacuzzi in town, not because of it's size or depth (not large and very shallow), but for it's view and tanning potential. Facing the same harbor view on the 8th floor terrace and with ample lounging chairs for tanning and people watching, I would probably have to agree (Four Seasons and Shangri-la only have indoor pools and Opus doesn't even have one). Only thing is if you order drinks, you might have to wait for awhile, their room service department seems to be a little understaffed during the tanning hours. 3) The Sunday brunch: I'm not usually one for the buffet, but from what I've seen, the Sunday brunch is all fresh supplies (not your usual let's-get-rid-of-week-long-left-over Sunday brunch). It does reminded me of a luxury cruise ship brunch. You might want to book ahead, the seats filled up rather quickly. The only downside is if you want to sleep in after a long night of partying, you might have some trouble if you are a light sleeper. There is a float plane terminal right next to the hotel, the first flight could be as early as 9 am and the cruise ships might blow their horns around noon. But for me, I throughly enjoyed my stay and with my corporate discount, I ended up saving my company close to half of what usually the other 2 hotels (yeah, the other 2 don't do have discount in their vocabulary) would have charged me.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveler99
Reviews.Content: We were at the Pan Pacific because my husband's conference was right next door. But far from being the luxurious 5 star stay we expected, it was a middling experience at best. First the good: The room was lovely with a gorgeous view of the harbor and huge bathroom w/ separate toilet area. Beautiful pool area, and very nice amenities. The not so good: we had two "double" beds, but they certainly seemed smaller than any other doubles we've ever been in in many years of marriage. The mini-bar fridge didn't work, even to cool a bottle of water. Several requests for assistance in order to cool medication as needed went unheeded. We were there 5 nights and it was not until the last one, after 3 requests, that we got any service. Not what I expected from a hotel that prides itself on service. A few other small annoyances: no free Wifi anywhere, including the lobby or business center. No real lobby area to meet people. An Ok location for cruises, conventioneers and tourbuses, but otherwise not all that central. I think I would be much more charitably disposed had this hotel not been so expensive and seemed so uncaring. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a anniversary weekend get away from Seattle and it was perfect. The location is perfect access to the Sky Train Waterfront station, and an easy walk to Gastown neighbourhood or about 20-minute walk along the water front to Stanly Park. Canada Place is also the main cruise terminal, so it's great access if you're taking a cruise as well. The room we stayed in was a King with inner harbour view. The bed was perfect and the TV was huge for a hotel, with a great on-demand movie selection. The bathroom was very spacious with Aveda bath products. The 8th floor has a pool and hot tub on a roof top terrace and it was very pleasant to sit out on a crisp night in the hot tub and heated salt water pool. I would gladly stay here again anytime, but next time I would probably splurge on the Stanly Park view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Spectacular City with Only A Couple of Issues”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan during a conference in late July during spectacular weather in Vancouver. In general it was a very pleasant experience at a full-service business hotel with a convenient location, but there were a couple of issues that might make me look at some of the other great full-service hotels near the convention center. And I cannot recommend Vancouver itself highly enough - a great location with mountains and sea, spectacular shopping and amenities, and great dining. Can't wait to go back. We had a suite on a high floor with a great view, EXCELLENT bed with high end mattress and linens, and a separate living room with a wet bar. Bathroom, wet bar with mini bar and long counter, and furniture in living room all great - two flat screen TV's. Staff kept the room spotlessly clean, room service was prompt and included the entire menu from the cafe. I loved the pool deck - a heated pool and super-hot (hooray!) whirlpool from which you could experience sunrise and sunset. Pool is long enough to do laps, and during our stay, it was very calm with few visitors and those visitors were quiet and contemplative. Perfect. The hotel is connected to the convention center and two blocks from the excellent public transport (train) station. The Gastown district is an easy walk, but I found it much less inviting than other parts of Vancouver - lots of generic tourist type restaurants and lots of panhandler/homeless men, which made it a little menacing for a woman. However, I strongly recommend the PourHouse in the Gastown district - great cocktails and excellent regional food in a casual, friendly atmosphere. Also recommend Bishops Restaurant downtown and the Punjabi district for fun costume jewelery shopping. The cons for this hotel: -no decent lobby bar scene - both Fairmonts within spitting distance had much better lobby bar scenes, which is part of the conference experience. Fairmont Pacific Rim's bar was especially groovy. -food was celestially expensive although typical for the convention hotels, and of high quality -service is the cafe was glacial but friendly - they always seemed to be under staffed with wait staff and we had to be very assertive on numerous occasions to get someone to take our order. Once ordered, service was fine - but twice we waited a half hour to order. -our safe failed a couple of times and we had to wait long periods of time for help, which was tough with a convention schedule. Staff admitted that the safe was a problem, and there were marks on the floor where it had been repaired before - so why is it still there? For the cost of this hotel, this is nonsense. -wifi was CAN $16/day and dropped constantly. I have major issues with being nickled and dimed in high end hotels over internet - but I do expect it to work. We prepaid for five days, so I addressed it at checkout and expected it to be removed, since it was extremely disruptive and unreliable. I had to speak to the manager, who said that because the hotel had not had a chance to correct the error, we had to pay the full rate. I pointed out that the safe repair took three visits by staff and was disruptive and inconvenient, and that we checked our internet at 5 am and late in the evening and didn't want to miss convention events to sit on the phone with their tech support or have their staff in our room at such late or early hours (as if they would have had tech staff available at these times). After a tussle, she cut the bill in half, which irritated me. Had I complained earlier in the week (or lied and said I did), they would have removed the whole charge. Since we had no issues with wifi at the convention center or the airport, I think the issue was with the walls in the room. Overall, I thought the whole battle was unbecoming a high end business hotel in which the wifi is pure profit. But lesson learned - next time I'll complain earlier. Overall, I liked the hotel and it provided most of the amenities I expected for the price and for a convention hotel. However, I would probably give the Fairmont Pacific Rim a try on the next visit - chic and gorgeous with a better lobby bar scene.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing start to an amazing trip!”
Reviews.Author: vacationmlc
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific was a great start to our Alaskan Cruise, bags were taken from the room right to the room on the ship. Breakfast was exceptional, views were great

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: GEW5
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel on Canada Day after a long flight from Dublin. There was a lot going on in the area. We went to check in with very long queues that seemed to take forever but when we eventually got to our rooms we were very pleased. Breakfast was excellent and location was excellent. We had a three night stay and then we were heading to Victoria for a night so the hotel kindly kept our luggage for us so we only had to bring an overnight bag to Victoria. On our last night stay after returning from Victoria the hotel once again kindly agreed to give us a continental breakfast to go as we were gettin an early train to Seattle. Staff very friendly and rooms very spacious would highly recommend this to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great location, contemporary styling, and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: CMfreqtrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pan Pacific for one night before going on Alaskan cruise. Location was great to be able to walk to cruise terminal (without much luggage) or take a three block taxi ride. Hotel was also a nice location for taking a long walk along the waterfront and into Stanley Park. Gym was oversized for a hotel of this size with a great range of machines including free weights and what looked like an exercise class or yoga room. Hotel lobby was spacious and inviting allowing either small or moderate sized groups to sit together without a crowd spilling into another table, Service was excellent in the lobby bar area for both appetizers and drinks. Room was pleasant with excellent view of the harbor and cruise terminal. Kept watching for my ship to come in (still waiting???) Shower was terrific. Would stay at pan Pacific again assuming a competitive rate.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Splurge!”
Reviews.Author: chloe55555
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel knowing it provided breathtaking views - which turned out to be utterly fantastic! We did upgrade our room, staying on the 23rd floor. It was worth the extra cost since it included excellant breakfasts in the Pacific Club (also on the 23rd floor), complimentary drinks our first night, complimentary evening Hors d'ovevres both nights, and free Internet access. Our room had high quality linens and toiletres. The King bed was very comfortable. Throughout our stay, the sftaff was very friendly, professional and helpful. I enjoyed using the Fitness room one day and jogged along the waterfront another day. The location is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre-Cruise Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Angiet2
Reviews.Content: Found a great deal thru Expedia ($200 per night, delux room incl. breakfast buffet for two) and since our cruise ship was going to literally be docked at Canada Place, how could we go wrong? We paid for an upgraded Inner Harbor room, BUT, we received a city view with a teenie tiny slice of a view of the water. I nicely went down to the front desk (it was after midnight when we checked in) and asked that they double check that we were in the room category that we paid for. The front desk attendant assured me that this was the room type we purchased, however, I still have my doubts. All of that being said, the hotel is lovely. They have Aveda bath products and fabulous linens on the bed. The breakfast was good. I was a bit suprised that the kitchen would not make me an omelette as I requested, without charging me an extra $15! When they price a breakfast buffet at nearly $30, seems that it wouldn't kill them to make an omelette. IMHO... Cab ride from the airport to the hotel, for two people with lots of luggage, was under $40. There is a ton of shopping and restaurants all around the hotel. It is really a GREAT location! I would not hesitate to stay here again, pre-cruise, if there was a good price on the room.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: kiekmich
Reviews.Content: While being on a business trip I stayed in the Pan Pacific Hotel in Vancouver, BC. This was one of the hotel highlights of many trips to north america: Hotel in perfect condition, world class service, the best view you can think of (had a room to the Bay / Stanley Park), the price was more than worth what I got. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A people-processing plant”
Reviews.Author: Catherine15
Reviews.Content: The one huge advantage the Pan Pacific has is its location, right by the cruise line terminal, so very convenient for pre and post cruise bookings. We had a top floor Pacific Club room. At around $600 the room size was average and the service sloppy (toiletries and tea/coffee hadn't been replaced). It's a typical showy corporate hotel - massive empty marble lobby, glass everywhere, and no soul whatsoever. Serves a useful purpose if you're joining a cruise, but don't expect the personal touch. We ate at both the Five Sails and the Cafe Pacifica, both overpriced and forgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, but room decor a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: pammyvancouver
Reviews.Content: Other than the emeral green and blond wood decor, I would have given this hotel a "very good" rating. Given that there are so many other 5 star hotels in town with a more modern room decor, I think the hotel needs to renovate in order to compete for travellers' dollars. Location is awesome, the outdoor pool is great (saltwater, heated, views of the mountains). The Sunday brunch is probably the best buffet in town with a wonderful selection of seafood, cold dishes, carvery and hot dishes....albeit pricey at $50/adult, $25/child, 5-and-under free. There were many pre-cruise and post-cruise guests at the hotel. Location is also great with views of the harbour, port and mountains. Close to the Olympic cauldron, and waterfront walking trail. Wonderful restaurants nearby (Gastown area) as well as the very important McD's across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your Wallet”
Reviews.Author: pointmtn
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire and stayed here two nights ($120 a night) 6/28 &6/29. When you use hotwire you never know where you'll end up.We were supposed to have a harbor view and if you pushed your face against the glass of our window and used your peripheral vision you can see some water. The help was snooty. I don't know how many times we walked past the bellmen and they never even made eye contact. Both people at the front desk made me feel rushed. Parking is $35 a day which I can accept but Corded internet is $16 a day. which is unacceptable. Advice:Go down to Starbucks at the entrance and get it for free. Also, there is a food-court across the street in a mall that you can use for breakfast. $80 for breakfast is a bit much. The hotel and city seem to pride themselves on their Eco-friendly Expensive European Image.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room, Great View, Great Honeymoon moment!”
Reviews.Author: Tophcat
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using Hotwire so we didnt know what we were getting until we had completed the transaction. Bit of a risk but boy did it pay off! Before we arrived I rang the hotel and asked if they could upgrade us as we were on our honeymoon and they did just that. We were upgraded to a King room with harbour views looking out over to North Vancouver. In the room we had a 42" flat screen LCD tv, lux bath robes, dining table chaise lounge, full mini bar service, A/C, bath/shower which also looked out over the harbour. The feel and quality of the whole experience was excellent. Location was great; its right on the water front and when the cruise ship is parked along side the hotel its very impressive. Just a 5 minute walk to centre of Vancouver and all shops and services. The Five Sails restaurant was very impressive as well, excellent food and wine and a breath taking view. Only one complaint and thats the fact that you have to pay for the internet which was free for all the other hotels we stayed in. The Pan Pacific definately made our honeymoon and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Warkslass
Reviews.Content: Stayed just two nights waiting for cruise. The two rooms, one was standard size with nice view of harbor, other was much bigger with a huge bathroom and a better view, so not sure which we paid for. Service was great, staff were excellent Hotel has all the ambience of a bus station, I'm afraid. OK for a quick stay but would like a little more comfort in public rooms for a longer stay. Continental breakfast was $25.00 Canadian. The hotel was discounting the US dollar! So real charge was closer to $30.00US. My suggestion is if staying there purchase meals and incidentals elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! what a view”
Reviews.Author: taratravel
Reviews.Content: Best location and perfect view of the harbor. Friendly staff and large comfortable rooms with enormous windows for watching the water activities. Within walking distance of Old Town and the steam clock. It is a bit of a walk to Stanly Park but well worth it. Next time I may rent a bicycle so we can see more of the park. The bartender didn't know the drink that I like but did a great job when I gave him the ingredients.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating Staff and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LexusGirl01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on an Alaskan cruise that was departing from Vancouver. The Pan Pacific is conveniently located right next door to the cruise port. The hotel is right on the waterfront and walking distance to Gastown. We booked a pre-cruise package, which included a late check-out (2:00 PM), breakfast at the buffet and our bags were taken directly from our room to the ship. Initially, we were given a room with an adjoining door. From experience, we know sound carries very easily with rooms such as this one. Therefore, we politely asked the front desk if we could be moved to a regular room. They upgraded us to a harbor view room without charging us. The room was nice, but the bathrooms need a little updating (i.e., cultured marble instead of real marble, older tile, etc.). However, the entire room was very clean and spacious. They also provide robes and complimentary slippers. The staff was very nice including front desk, restaurant, and bell man. I would recommend staying there if you are looking for a quieter stay (i.e., not downtown).

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms with Views, Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Qwikblip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre and post Alaska cruise and was not disappointed. Rooms are well appointed. Staff is responsive, they moved us when we had a problem with a noisy air conditioning vent late at night. Nice city views.

Reviews.Title: “Views over Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: grannyfranny89
Reviews.Content: This is a large business hotel. Nevertheless the service and welcome we received was personal and friendly. There were some drawbacks to our stay relating to the building work being carried out in preparation for the then forthcoming winter Olympics. We were also disturbed, early in the morning, by the hearty reveille on American cruise ships berthed just outside our bedroom window. On the other hand, the views over Vancouver Harbour were spectacular. The location of the hotel in Canada Place allowed us to explore most of central Vancouver on foot. The hotel is also conveniently situated for the flight planes, a special delight for visitors to Vancouver. The hotel has a super outside swimming pool which I used always a bonus in a city hotel. I would definitely stay in the Pan Pacific again if I ever have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: flygirl_7
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this wonderful hotel before going on an Alaskan cruise. The young man that checked us in couldn't have been nicer. Our room was spacious and we had a great city view. We slept so well in the big comfy bed! The hotel is located about the cruise terminal and the bellmen took our bags straight to the ship for us - the service at the Pan was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business meeting”
Reviews.Author: ksmithderm
Reviews.Content: About 50 business associates got together at the Pan Pacific Friday 4 - Sunday 6 June for a very productive series of meetings. Everything was perfect -- lovely large quiet hotel rooms with plenty of space to spread out laptops, papers and personal gear. Meeting rooms, audio-visual, dining and staff were all first-rate, with no glitches. The Pan Pacific is very well located, with wonderful views of Coal Harbour, and you can easily walk along the waterfront to the seaplane base, the ferry terminal, or Stanley Park. I would certainly come back here for a meeting, or bring my wife for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little extra touches...”
Reviews.Author: T-loves-B
