Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 2009 and March 2008, and love this hotel (and the Spa Utopia that is here as well). Little things, like great front desk people, custom carpet in the elevators, very plush, with the day of the week embossed - stuff like that. Great view of the city or harbour. Be sure to take in a Sunday brunch if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for pre-cruiser and non pre-cruiser alike”
Reviews.Author: zz_forever
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel where cruiser board onto the ship, so it's a popular hotel amongst the cruisers, but this is a great hotel for non cruiser as well. Rooms were good size, and comes with everything one needs. The location is great, short distance to all tourist places including Stanley Park. Hotel Staffers were very accommodating. The only thing is the parking fee. About 20 CAD per day.

Reviews.Title: “Looks great”
Reviews.Author: CookieM0nster
Reviews.Content: Stayed here, July 2008. It's a very nice hotel, but feels more like a convention centre in the main lobby. Location is nice, but we found night we wanted to eat out, we walked for blocks and only found a food court open. I think it was a Sunday night about 9pm. There are plenty of restaurants near by, but they weren't open for some reason. (Hotel restaurant was too expensive for this bargain hunter.......only stayed here because of great rate via Hotwire)

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: tombond
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at this hotel and yet again i havent been let down. The hotel is close to down town shopping. The hotel has the use of the Sky Train under the hotel which is fantastic to get around I had a deluxe cornor room which had a balcony so i could sit outside and over look the mountains and the float planes going in and out of Vancouver. Looking forward for the next time i come to Vancouver so i can stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: KirstineDenmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. We only paid about 150 $/night (Hotwire), and thought it was a great deal. We didn't try their breakfast, but went down to the food court next door. We enjoyed our breakfast in the room in front of the big window. The pool was heated, and therefore nice in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Dont think about staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaE3
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. The rooms were immaculate and the staff were very friendly. The hotel is situated at the waterfront and is also above the cruise terminal. We loved watching all the cruise ships ocme and go. The swimming pool and jacuzzi are well located outside and were very well heated. The hotel is very well situated for all sightseeing. We have stayed in other hotels in Vancouver but if I went back again I wouldn't book anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: trav4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed 17 nights at this hotel and of course got a good price for the wonderful room. It overlooked the city and was very clean and comfortably. The bed was a king and so snuggly. Soft large bath robes where supplied. I have found in the past all the hotels I have been in these can be small and rough. Not these it was a treat to shower and wear these and settle to a night in watching the telly which was wide screen and large. Eating at this hotel was expensive. But inside near the entrance was stairs going underground to a food mall with a wide range of food for all tastes. We arranged to get married at the time and the hotel let us use the restaurant area before people arrived to to eat. Very helpful staff considerate to your needs. On the last night a little treat was found in our hotel room chocolate strawberries as a celebration of our marriage. Just one thing the rooms facing the mountains because of the sea planes taking off, you can hear the planes taxing to take off. We spent our last night in one of these rooms for the same price as a city facing room. As I said the staff are very accommodating. There is an outside pool only.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Faience44
Reviews.Content: I only spent a night in the Pan Pacific at the end of the Olympics and didn't really get to try out many of the facilities. Check-in was painless and even though the hotel was totally full (this was February 28th, last day of the Winter Games), I didn't hear a squeak from anyone. The walls are nice and thick and the beds are comfortable. The bathroom looked a little tired and the bath was tiny, but apart from that, I had no complaints. I'd like to come back and spend more time here. The location is on the waterfront almost in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Glostamember
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night but teh harbour and mountain view was glorious. Very comfortable , quiet rooms. ( in contrast to some of the public areas ). Excellent service and as we were leaving on a cruise it offered the added luxury of taking your bags directly to the cruise ship. No hassle, no stress. Great. However not sure how it would have fared for a longer stay as restaurants etc extremely busy preparing visitors for loading on to cruise shios.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: niceguy42
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable, wonderful views from rooms. The large umbrella things, you see at the cruse ship terminal, were in the center of the view from my window. The float planes were taking off and landing on our side of the harbor, and there was a backdrop of snow caped mountains in the background. No way to top it.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: SeesItAll
Reviews.Content: I was checked in to this hotel for a night for business and have to say wasn't terribly impressed. I stayed at the Seattle one last summer and that was nice and new and fun, but this one is need of an update. Your boring, typical business hotel. Breakfast room service was OK. Didn't have a chance to do any fitness center, or any other things. I was, however, very impressed by this small shop near the meeting space that does printing, copying, business services type. I was in desperate need for good, color copies, and not only did they do a great job in a less than 10 minutes, they charged it to my room! Dinner was good in the lobby lounge late at night, overlooking the water. I can't even remember what I ate, but I do recall liking it and being more impressed than what one would assume in a hotel lobby lounge. Next time I'm trying the Fairmont across the street, although I hear the Fairmont at the airport is a great option and not even close to your typical airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glacier Bay-Holland America”
Reviews.Author: SCWienke
Reviews.Content: Great for before and after Cruising, convenient, easy to board and disembark, they handle everything.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in easy reach of Robson Street and Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: Thegsmacs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific at the start of our honeymoon and to explore Vancouver for 3 days before heading to Banff for skiing. We arrived about 10 days before the Winter Olympics where the Pan Pacific was being set up as the Media Centre but this didn't detract from the service provided by the hotel - just created a more interesting hustle and bustle!! Once you get to the Reception level check in is friendly and quick and the Bell service was very efficient. Rooms are very clean, spacious with brilliany views (we were upgraded to harbour view which was awesome!) with good facilities ie flat screen tv/ tea/ coffee (albeit the wine provided on the hospitality tray was very over-priced so buy in!). The outside pool on the 8th floor looked great (although weather was not on our side to use it!) and we would be happy to recommend this hotel as a very comfortable base to explore Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: austom2
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great hotel to stay, especially if going on a cruise ship. Only complaint was Trevor in the hotel bar, hope he got the message after our 5c tip!!!! Overall great place, and great location we were able to walk everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Mickey_d31
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the PP prior to taking an Alaskan cruise. We picked the hotel purely based on location, as it is part of the same construction complex that includes the passenger cruise terminal. It was possible to take the lift from the hotel straight to the cruise terminal access area. Very handy. We were not really looking for anything other than a place to work off a night's jetlag, but the hotel proved to be very nice. The location, obviously was spot on, and the staff were helpful and polite. The room that we had booked was very spacious, more like a mini-suite and was very well laid out. We didn't have time to try out the other facilities on offer (other than the swimming pool, which was a tad on the small side). If you don't fancy using the (slightly pricey) restaurant in the hotel, there is a food court over the road in the basement of the Fairmont building. Ideal for that 05:30 breakfast that is so essential when jetlagged!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel. Got it on a deal. Breakfast yuck”
Reviews.Author: helensnow
Reviews.Content: Great location and yes i would stay there again but only if there is a great deal. Stayed in a two bedroom apartment. mmmmm not very much room really. What you would expect in europe not canada. Staff were pleasent, breakfast was nice on the first day but they serve the same limited menu for breakfast each morning and not really that nice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and views, impersonal atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: nwmouse
Reviews.Content: We went to Vancouver B.C. for Christmas 2009, and I got a great rate for this hotel on Hotwire (as most of you did!). This hotel cannot be beaten for the location. Exquisite views of the harbour, snow-capped peaks, city lights and situated next to Robson street. I was prepared for the parking charge of $30 per day as Vancouver is an expensive city to park in. What annoyed me was the internet access charge of $20 for 24 hrs! Come on guys, we spent enough on breakfast and parking, why not give free internet access like most hotels? The room decor was adequate - circa 1980 feel and the bathrooms are extremely basic and need updating. But we got the best views and location in Vancouver so overall I was happy. This is a huge convention centre hotel, so don't expect anything intimate and personal. We spent most of our time outside the hotel, visiting Stanley Park's Christmas lights (stunning!) and the aquarium which was world class. Good value for this hotel if you book though Hotwire, but I wouldn't call this hotel 5 star. It's a 4 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room (Shame about the Refurbishment)”
Reviews.Author: knutsford1
Reviews.Content: When we stayed, the main reception area of the hotel was being refurbished which meant it was a bit of a mess. The hotel was also totally full due to local events. The check in staff were very helpful and it didn't take too long before we were in our room. it is a big big big hotel but perfectly situated for the cruise lines. We were on an NCL cruise and all we had to do was call the bell boys and they came up within 5 mins(at 11.45, 15 mins before check out) to get our bags and even put the labels on for us. We next saw our bags outside our room on the boat about 4 pm. We tipped 10 dollars but thought this a bargain and meant we only had to carry our carry on bags and could spend 3 hrs more in Vancouver. I can recommend the IMAX theatre which is in the same building. Whilst staying at the hotel in August or July check if the 'Celebration of light fireworks show is on in Vancouver. There are 4 heats each year for the world fireworks championship. it is about a 30 min walk from the hotel in English bay and attracts arround 200,000 people. I have never seen a place so busy but it was well worth it. about a 25 min firework display on a barge on the water. get there at least an hr early if you want any chance of a seat on the floor. be prepared to stand. It is AMAZING! The rooms were excellent. There was a nice big bed with beautiful views over the harbour and mountains(floor to ceiling windows) there is also a neat toilet door that closed off the bathroom in one position and the toilet in another. WI-FI is not free and costs $14.95 per day!! There was a massive 50 inch plasma in our room which provided the usual crap American channels. It was an easy walking distance to robson street where all the shopping is and then onto china town. Overall a really nice hotel and the aircon was appreciated when it was 33C outside!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 66mercgirl
Reviews.Content: We were convinced to try out the Pan Pacific by taking adavantage of a recent TravelZoo offer with very reasonable rates. My husband had stayed there when it was newer and reccomended it as being alright. We booked our room Nov 4th, for Dec 9/10. So plenty of advance time. We got to the hotel and were advised upon check in that they did not have our room available. This was at 5:00pm so not exactly late. We were told we would need to upgrade to another room for an extra $60 a night. Sort of defeated the TravelZoo promo. The front desk clerk was unhelpful and we were told the booking was non refundable and in no way were we guaranteed to get the room we booked, since it was booked at a sale price. Would have been nice to know that when we booked. We got the impression we were a bit second class since we didnt pay full price. The room and facility itself was alright, nothing too extraordinary. Worth noting if you need internet access its an extra 15.95 for 24 hrs, parking is also an extra $30 overnight. .Local calls from your room also cost. We ended up with $200 in surcharges over 2 nights , and no, we didnt hit room service or the mini bar :) I realize I sound like the money was an issue, not so, it just drives me crazy when places charge a premium for basic services, like its something exclusive to make a call or use the internet. rather than just charging a higher room rate and including the basics you'd expect. Nice views though and a good location for some business we had downtown. I did email the customer service rep regarding their booking policy, and our disappointment on not receiving the room we booked or any advance notice there might be an issue . That was on the first night of our stay. I was hoping it was just an oversight by the front desk, but I have not recieved any response, confirming our feeling our business wasn't valued. We frequently stay at the Fairmont Airport or Hotel Vancouver when in town and will likely return there as the rooms are nicer and we've never run into any issues there.

Reviews.Title: “perfect.”
Reviews.Author: DeeanaLynn
Reviews.Content: Perfect location...perfect rooms. But what really makes a hotel stand out is the service, right? Could NOT have been better. Friendly, helpful, outstanding. From the valet to the concierge, truly first class. Beds and linens were soft and comfy, house cleaning staff was A+. Laundry was turned around in 2 hours. Excellent advice from every employee as to where to go/what to do.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Retreat Set Against The Beauty of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Michael_SD
Reviews.Content: After several trips to Vancouver, and always seeing the Pan Pacific, I finally decided to book a room there on my recent trip. It was a short one night stay as we were leaving on a cruise, and we only wish we had had the opportunity to spend much more time at this wonderful hotel. Our stay didn't start out so smoothly. We had an early morning flight, so we arrived to check-in at the hotel at 9am. They didn't have a room ready for us (which was fine and what we expected), so the lady at the front desk took our mobile number and said she'd call us when a room was ready. Once it got to be 4pm (check-in time) and we still hadn't heard anything, I went to the front desk to inquire. They seemed confused and claimed that we had already been provided a room key. When we said that we hadn't, more confusion ensued. At this point, Ash, one of the gentlemen at the front desk was trying to assist us. I assume the original room we had reserved was unavailable, because Ash offered us an upgrade to a corner suite. He did mention that it was a smoking room, but we could try it and let him know if it would work for us or not. When we opened the door to the room, we were amazed. It was a beautiful room, with windows on all sides and spectacular views of the harbor. The linens were high quality and the beds were amazingly comfortable. The room was spotless and obvious care had been takien in cleaning and maintaining the room. I have stayed at several 5-star hotels, and this room ranks among my top favorites. The hotel itself is lovely as well. When we were there, they were just finishing up renovations and the whole place sparkled. Some of the staff was aloof, as previous reviews have mentioned. But we were impressed by the service we received from Ash at the front desk and Shelley at the concierge desk. The hotel is perfectly located in downtown Vancouver and right on the water. In fact, we were able to wake up in the morning and watch our cruise ship dock from our room. The hotel is located at Canada Place. And, admitedly, the hotel is a little awkward to navigate. Access from the outside deck areas to the rest of Canada Place is blocked, so it takes a bit of walking all the way down a couple of levels and back to the front of the hotel to access Canada Place. Also, finding the hotel's gym is a wild goose chase, as it is seperate from the hotel and actually in the parking lot for the cruise ship terminal. It is a great little facility, though, once you figure out how to access it. We ate buffet breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, both the morning we left for the cruise and the morning we returned, and really enjoyed both the service and the food - they have these fantastic serve-yourself smoothies in pitchers available - and all of the rest of the food was terrific. We were really happy with our stay here. It is a high-end hotel that is not cheap, but well worth it. You can't find a better location in Vancouver. You will really as if you are in lap of luxury at this Pan Pacific property.

Reviews.Title: “Top Five but Certainly Not Number One”
Reviews.Author: Overseez
Reviews.Content: I like the Pan Pacific. I’ve stayed there three or four times on business over the past five years and each visit was without incident. I always get a good night’s sleep on a great bed, the room service is (pricey but) satisfying and well-presented. Staff tend to be helpful. The location is “tourist perfect” and the views, even the standard city views, are captivating. With a Starbucks on the front entrance that opens at 5:30 a.m., Skytrain connections right close by, and all of downtown on your doorstep, it’s a great hotel and I recommend it. However, it bills itself as a luxury hotel and it comes up short in many ways. First, they still use keys. It feels like 1977, a step away from Fawlty Towers (and it’s also a nuisance to carry a key around when any other location would use a card that fits in your wallet). The bathrooms are functional but small. The restaurants, public spaces and banquet rooms, with their unrivalled harbour setting, are awesome, but the food is just OK. In some other places, OK food might pass. Not here. Vancouver has one of the most interesting, diverse and mouth-watering food scenes in North America. The Five Sails, ostensibly a high end restaurant, is just out of synch with its competition and not up to snuff for what it charges. At least the Four Seasons recognized this two years ago, renovated, and opened Yew, which is both an inviting space and a dinner destination. There’s absolutely no one living in Vancouver that would make the Pan Pacific their dinner spot of choice, unless of course they couldn’t get into West or Yew or CinCin or Vij’s or Market or Lumiere or, you get the picture. Also, with a Shang ri La up the street, a new Fairmont opening up adjacent shortly, to say nothing of the absolutely exceptional Fairmont Waterfront and Terminal City across the street, the Pan Pacific seems content to let things be rather than pick up their socks and get with the program. I would put the Pan Pacific in my top five, but it sure wouldn’t be number one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and views”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaChristiegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct 8-11/09 and thought the location of this hotel is what sets it apart from other hotels in downtown Vancouver. LOCATION: Downtown Vancouver, over looking the harbour & Stanley Park. Easy access to the "Canada Line" and transit, Gastown, Stanley Park and Robson Street. There are beautiful walkways along the harbour with places to stop for coffee, lunch, a drink or simply to sit on a bench & enjoy the view. It's attached to the Convention Centre and cruise ship dock as well. About 25 minutes via taxi from the airport or you can take the Canada Line train. You enter the hotel on street level but take either the escalator or elevator up 2 floors to the check in area. ROOM: We asked for one with a view of Stanley Park and the harbour-we weren't disappointed. The room itself was slightly dated with older carpeting and the shower/tub should be updated. The king size bed was very comfortable and had crisp, clean linens. There was a nice lounge chair that faced the large windows overlooking the harbour. Also handy to have an in room safe, umbrella, fully stocked mini bar with snacks and a 40 inch HD flat screen television with all the channels & movies you could want. Very good toiletries were provided and there is a handy make up mirror as well. Note that when you check in they offer you a "complimentary newspaper", which is the Globe & Mail. When you look at the holder for your room keys, it actually says if you decline the newspaper, the cost per day will be deducted from your bill. You also receive an actual key instead of card access. Therefore, anyone can access the room floors via the elevators and I did notice signs posted saying "no view" at the elevator area. DINING: For breakfast we simply walked over to the food court (connected to the hotel underground) which has a vast array of dining options (including Tim Horton's for coffee). There is a restaurant open for breakfast in the hotel if you prefer or order room service. We chose to eat dinner away from the hotel as well, but there is a beautiful dining option at Sails. In the lounge we sat and enjoyed coffee & drinks while listening to the entertainment of piano and singing. It was fabulous, with large windows overlooking the habour lit up at night. FITNESS/SPA: We finally located the fitness centre, which is in the parkade. The equipment was newer and the facility wasn't busy when we checked it out (your room key is required to enter). The spa was fantastic and very busy. They offer every service imaginable-we had a couples massage & were given 10% off with our stay. We also enjoyed the outdoor heated pool and jacuzzi. There is an area with fresh towels to use and tables & chairs around the pool....again, great views. SERVICE/SHOPS: Checking in and out was a breeze. We found the front desk staff helpful in providing maps and ideas of where to eat outside of the hotel. Our room was cleaned to our satisfaction. Service in the lounge was attentive and prompt. There are several shops for gifts and necessities as well. Overall we were very pleased with the Pan Pacific Hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend prices makes PP a good choice. Ask for a view”
Reviews.Author: Albert K
Reviews.Content: Good & helpful welcomes from this 500+ room hotel next to convention centre. Good location as wonderful views if high enough, but a little out of downtown for walking/shopping. Room excellent. Buffet breakfast included in rate excellent. Nice lunch in lounge overlooking harbour, but not cheap! National car rental in foyer/garage! Against: NO free Wi-FI (remarkable for a business hotel! Parking very expensive $30+ overnight

Reviews.Title: “Panaromic view of the ocean....”
Reviews.Author: amit_taniqsh
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel for 3 days and it was a great experience in 2006.The view is terrific from the room window.i am again planning to go to vancouver in the comming summers and would like to stay at the same place.food is also great.....Must visit the hotel on saturday nights and sunday afternoon for dinner and lunch...!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocrity at a premium price”
Reviews.Author: Desespoir
Reviews.Content: It was a nice place to stay, however I would not choose this hotel on my own (it was an expenses paid trip booked for me for business). The location and hotel are both beautiful but the staff is distant and aloof. Being from Vancouver I can say that there is a certain arrogance of locals amongst tourists. They assumed I was a tourist because I checked in with my passport and I definitely noticed it. I know this because when I checked in (a separate stay) with local ID the *same staff members* treated me like a local. I have seen them treat minorities poorly too, as another review said. I will recommend this hotel for white people with a BC license, but not tourists and not minorities. Great place if you have money to burn or it's free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice even w/renovation for 2010 Olympics”
Reviews.Author: da_kaz
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 young kids stayed at the hotel during the spring break. The hotel was undergoing exterior renovations, like most of the city, for the 2010 Olympics in Vancouver, B.C. Nonetheless, we were very impressed with the hotel. The room was very clean, large and spacious. The front desk was as accommodating as could be with requests for early check in and late check out, as well as helping to give change for currency and directions/tips for sightseeing. I used the exercise facility in the late evening and was impressed with the variety of machines and dumbbells. We also appreciated the close location to public transportation and the slew of taxis waiting to take us where we needed. One shortcoming was the lack of free Internet/wireless, but that was resolved by going to Blenz Coffee just down the block. Another issue is that the hotel restaurants are very expensive, but luckily it is very close to downtown Vancouver and it's not hard to find places to eat lunch or dinner. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and it made the other hotels we stayed at afterward seem much worse than they would have otherwise. Should we go to Vancouver again, I'd definitely want to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: JanaliSydney
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to transport, shopping and Stanley Park. Food court nearby and right next to Skytrain, float planes and the Seabus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location. Your opinion will be based upon your price.”
Reviews.Author: redtexas
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific hotel is very nice. It has the standard amenities of any upscale hotel: robes, room service, restaurants, Aveda products, cleanliness, etc. What it's lacking are a few things that make this hotel "exceptional." First, a minor point to some, major to others, is the fact that you have to go outside to get to the Starbucks. The hotel advertises this resource, however, you must actually leave the hotel, and turn around to access. Depending on weather, this could be significant. Second, the location is "good". We were able to walk to some of the tourist areas pretty well (Gastown), but definitely needed a taxi for most areas. The one great thing is that it's right next to a subway terminal. We ended up using the subway a few times, although downtown Vancouver is not fully established as a subway city (metro Vancouver definitely is). This hotel is quite new. If you like the newness of hotels, you will appreciate this one. On the contrast, it does not have much character or personalization. Your preferences will guide this. My title says it all. Your price will determine how much you like/dislike the hotel. If you pay $400+/night I can easily see how you might be disappointed. We got a great deal on Priceline and really enjoyed our stay. We have no complaints with this hotel, and hope to stay here again some day from Priceline. Be sure to budget for a car - approx $30 US/night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: mmuller2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver for 2 nights. It was nice, but overrated. - We arrived late at night. We were fine with our own suitcases, but still, nobody offered to take them for us. Not what we expect from a hotel of that calliber - Rooms were nice and clean, but small and nothing spectacular. - Nice Views - Hotel is massive. Not romantic. I'd think of it more for business travel than leisure travel. - Well located (we walked most places from the hotel). - Concierge was helpful, but desk not staffed well enough. For a hotel of that size, should have more staff on hand. Frequently had long waits at the concierge desk. Also, while very helpful will recommendations over on sites to see, not that helpful in person on restaurant recommendations. - Breakfast was good but VERY expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: emtbvms
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for three nights before departing on a cruise on the Silver Shadow. We had booked a Pacific Harbour View room (#2324) on the Concierge level for approximately $400US a night including tax on their website. This rate included a daily buffet breakfast, daily hors d’oeuvres and a cocktail the first night. Because we were on the Concierge Level, we had been instructed to take the elevator up to the 23rd floor and check in there. This avoided all the confusion that many TA contributors have stated about regular check in on the main level. The room, while smaller than anticipated, was recently redone, and the furnishings and other appointments were quite nice. There was ample room to store our cruise luggage. The view from the room was the reason that we chose this hotel. We had a beautiful view of the shoreline of Vancouver, Stanley Park, the Lion’s Gate bridge and North Vancouver which was spectacular. As an additional benefit, we were able to see our ship arrive and watch it dock at the pier. The breakfast selection, while limited, was quite sufficient. They had a pod coffee machine which made superb espresso. The hors d’oeuvres were much better than anticipated, and the honor bar was stocked with a nice selection of wines, liquor and soft drinks. The staff in the Concierge lounge was helpful and attentive. While we could have let the hotel deliver our luggage directly to our ship, we opted to take it ourselves, which was quite easy. We took the hotel elevator down to the embarkation level and managed to navigate our way through the hoards of debarking/embarking passengers from two large ships that were also docked at Canada Place. The hotel is a large, impersonal, busy place with conventions and meetings taking place frequently. However, what it lacks in intimacy and charm, it makes up for in location, location, location! Also, if you stay on the Concierge level, you have a much more relaxed experience than in the rest of the hotel. If we were to cruise out of Vancouver again, we would definitely stay at the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Polished & professional but lacks the homely feel.”
Reviews.Author: LeatherheadWidgeon
Reviews.Content: The entrance lobby up the escalator to reception resembles a cruise ship. That said, it is a grand building with internal features to match. It is very spacious, but seems more at home with dealing with conference delegates than just tourists. Our superior room on the 21st floor lived up to its billing, with fantastic views of the harbour, mountains and Stanley Park. The neighbouring cruise ship terminal was not a problem for us. Indeed, on one occasion 3 cruise ships had obviously tied up overnight and we hadn't heard a thing. Similarly, the seaplane base is situated quite close to the Pan Pacific and they do operate at regular intervals thoughout the day (from 7am to 7pm), but their activities are not especially intrusive, at least not from the 21st floor! Eating in the Pan Pacific is a bit limited. The breakfast buffet offers the standard fare. It's beautifully presented, if a little expensive compared to other buffets in similar quality hotels elsewhere. The dinner menu offers rather limited choice, again on the dear side and the service was not especially swift. We ate in the Cascades Lounge, but you need to be seated quite early (6pm-7pm) to be sure of a table by the window overlooking the harbour. A note of warning though, on our last night in the restaurant/lounge, a mouse scuttled across the floor while we were eating. Pointing this out to our server, it was evident that this was by no means an isolated incident or the first such incident. Indeed, we were informed that one of her colleagues had spotted one earlier. Local building works and the nearby cruise ship terminal were blamed for disturbing the local rodent population!! Stanley Park is do-able on foot from the hotel if the weather is good. If not local buses run right outside the hotel. Stanley Park is highly regarded. Yes, it's a lovely park but nothing really to set it apart from lots of others around the world. If you plan on taking in a whale watching tour off Vancouver Island, beware that the coach and ferry option to take you to your whale boat company in Victoria will take approx 5 hours door to door. After 3 hours on the whale boat watching the resident population of Orca (killer whales) that are magnificent, there is then the prospect of another 5+ hours return trip to your hotel. If the weather is not especially good, it can seem like an eternity. Another option to consider, which we took advantage of, is to catch a seaplane (for approx CDN$250 for 2), which will drop you off almost outside the Pan Pacific in 35 minutes from Victoria. It was brilliant, and the smoothest take off and landing you're ever likely to experience. While in Vancouver we'd booked a day trip to Whistler on the Whistler Mountaineer. I'm sorry to say Whistler didn't live up to our expectations. It's a rather small village and naturally enough caters almost exclusively for the winter sports set. It's scenery is stunning, though and in danger of being overwhelmed by all those who descend on it for the 2010 Winter Olympics. The 3 hour journey on the Whistler Mountaineer was absolutely brilliant. The onboard team and their service could not be faulted and we loved every minute of the journey. If you get the chance do it.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Debarkation after Cruise to Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: fierycale
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled on an Alaska cruise with our 2 year old daughter. We booked the Pan Pacific as our post-cruise hotel primarily for the location. The hotel did not disappoint. As we saw others queue up for buses, cabs, and other transfers, we were able to walk past everyone straight to the elevator to the hotel. The hotel also had our room ready a couple hours early so we could check in at noon. The room amenities were nice and we enjoyed a very large room, including convertible queen sofa for our daughter. Most rooms have great views of either the bay or of downtown. We enjoyed a delicious (but pricey) room service breakfast in the morning. The location is also very easy for airport access using the new Canada line to the airport. It's a short 1.5 block walk to the train terminal and about a 20 minute ride to the airport. All very easy even for out of towners. As a travel agent with Eden Exploration, I would highly recommend the Pan Pacific to my clients and others for all post cruise stays.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice but there are probably better hotels downtown”
Reviews.Author: JenBR
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the last night of our vacation. Our rate was $166 USD including tax so about half of the online reservation rate. We received a room with two double beds (wish we had gotten a king-size) overlooking the train tracks but with a decent view to the sides (could kind of see the mountains and cruise ships docked). The hotel was undergoing renovations on the entrance floors so it was a bit hectic trying to figure out where check-in was. The hotel service people were very nice but obviously busy. The hotel lobby was crowded with many cruise ship guests going to and fro. Once we checked in though, the room was very nice and quiet. The room was a bit small for what I was expecting (giving then rack price of over $300) but the bathroom was gorgeous and the beds were heavenly. The TV was a flat panel and huge. The décor was modern but not amazingly luxurious or anything special. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. We took the 257 bus from the Horseshoe Bay ferry terminal and then walked to the hotel from the bus stop at W. Georgia and Burrad. Really quite convenient and cheap compared to taking a taxi. The main downside to the Pan Pacific was that it was totally not cute, or homey, or anything like that – it felt like everyone was busy. Actually it felt like staying in a huge conference center or something. Overall this hotel was worth $166 dollars given its great location and nice beds and bathroom but I would recommend checking out some other downtown hotels such as those on Robson Street. If booking on Hotwire or Priceline also consider some of the non-5* hotels because I’m sure there were other 3* and 4* hotels that would have been just as nice as the Pan Pacific and maybe even a few dollars cheaper. The Pan Pacific was nice but definitely not a 5* hotel by any means. I’m sure there are better values out there if you use Hotwire or Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thainy001
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Pan Pacific for 5 nights after travelling from Toronto. We paid for a superior harbour/mountain view room and it was well laid out with a lovely view. I must admit that the price we paid was probably not worth it as the room itself was not that fancy from other hotels I've stayed in. The rooms were very clean. The hotel itself is located at Canada place where the cruise ships come in. Very handy if you are on/off your ship The Restuarants are expensive. Be warned. The breakfast is also expensive. We opted to eat out a couple of times at the food courts just across the road. One thing I will say is that the Sea planes take off early in the morning around 7am and they are very noisy. So, if you are a light sleeper and fancy a lie in, take ear plugs!. Oh, before I forget, House keeping starts early too, so, we always put on our "do not disturb" sign on the door until we left for the day. All in all, I'd stay there again, but I would try prices at the Shangri-La also.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...”
Reviews.Author: h0bn0b
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as it was ideally located by the cruise terminal. You only need to use the elevator and you are directly within the terminal for an easy check-in. The hotel was very busy when we arrived early so did not have a City View room available which we had booked. They kindly offered me the living quarters of one of the suites - even though there was only a sofa bed instead of a normal bed, the view was fantastic with a 180 degree view over the harbour. I was more than happy to have this room. Breakfast was a bit confusing as our rate had complimentary continental breakfast but we had to order this from a separate menu instead of helping ourselves to the laid out continental selection. Our rate involved our food coming from the kitchen! This was not explained very clearly at the time. All-in-all, a good stay with the location/view being the reason for giving it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect after cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: jipper
Reviews.Content: After our Alaska cruise (which we did for our Honeymoon), we jetted over to Victoria for a day and a night. After Victoria, we came back to Vancouver and stayed at this hotel. Great place, great rooms, a little expensive, but overall a great place. We had room service one night and ate at a little Indian restaurant another night. Room is big, clean, modern, and had great views over the harbor and the cruise ships. It is your typical high-end modern, clean, business-type hotel that is perfectly adequate and acceptable to all but the pickiest traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Would definetly stay again”
Reviews.Author: mrsbee09
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel. We had a room with the harbour mountain view that was spectacular. Very clean, bed was so comfortable! The staff was friendly. We only ate at Cascade Lounge for breakfast but the service and food was good. Great location for walking around downtown, shopping on Robson and Stanley Park. Skytrain station is right there, very convenient. We used the Canada Line to the airport and it was very efficient. Will definetly stay at Pan Pacific again.

Reviews.Title: “Choose This One For An Unforgettable Introduction to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: jeannemac
Reviews.Content: Because of its location, comfort, hospitality and spirit I would highly recommend this Vancouver hotel. I spent four nights here and was so pleased with the entire situation that, at times, I didn’t even want to go out exploring. My first room, booked through Hotwire.com, looked across the street to the rising towers of Vancouver. The second room, booked through the hotel itself, (which incidentally honored its pledge to beat a lower advertised rate and provided $75.00 in meal charges) overlooked the panorama of the inner harbor with its constant flow of float planes, cruise ships, tankers, tour boats, tugs and yachts. Add to this the cities on the distant shore, the backdrop of forested mountains, and an expansive sky animated by changing light and weather, and it became easy to linger at the window and just watch. What previous reviewers have said - opt for the even numbered inner harbour rooms - is correct: It is very worth the added expense. The hotel’s location also turned out to be important for other reasons. It is steps from the Waterfront Terminal which launches Sky Train, city buses and the little Seabus, a ferry that crosses the harbor to Lonsdale all day long. Skytrain’s brand new Canada Line brings visitors right to this terminal from the airport. Between the hotel and terminal you will find an underground food court for inexpensive meals. Canada Place and Imax share the hotel complex. Across the street is Vancouver’s visitor’s center. Guests walk the promenade along the landscaped shoreline to Coal Harbour where they can board a luncheon or dinner cruise. (Loved it!) One reviewer commented that the Pan Pacific has no soul. Actually, I think the Pan Pacific might have BECOME a part of the greater city’s soul. In terms of the accommodations, I was totally satisfied. Both rooms were lovely, quiet, clean and up-to-date. Linens: soft and white. Bathroom: marble and gold, with abundant hot water and fine bath products. Desk: generous. Thermostat: responsive. Privacy: complete. The staff morale seems uniformly high: Everyone I met appeared to be proud of the hotel and genuinely pleased to assist their guests. The concierge team, for example, was consistently willing to dig deep for details and quickly report back by phone and letter delivered to the room. All transactions in the lobby were smooth and friendly with no waiting, even when the large cruise ships had arrived in port. Restaurants were good, and on three evenings, as the day dimmed and the harbor lights began to glitter. I found every reason to dine in. Of course, its superb view and location are what make this a special property, but the comfort of the accommodations and the warmth of those at work in the lobby and restaurants (not to mention housekeeping) perfected my visit to Vancouver. What I experienced was a hotel in a five-star location that offers five-star hospitality without a single sign of burnout, arrogance, or exclusivity. In fact, there was a detectable level of positive energy among staff and guests alike. Other travelers I met expressed similar delight with their stay. Having sampled it, they would simply never chose any other hotel in the city of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kmax48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific at the end of August for 3 days before our cruise and was very satisfied. Arrived from the East coast at 10:30AM and even though check-in was not until 3 we thought we would give it a try. Very professional and pleasant front desk staff apologized that our room was not yet ready and that we could leave our luggage with them and go out, or we could upgrade to a concierge floor room that was ready on the top floor facing the harbor for $75 more per person total. For that additional charge we would receive complimentary internet, a private concierge staffed lounge with soft drinks, tea, coffee, breakfast in the lounge with wonderful fruits, pastries, breads, hot and cold dishes as well as afternoon snacks and evening appetizers which were first rate. This was in the end a bargain because we took full advantage of the amenities. The room itself had a great view of the harbor including Stanley Park, the sea planes coming and going and of course the cruise ships. We did not have a problem with outside noise at all, which some previous reviewers mentioned. They even provide you with a great pair of binoculars for you to enjoy. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds my wife and I have slept on in a hotel. The bathroom was very nice with marble everywhere and plenty of room. All of the staff that we came in contact with were very professional as one would expect from a 5star hotel. The construction that people are talking about was barely noticed and had no effect at all on the quality of our stay. The cruise ships for Princess and Holland America dock right at the hotel and are very convenient for their passengers. We were on the Royal Caribbean ship which leaves from a pier that is a 5 min. cab ride. There are no hotels near the Royal Caribbean docks and the area is industrial. This hotel offers the benefit of being within walking distance to so much that we canceled our rental car and enjoyed the beautiful sunny and warm days walking around. Shop around for the room price, often there are specials or packages, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Location"”
Reviews.Author: Paull59
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the previous review, the rooms were excellent, clean and tidy and have great views, Large LCD TV, with loads of channels,lovely big bathroom, but we only spent our time in our rooms, we did not spend any time in the hotel, the food and drink was so expensive, we didnt go anywhere near the bar or restaurtant. there was also a lot of work going on in the hotel, which did not help for the overall feel of the hotel, We went on an Alaskan cruise, and the hotel location for this was excellent, it was also very near to Chinatown,Gastown, and Robson St for shopping and all the tour buses stopped right outside, also from the hotel, there is a nice waterfront walk around the harbour to Stanley Park. Also worth mentioning is that you are connected from the hotel to the food court across the road, we had breakfast in there every morning at the Pita Express, very nice friendly guy called, Alberto, food cooked fresh, no microwave, reasonable prices, and he opens at 5:30am if you are suffering from the time diff from th UK.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star hotel, but lacking soul”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Deezel
Reviews.Content: It's a struggle to fairly review the Pan Pacific. On the one hand it ticks all the boxes you'd expect from a 5* hotel, but on the other, it feels souless, even compared with other luxury chain hotels. Staff were efficient and friendly, the room was clean, comfortable and had a great view, and all ammenities were as you'd expect from a hotel of its class. The trouble is, I'm finding it difficult to actually remember much about the hotel, beyond the views over the harbour to the North Shore of Vancouver, and that's the problem. The Pan Pacific is undoubtedly great for visitors using the adjacent conference centre and for business travellers, but needs to do something to differentiate itself before it can be completely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!! Worth every penny for the view. This is what it's all about!”
Reviews.Author: lawahoo2001
Reviews.Content: Vancouver is one of the most beautiful cities in the world, and the Pan Pacific offers you the opportunity to see one of the most picturesque harbors. We stayed for one night in this 5-star hotel after our Alaskan cruise. Very easy to get to from the cruise ship - just walk right through the cruise terminal at Canada Place, and you're there. I had booked the hotel in the spring by calling the hotel direct. The price kept dropping (I checked on-line every month), and the hotel allowed me to change my reservation to accomodate the price change each time (probably saved $150 this way). Excellent service in that respect. We booked a deluxe harbor view room, and it was spectacular. Lots of space, huge flat screen TV, very comfy king-sized bed, gorgeous and spacious marble bathroom, and the best view! I could have just stayed in the room all day. The package we booked included buffet breakfast, which was top notch (best breakfast of our 2 1/2 week trip). They were also very accomodating in letting us check in at 9am (I told them ahead of time that we would be there early off of the cruise ship). I will definitely be back to this hotel when I visit Vancouver! Highly recommended. I'll be posting photos later...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VIEW, CLEAN AND MODERN”
Reviews.Author: garyfong
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting five star, this is a four star, but it's very nice. The rates are reasonable (about 20% less than the four-star Fairmont waterfront across the street) and the view is really great. You get three feather pillows, plus two decorative duvets. They're a bit skimpy on the pillow size. The sheets are soft - very soft, not the softest but great, and the walls tend to be a bit thin. You can hear doors slamming in hallways (I stayed in 1022), people walking upstairs, and seaplanes and ferries noise is fairly transparent through the windows. The TV is not high def, and the lighting is flourescent (typically the sign of 4*, in my experience). My tub stop wouldn't work, and the tubs are pretty shallow and old-fashioned. There is no WIFI service available, so bring a computer that allows an ethernet connection. It's also expensive for comparison, at $14.95 a day. The restaurant is excellent, the room service rates about a B. Picture a Hyatt on Vancouver's waterfront, and you will not be surprised, in fact this feels like I am in a business-class Hyatt hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: MSNDIS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific August 10-11, 2009 and we got a great rate online (through the Pan Pacific web site). We had a small, city-view room. There are four of us (two adults and two teens) and the room was cramped. The picture on the web site shows a sitting area near the windows but our room did not have that. The bathroom was really nice and the service was spectacular. The location is within walking distance of Gastown and downtown. I assume it is also within walking distance to Chinatown but we didn't have time to go there. My husband also walked to Stanley Park but it was raining when our family was visiting the park so we drove. Our rate included a continental breakfast but when we checked in we were told it only included two per day. That was not specified on the web site even though other rates did specify that. I'm sure I could have argued and received four more breakfast vouchers but we decided to eat elsewhere the first day because we had a lot of sightseeing to do and wanted to be well-fed. The second morning we all used the vouchers and received . . . a choice of: bagel and cream cheese, two croissants, toast, muffin, pastry; a choice of juice; coffee; and a small cup of fruit. We could have upgraded to a full buffet breakfast for $15 each ($60 total) and we decided not to (there is a Starbucks and McDonalds nearby). Cost for parking was $30/night. They did have games kids could check out from the concierge which was a nice touch and the pool and hot tub area were nice. If I could get a good deal, I might stay there again but would never eat there. Overall, it was a nice hotel in a good location but the cost of the food in the cafe was ridiculous. Unfortunately for them, there are a lot of places to eat within a short walk of the hotel and it isn't necessary to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheen4r
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Pan Pacific in Seattle so thought I would try Pan Pacific in Vancouver, the staff were very friendly and on arrival upgraded up to a river/mountain view which was amazing. my partner had planned to propose to me, and the hotel organised a limo, flowers and a special meal for us, it was a dream come true and I had no idea :-) The room itself is very spacious, no faults at all, bathroom was pure luxury. Hotel itself is outstanding, I would definaly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, somewhat disorganized”
Reviews.Author: QuinnM
Reviews.Content: Now, I made a point of checking their website before we went for our romantic Valentine's Day stay. It said, very clearly, that they had a pool and hot tub. We got to the hotel and were pleased with our room and the quiet, helpful gentleman who brought our bags up and promptly ordered up a vase for my flowers. However, when we went to go find the pool, we walked in circles before noticing a boarded up wall with a sign posted up front. It stated that the pool was under renovation for the past few months and would be finished by ... the October that just passed. I stood there, fuming -- not only because there was no pool and hot tub, and that was the main reason for our going was to relax (I have a bad back) but because they were so bloody lazy that they couldn't be bothered to update their sign or their website. They suggested we use the pool at the hotel across the street (they'd made an arrangement), but we were concerned about the number of people who would be using it since ours was closed. Well, lo and behold, after I checked again right after Valentine's, the website had been updated to reflect their renos. How convenient that it was changed right after the rush. Overall, perfectly pleasant and nice staff, but just a little suspect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SGBQuebec
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in the Pan Pacific this last August. It was just perfect: really nice room, nice decoration, super comfortable bed, very comfortable and nice smelling pillows (you could even select the type of pillow if you wanted!).... even the bedsheets felt really cozy. The toilet was also really clean and nicely decorated. We had a City View and it was really nice sitting in the confy chairs by the window with a little glass of wine. The swimming-pool and hot spot was also very good..... and the location could not be better: just steps from everywhere in Vancuver (although I guess everything is close by in Vancouver). If you like sushi, the Oysi-Oysi was at walking distance from the hotel (in Albertini and Thurlow) and the sushi there was really good :-) We would definetely stay again in this hotel the next time we will go back to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: harrisment
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to a cruise.Arrived at hotel to find our room was not ready, receptionist told my husband to ring the housephone to check when the room was ready. When he tried to use the phone a little later she had given him incorrect information as to which number to dial.The conciege checked for him but room still not ready. When my husband went back to him about 20 minutes later he referred him back to reception where he had to queue again . Finally after an hour our room was ready. I think the standard of service we received was very poor, it should not be the guests responsibility to find out when their room is ready espiecally at a so called 5 star hotel. The room when we finally got there was good, very spacious and comfortable but having to hang around for an hour to get there soured the experience for me and I'm not sure I could recommend this hotel unreservedly. The service we recieved at the Pacific Pallisades last year was much better.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms with fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: sugarlandmom
Reviews.Content: Our family of 12 stayed in four rooms at the Pan-Pacific this July for one night before our cruise with Princess. I got a great rate on Orbitz, especially given the location. Three of our rooms were city-view, and one was ocean-view. There was plenty of space for us and our children, the beds were comfortable, and the bathrooms nice. We took advantage of the bell-hop service to transfer our luggage to our ship. The breakfast buffet was not cheap, even with our voucher discount, but it was hearty & delicious. We would definitely stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Where I always stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Wizardmate
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vancouver from London at the very least a couple of times a year on our way to our second home on the islands and always stay at the Pan Pacific. We always have a Harbour View Room with a breathtaking view. We have never found the staff to be anything other than helpful and courteous. Food in the hotel is very good although expensive however there are many cheaper options nearby. Last time I arrived with my dog and they had provided special amenities for him including dog bowl, plastic bags and a "greenie" treat. The spa at the hotel is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: Cartervan
Reviews.Content: Decent rooms, with a great view This hotel is first class, all the way Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: RollyT
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in Vancouver, we spent 3 nights at the Pan Pacific after getting a good deal on hotwire.com. And also 2 nights at the Sutton by Robson Street. (both awesome hotels) We prefered the Pan Pacific as the room was large and the bed very comfortable, we also had an awesome view over the city and water...very nice. If your an experienced traveller who doesn't seek or need alot of help from staff/valets etc and happy to cruise along on your own, then this is the place. Because of the size of the hotel, it can seem alittle impersonal at times, but thats what we like...we prefer not to have doors opened for us. If you want to be pampered, then stay at the Sutton Hotel by Robson St. Which is also very nice and staff are all too willing to help and greet. Make sure you check out the Granville Island Food markets and a japanese restaurant on Robson St called Ebisu between 4.30pm - 6.30pm for Happy Hour, food is stunning and staff amazing. Price even better!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5* when we went there”
Reviews.Author: RosanScotland
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we were going on a cruise which we were led to believe sailed from Canada Place and we would be able to walk on to the ship from the hotel. In fact Celebrity and Royal Carribean Cruises leave from another port a taxi ride away. When we arrived by car at the front of the Pan Pacific we were met by a valet who couldn't have been more helpful. So far so good. There is a lot of building work going on at the hotel. The entrance up to Reception is by an escalator which takes you through the construction area which looks dreadful. The Receptionist was efficient but not friendly. We had requested a high floor but were given a room on the 8th floor looking out on to a roof. The 8th floor is actually the bottom floor of the rooms. The room was spacious with a double bed, a setee and chairs, a large TV and a sink with units underneath. The bathroom was average size and unremarkable. We ate in the main restaurant on our first night. It was very very cold. My husband had to go up to our room and get jumpers for us (2 for me). We have never been so cold in a restaurant before. The food was good but unremarkable for the price. We had a swim in the pool on our first day which was nice. On our second day we were unable to use the pool as there was a wedding at the pool side. I'm sure if we had commented on this to the hotel we would have been told we could use the pool but you can hardly splash about in the middle of a wedding ceremony. Staying at this 5* hotel was meant to be the highlight of our trip and the most expensive but it was a great disappointment. For us this was definately not worth the money and definately not a 5* hotel. We would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Service could improve slightly for the price”
Reviews.Author: Fitzgerald13
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at the Pan Pacific in a superior room. Bed was very comfortable and the view was fantastic. I only ate the buffet in the morning and appetizers at the bar, but the food was very good (and expensive). The only downfall was the quality of some of the help and the locked accesses for the view. When I asked the concierge to help me find a restauraunt for my anniversary, he pointed me to a reasonably bad bar with mediocre food and he obviously didnt know much about the restaurant. Similarly, he seemed eager to point me towards a very expensive suspension bridge that I am sure was lovely, but I cant believe it was worth 64 dollars for the two of us to walk across. When I asked the girl manning the door about where to get a bus she pointed to the east and said somewhere over there. She also incorrectly told us we could get a water taxi to granville island from the harbor, luckily the concierge at the westin knew how to get there. Overall, we had a fantastic time in vancouver. but these few unknowledgable folks turned our expereince into a little more forgettable one.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap - but a quality hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Millie211
Reviews.Content: Probably the best location in Vancouver. Easy walking distance to Gastown; the Float Planes; Stanley Park and Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: rzrbkfn08
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 stayed here in July 2009 the night before we sailed on a cruise. The location is great for those cruising out of Canada Place terminal. Our crusie was from Ballentyne terminal, which was only a short cab ride away. Lots to do within walking distance, and all major tour companies stop right outside. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the bellman and treated wonderfully. The hotel was beautiful, although there is currently some construction in the lobby area, this didn't affect our stay. Our rate booked on travelocity came with contential breakfast which we didn't use. Rooms were beautiful and the views were great, and we didn't even have a harbor view room. The beds were probably the best I have ever slept on anywhere. The real part that impressed us is when we returned from our cruise the following Saturday, we had nothing to do with our luggage (6 bags, and five carry on bags) due to a miscommunication wtih the cruise line. The Pan Pacific allowed us to store our luggage there for the entire day since our flight was late the same night, locking it securely in their view. This to me is above and beyond. At that point, we were no longer guests and they still insisted that we go enjoy Vancouver and pick up our luggage when ever we were ready for it. The concierge also arranged for our transportation back to the airport. This was our first stay at Pan Pacific, but I am sure it will not be our last. This hotel really allowed us to relax and enjoy our vacation. Truly an exceptional hotel with outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: Travelaholic37
Reviews.Content: Received a complimentary upgrade to a room with a harbour/mountain view. After spending 14 hours on a plane and the day touring Vancouver, we were in need to a comfortable nights sleep. The beds were like sleeping on a cloud and the room was large and well appointed. Breakfast was costly, but there was a great variety to choose from. The hotel is above the Alaska cruise terminal and getting to the ship was as simple as going down in the hotel's elevator. Great place to stay if you are going on a cruise from Canada Place.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, great value/deal with package special; expectedly high parking fee.”
Reviews.Author: bikinghiking123
Reviews.Content: Booked a package of 3-night stay in two city view rooms with two queen beds each and a rental car for an astonishingly low price that I dare not disclose the remarkable value. Traveling with extended family and with a rental car, we were open to staying near the Vancouver Int'l Airport in Richmond, BC. Doggedly looked for deals at all the usual travel sites, and one day the homework paid off because Expedia had a one-day special offer sale... The package (2 hotel rooms+Hertz rental car) price we paid was $200-$300 USD LESS than staying at Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Express, River Rock Casino in Richmond,, The Sutton Place, Westin, Fairmont, etc....basically less than any other type of hotel, including budget to luxury chains. Granted, they were "city-view" rooms, which they disclosed in the deal, and supposedly more than 80% of the Pan Pacific Vancouver's rooms have harbour views. We overhead some cruisers ask if they could upgrade to a room with a view...the friendly hotel clerk said if they didn't mind a smoking room, she'd upgrade them to a harbour view room for free. So, there's a tip. This hotel and the Fairmont Waterfront right across the street are very popular amongst cruisers staying overnight. The parking garage fee, as expected in a major city, was $30CAD a day. Even so, our package was such a bargain that we were fine with the parking fees for a three night stay. After all, we traveled around the national Canada Day holiday period (and during America's July 4th weekend). The skytrain stop is accessible if you go to the ground floor (two escalators down from the check-in lobby floor) that can take you to the street exit, but continue down to the Canada Place/Waterfront food court. Signs show you the skytrain. Due to 2010 Olympics, they will expand Skytrain to the airport. That will be great, but if traveling with elderly relatives, a rental car is still the best way to take it easy on vacation. Tourist center is across the street. Pros: Pretty, clean, very well located. Great choice if you have a special deal. Cons: high parking fee if you really need to rent a car; you can hear neighboring rooms' showers and the doors are thin...you can hear guests talking at a normal decibel very clearly right outside your door; if your room's near the lifts/elevators, you will also hear the elevators go "ding ding" whenever they arrive at your floor. Turn on the TV loud to mask such noises.

Reviews.Title: “This was a perfect place to stay and close to many activities.”
Reviews.Author: melannjaq
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 2 pm to find that our room was ready. We asked where the closest place to rent bikes was and it was a 5 minute walk on the other side of the convention center. Only $6 an hour! They provide a map. We rode to Stanley Park and then around the Seawall. Well worth it on a beautiful day. You can watch the seaplanes take off too. There is a restaurant on your left as you're riding called "The Mill" Great food and service. The weather was so nice that we skipped the IMAX which is located right near the hotel at Canada Place. Pacific Center Mall is a short walk, as is Gastown. The staff were always attentive and friendly. There were many guests who were leaving for the Alaskan Cruise. Two ships were docked and we want to definitely stay in this hotel and take the Alaskan cruise next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Always Excellent, but Big and Impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Escape-Is-At-Hand
Reviews.Content: Pros: I've stayed in the Pan Pacific several times and have never been disappointed. Hotel staff are good, rooms are comfortable and the location is great. The rooftop pool with harbour and moutain views is always a treat especially at night. Cons: The hotel is very large and a bit impersonal, and access to the hotel is a bit of a pain as you have to take several elevators up from the ground floor conference centre area at Canada Place. Parking is extra as usual in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT comfort and service - - especially if taking a cruise from this port”
Reviews.Author: jd618
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel stay prior to our Alaskan cruise. The clean, spacious & comfortable room was a welcome place to rest after our flight from the East Coast. We walked across the street to the food court for dinner before turning in early. The room was quiet and the bed was so very comfortable. The next morning we called the Bellman . . .they took our bags and the next time we saw them was in our cabin on the ship. It was the easiest cruise check-in EVER!! Not having to haul our luggage was terrific. We look forward to staying here again the next time we are in Vancouver (espcially if we cruise!). We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. If you get a deal it's fantastic, pay full price you got robbed.”
Reviews.Author: OfficialPackerFan
Reviews.Content: Your enjoyment at Pan Pacific is all about how much you paid. If you paid full price expecting a 5 star hotel, with 5 star rooms, and 5 star service, you will NOT be happy. But if you got a deal, or a good rate, you'll probably love the place. It's a contemporary luxury hotel. It's a great location right on the water and a great spot in downtown (everything was close by). It has some of the best water views in all of Vancouver. But it's overpriced. We had 3 days planned (party of 5), we paid $600 for a suite (separate room king bed and living area and sofabed) with tax over $700+. We were so disappointed we left first thing in the morning (after reaching 1AM at night and 12 hours of flying). The room was crowded, city view, and the furnishings were AVERAGE. I couldn't believe the price we paid, and the service was not anything even CLOSE to 5 star. I was told these same rooms can go over only a couple hundred dollars, but there were TWO conventions going on, and a bunch of cruise ships in port. We jumped over the the Renaissance down the road, got TWO connected rooms and still was less than HALF the stupid suite we paid (FOR TWO ROOMS!). Also had perfect gorgeous view, 100 times better view than City view in Pan Pacific. Renaissance is not a luxury hotel, but was fine, price was so much better. Pan Pacific's location is both a pro and a con. It's a signature hotel for Vancouver. it's right on the water and literally attached to the cruise ship port. If you are on a cruise ship it's fantastic. You walk off the boat and take a couple steps and check into the hotel. The convention center is also a few steps away. But this leads to a CONSTANTLY PACKED hotel. You just aren't going to get top service with that scenario. It's crowded like mad with all the guest shuffling in and out of the cruise ships. DO NOT EXPECT OR PAY FOR 5 star service. Also annoying internet was not complimentary it was something like $20-30 a day, parking was extremely expensive too. If you are not leaving downtown, cabs and walking are a better option. At one point we needed a wheelchair and that took forever, because it seems like they only have ONE, and they can never find it (even though we called twice ahead of time saying we need it before we go). On our second stint back to Vancouver a manager got us a room, it was MUCH bigger. While it was one room it was oversized, so it was TWO double beds and had plenty of room for a rollaway. Had an amazing view of the harbour, and it was wide open and spacious for $250-$300. It was LESS THAN HALF the cost of a suite but so much better than that terrible suite. The second time around was better, the first try was awful but still it's all about your expectations. Don't expect Ritz, 4 Seasons, 5 star hotel service and don't pay for it like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a joyeous hotel. Great service, food & accommodations”
Reviews.Author: screenerStLouis_MO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location returning from, or leaving for a cruise, or if you are there just to see or visit the most beautiful city in the world. There are all kinds of activities for adults and families, great, interesting restaurants, and views from every where. Shopping is abundant, but expensive. Bike rides through Stanley Park, boat rides, and the Calipano Park if fabulous. I could have spent a week there and wish I had rather than taking an Alaskan cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room!! Lovely facility in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: 4trish123
Reviews.Content: This is a first rate hotel and it is in a great location. The hotel decor is contemporary and it is extremely nice. The 17th floor room was very large with a sitting area and a nice city view. The front desk staff and reservation staff were unfriendly and unhelpful and this detracted from an otherwise lovely property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DTen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights before a cruise at the end of May with my mother. The hotel is run very well and the rooms were beautiful and the food in the restaurant, as well as room service, was very good. We got a harbor view room and it was well worth the price...it made our stay in Vancouver very special. They transferred our luugage to the ship for us at no cost. The ship is located steps away from the hotel. We never heard any noise from any other room, etc.

Reviews.Title: “cruisers: Don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: seetheworldb4wedie
Reviews.Content: HAL recommended this as a hotel "near" where their cruises originate. We could literally toss our luggage from the hotel's outside cafe onto the ship! But handling our luggage oursleves was NOT necessary; the valet picked up our luggage from our room and it was waiting in our cabin after we boarded. Luggage handling was not the only ammenity for cruises. Access to NCl and HAL cruise checkin was made throught the hotel's enclosed parking lot. It enabled an earlier and hassle free start. The hotel's room service was quick and delicious. The morning buffet was convenient if a little pricey ($25 for cold buffet/$29 with eggs and pancakes). However, we received a $25 restuarant credit when booking directly with the hotel. The room was spotless, spacious and had a great view. Staff was friendly and very informative. Our only complaint was we wished we had arrived earlier to enjoy the inviting pool and hot tub we could see from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, contemporary luxury hotel --nice location and views”
Reviews.Author: BobakLives
Reviews.Content: On a quick jaunt through the Washington/British Columbia Pacific Northwest, I stayed at the Pan Pacific for an evening --and I was very impressed. I actually got the hotel at a reasonable price through the blind-purchase off of hotwire, when I found out I'd got a room at the Pan Pacific (already knowing the prominent location), I was very pleased. Despite sitting on the lower end of the reservation totem pole (as all of use who use hotwire/priceline/etc tend to be), they gave me a nice room on a higher level. The rooms are either bay or city view --with the bay being more desirable (you get the tremendous views of the water and North Vancouver). They gave us the city side, which wasn't bad at all --the sight lines from all the rooms are good; there's no building that's sitting point-blank right in front so you can see a good chunk of the expansive, modern glass skyline that's erupted in this city over the last decade. Besides, you can get excellent views of the bay from the lobby, the various restaurants, or just walking on the deck of the connected Canada Place. The room itself was well appointed --it was an oddly shaped room, which made it spacious with plenty of large windows, a couch, a large bathroom, large flat-screen TV, a very comfy bed and everything was clean. It was the sort of room that cheers you up when you enter it. Since this hotel fights to be a five star, it had robes, plenty of good bath products, and an umbrella for use during the stay (we didn't need it, thankfully). They have the option of delivering a variety of pillows to your room, we chose the temperpedic, and they were delivered very quickly --a big plus as it was later in the evening. The facilities are what you'd expect: the hotel is attached to the original convention center (itself built for the Canadian pavilion of 1986 World Expo, which I attended), as well as a major cruise ship dock. Parking prices are fairly high, but reasonable for a downtown hotel of this caliber. There is a spa, but my companion was unable to use it as it opened a little later than we could fit into our busy schedule (we only stayed for a night). The gym is located adjacent to the hotel, and has a good spread of cardio and weight equipment. I do serious weight routines, and I found the equipment present to be adequate for a full body workout (though it requires knowledge of how to make best use of the various pulley systems). The view from the treadmills is a nice view across the water to Stanley Park. We tried the hotel's resident fine dining restaurant, Five Sails (named after the roof of Canada Place), it was very good. Pricey, of course, but the food matched the excellent view. The front desk was very helpful in getting us a reservation (at the window!) as we checked in. The hotel's service was top-notch, everyone from the door man to the front desk to house keeping was on the ball. Finally, the location is absolutely great --its a short-to-reasonable walk to all the major neighborhoods around downtown Vancouver. We were able to do a one day intensive walk-through without any trouble. And the ability to walk along the harbor in the evening or early morning is a big plus. The new convention center is right next door. This hotel still has the most prominent location in the city. Overall I highly recommend this hotel, especially if you can snag it using one of the discount travel sites.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, breathtaking ahhhhhhh :)”
Reviews.Author: VanillaBreeze
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Pan Pacific in downtown Vancouver for a vacation booked to forget about the stresses of the moment. This hotel is beautiful. I booked a Premier Harbour View Deluxe corner room, and the view was spectacular. The room was big and the layout was done in such a way that I did not hear the guests in their rooms while I was trying to sleep. This is a huge plus. The food was very good albeit pricy (however being as it was a hotel to be expected).
