The best part of the hotel was the staff who were always polite and welcoming and the beds that were very comfortable. To be honest I had a hard time leaving the hotel at the end of my trip as the view was so beautiful. The hotel is located right next to the Vancouver tourist bureau and across the street is a little mall with small restaurants should you wish to not eat at the hotel. It is right near Gastown and a short walk to Robson St. (about 10 minutes). Keep in mind it is next to a convention hall so it does not have the boutique feel. But.... I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I wish they had a loyalty program.

Reviews.Title: “very nice rooms on the concierge level”
Reviews.Author: chefjef
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights recently and enjoyed the concierge level. The inclusive breakfast and late afternoon snacks were very good and the booze offered at the honor bar was top shelf. The rooms are attractive, but not huge. The bedding was excellent and I loved the high thread count sheets. The view is fantastic, but those cute little float planes start flying early and they woke me both mornings starting around 6:00 am. We indulged in the highly rated spa, but thought it was trying to hard to be a Euro looking spa with the fake columns and bricks. Unfortunately, the hotel pool was being repaired and the noise was disturbing in the spa area. We were able to go over to the Fairmont across the street to use their facilities. Just wish I knew of this issue before booking my room. The gold level at the Fairmont is quite nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and great food”
Reviews.Author: TlaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. The staff are excellent with their attention to detail marking them out amongst their peers. Hotel is definitely in the luxury range and the staff act accordingly. We had breakfast in our room one morning, which was astoundingly good, the best breakfast of our trip. I recommend the poached egg westcoast, delicious and unusual. We also enjoyed dinner in the Five Sails restuarant. Again, staff were very attentive, with details like the Congratulatory petits four very much appreciated. Only thing that took the gloss off the restuarant a little was the two couples sat at the next table, talking loudly about their children's chances of going to certain Ivy league university (and giving me filthy looks in the ladies room) but I guess a restaurant isn't responsible for the rudeness of other diners. We had cocktails in the bar before dinner and I would say, I found mine to be particularly strong, so perhaps be a little wary. Our room had a City view and if we stay here again, I would go for a bay view instead. The hotel is a little out of the way but most of the Vancouver attractions are about a half hour walk away. It's also not the most beautiful of places, being positioned above a conference hall, although the jetty area is very elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Funfilled”
Reviews.Author: AlterEgo69
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all, location, views and nice sized rooms..... would recommend to anyone..... other than the price....... if you have no budget it is well worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “amazing building”
Reviews.Author: Caerketton1
Reviews.Content: views to die for and easy walk to Robson street - good jogging route on waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “It was just o.k. - They will nickel & dime you”
Reviews.Author: msbianca2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just o.k. to us. No personality really - the rooms are just ordinary but large. The hotel is very large and seems to nickel and dime guest for everything. We seemed to have to go through a maze to get to the fitness center. And if I read correctly they wanted to charge (we couldn't quite figure out the posting in the entrance). I am glad we got our stay at a discounted rate. The front desk was pleasant. I would stay somewhere else next time. I expected a bit more from the Pan Pacific Brand. We stayed at the Pan Pacific Seattle (brand new) after and felt the same way about it as well. I just may not be a Pan Pacific Lover (or just their US properties).

Reviews.Title: “best hel in vanoer”
Reviews.Author: ajax57
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific has the most gorgeous location-on the harbour -connected to the Convention Center and cruise terminal.. I would not stay anywhere else.. check-in-always polite-gracious and efficient...rooms immaculate-always smell fresh and clean..quality Aveeda ammentities in the bathroom..shower head has great pressure (However-I would recommend they add a hand-held attachment to the shower...this is a hotel that makes you feel well-cared for and special... If you are taking an alaska cruise out of vancouver this summer- this is a perefect place to stay!!!One elevator goes right to the cruise terminal boarding level!!! The bar has floor to ceiling views of the harbour and towering mountains...also-not a part of the hotel-but there is a great jewelry shop in the hotel lobby-has some amazing prices on antique and collectible jewlery!!!I

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pacific especially if your cruising.”
Reviews.Author: thedzoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before an alaskan cruise. It was amazing. great views and the best part was you could have your luggage picked up in your room and taken directly onto the ship. Really enyoed the hotel and wished we stayed longer. The concierge a=was very helpful and helped us make dinner reservations at a great hotel./

Reviews.Title: “Yuck - Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Resort_Employee
Reviews.Content: I always thought the Pan Pacific was one of Vancouver's "premier hotels" - this was until I actually stayed there. I booked a 1 night stay in a Deluxe Harbourview Room as a treat for my family before we left for a trip to the states. By far this was the least impressive hotel on our trip. The staff are nice enough, especially the doormen, but my room left much to be desired. The carpet was heavily stained, the furnishings were mismatched and the bathroom was just "okay". Nothing about the facilities seemed modern or fresh. Only after the hotel goes through a renovation/refresh would I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jettaset
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel on the waterfront. Definately a 5 star property. Great for conference center access and downtown shopping. Restaurant pricing is high but expected at a property like this. Parking is not included and VERY expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you're White”
Reviews.Author: Shahzadeh
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Pan Pacific for one night. After checking in, we decided to walk around Gastown and take some pictures. Before we left, we tried to take pictures of the front of the hotel. As soon as the bellboy saw me taking a picture of my best friend, he came over and informed me that we were not allowed to take pictures of the hotel property. I informed him that this was public property and that I could take pictures of anything I pleased. I then told him to get out of my way as he was ruining my shot. During this time, a White family stood about three feet away from us taking pictures of themselves in front of the hotel and he did not say anything to them! I got this bellboy's name (Jeff) and complained to the manager. I told him that I wanted a full refund for my stay and he denied my request. Unfortunately, all nearby hotels were booked because of the Vancouver International Film Festival, so we were stuck there. Word must have gotten around about what happened because the White staff were extremely rude to my best friend and I after this incident. The manager gave us a free breakfast, which was mediocre at best. I do not recommend this hotel to anybody, especially to visible minority individuals.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: islanderbob
Reviews.Content: 4 nites in vancouver,beautiful city. the pan pacific has the best location facing the water,park and mountains,5 min.walk to the seaplane airport where you can get a tix and flight allover the islands(victoria was our destination) for around $200 around trip. the room was very clean,modern and the staffs very friendly /professional. did spend 1 nite @ the 4 season as well on this trip,this hotel was more elegant and gourmet,but again you can not beat the pan pacific view . and please go to "TOJO'S" for sushi,the best !!if you ask to seat @the sushi counter,the chef will do a menu for you,he and sous- chefs will send incredible dish until you tell them to stop.we had may be 10 courses with sake wine served in bamboo for around $150 per pers., a bargain for a life long memories:) did spend 1 year working in japan having incredible culinary experiences,and tojo's was one of the best enjoy your trip

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: stubborntraveller
Reviews.Content: Three star experience in a five star hotel. That's what our trip there felt like. We arrived late after driving in from Seattle. Our car stopped working as we pulled in. Great.... needed to leave it there on the street. It was around 1 a.m. when we checked, tired from a long trip and troubles with the car. Excellent we thought, we can sleep in in the morning and get the car working again and continue on our way. Little did we know (as no one had told us) that they were doing renovations on our floor. In fact, they were doing renovations in the room next to ours, as we found out at 8:30 when they began sanding the wall behind the bed. I called down to complain and was told that there was nothing they could do. I explained that we had come in quite late the night before and had been hoping to sleep a little, but that was not the case. Nothing could be done. Fantastic. No one had told us of the renovations, so we were quite upset. They offered to comp our parking (hmmm.... in front of their hotel on the street, sure, sounds like a good deal). First though, they offered to pack our bags. Ummmm.... no? When we finally got eveything ready to go, we went down to check out. Found out at the front enterance they had tried to open the trunk of the car, even though we told them not too as it was having problems (it was an old car that we had borrowed from a family member). The valet staff managed to jam the lock so that it wouldn't work at all. Then they flooded the engine (old diesel Benz). Nice. What a great day we had. I will never stay there again. Was not the experience I was looking for when I booked a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the Pan Pacific.”
Reviews.Author: carolynu
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay here booked via hotwire. Got a good deal booking early although had I waited the price on Expedia came down to beneath what I paid anyway. Great size rooms, and fantastic location. There is noisy renovation going on right now, but I didn't actually hear it in the room. Didn't make much use of the facilities because I was too busy, but my sister and friend wanted to go for a swim, and because of renovation pool area is closed ,so they were advised to use The Fairmont across the road. Needless to say they didn't fancy that idea too much so didn't bother. All staff were very polite and efficient. Could do with more casual seating in the reception area not just in the eating/coffee places.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver hotel is first rate.”
Reviews.Author: DellaMar
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific Hotel is connected to the Vancouver Convention and Exhibition Center. I was a hotel guest attending a four day meeting and was impressed by the hospitality, comfort and location of the Pan Pacific. The hotel is well located for transportation, restaurants and shopping, a short walk connects travelers with this beautiful, friendly city. Hotel ammenities were excellent, rooms were spacious, well-appointed and spotless. This is a large hotel althrough floor layouts create the feeling of a much smaller hotel, there don't seem to be endlessly long hallways stretching off in all directions. Housekeeping was excellent, helpful and friendly. Even through a convention brought me to the city and the hotel, I would definitely rebook this hotel for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: katewcdf
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an inner harbour view room, which we got a great deal through hotels.com. Great room, with a great view overlooking Stanley Park too. Nice bathroom which was pretty big. We didn't really use any of the hotels amenities so i can't comment on them (although the pool/hot-tub had been closed for refurbishment for a few months so we couldn't use them anyway - but we could have used the hotel across the road). Great location downtown within easy walking distance to pretty much everywhere, and there's a skytrain stop right outside. A little noise from the seaplanes taking off nearby, but nothing that spoiled our stay. Would definitely stay here again, providing we could find another great deal, otherwise it would be well out of our price-range.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Offtomorrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and were so glad that we made the decision to stay here. It was by far the largest hotel we stayed at but the service was better than the small ones we stayed at. The staff made you feel special and treated us like individuals even though they had so many people to deal with. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to one of the balcony suites and I have not stayed anywhere that even comes close to it. The room was stunning and the view from the balcony was out of this world. I was worried that there would be noise from the cruise ships, sea planes that land and take off in front but there was no noise inside at all. The breakfast was first class and the bar overlooking the water was a wonderful place to sit and sip a beer. All in all this was a perfect end to our honeymoon and I will be staying here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: IckleA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in August 2007 before going on a cruise around Alaska. The hotel was amazing. We arrived early and as our room wasn't ready so they upgraded us for free to a room with a sea view, which was lovely. The bar food was great, and the entertainment (singer) in the bar area was very good. There are a few cafes outside of the hotel including a starbucks downstairs, which were all good for a bit of breakfast and coffee. The walk into the city centre didn't take too long and was very nice. Overall i would definately recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bed & fantastically clean...”
Reviews.Author: scubabunny13
Reviews.Content: My partner and I got a fabulous deal through Hotwire, but would have been just as happy if we'd paid the full price for our night. The location was prefect for our needs, walking distance to restaurants and great views. The bed was amazingly comfortable, with the softest sheets ever. The bathroom was super clean, not a speck of dust or hair anywhere, one of my biggest pet peeves. Loved that the door to the bathroom was hinged to actually close off the toilet cubicle within the bathroom for extra privacy. I will use this design in the next bathroom I build/remodel. Internet was fast, with an ethernet cable provided. Was a bit disappointed to have to pay so much for access, but seems fairly typical these days. If we were there for more than a night, this would have been more frustrating. All the staff we came in contact with were very friendly and efficient. Loved the tasting desserts in the lounge across from the reception. We should have just ordered all 5 and not just 4, they were an excellent price, considering where we were, we thought we would have to sell our first born child to pay for them! Tim Horton's donut shop is right across the street, via underground walkway if it's raining. Perfect location for a quick morning coffee.... The other thing I loved was the carpets in the elevator had the day of the week embroidered on them. Took all my early morning confusion out of what day it was. A nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views!”
Reviews.Author: Fevil
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous! From the moment you enter, you feel like you are in good hands. The staff are friendly, helpful and eager to please. The room we stayed in had a harbour view, which was fantastic! Rooms are well sized, well stocked and comfortable. We ate in two of the restaurants in the hotel while we were there; Cafe Pacifica and Cascades. The food and service were faultless each time. Thoroughly recommended, excellent location too!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Treat”
Reviews.Author: cockatoos
Reviews.Content: We had the good fortune of blindly selecting this great hotel on discount website for a Saturday night. I am a Vancouverite and love my home city, but after five years of traveling and living in other cities I found myself living with my sweetheart in Abbotsford (I call it the island of Abbotsord because it is just far enough from the center that the hour and sometime longer trip is an onerous deterrent. We decided to spend the money for a Saturday night in our city. Hotwire worked out well for the Pan Pacific because we came back on a few more weekends and booked directly and paid additional to upgrade our room. It is well worth it for us to sleep and play in the room with amazing view of the harbour and North Shore mountains. As a bonus staff are always courteous. We have stayed in a few other places through discount sites with mixed result. The Hyatt had a great room with more space, a balcony, and a modern design we liked a lot, but for about the same money the Pan Pacific is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Please Please take me back to the Pan Pacific!”
Reviews.Author: MidtownDetroitGirl
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable hotel situated right on Vancouver's harbor! The Pan Pacific is a gorgeous, huge, hugely modern hotel right in downtown Vancouver. It's done in many shades of beige, champagne, oatmeal--which I usually find horrendous. Here it comes across as sophisticated and smart. One reason to stay here is for the spa! When you book a spa treatment, you can use the spa area all day! Eucalyptus scented wet saunas, dry saunas, beautiful locker rooms, meditation rooms, vino and hot teas, white padded robes--the whole nine yards. This is included...in the price of a massage. The massage was heavenly. One sour note: I had my makeup applied for me...and she wasn't that amazing--my $45 application took her about ten minutes. The hotel rooms are also great--not huge, but the views of the city and the harbor are unbeatable. Really comfortable beds, and most of the rooms come with a mini-kitchen, which is great! The staff was warm, friendly, talkative, EXTREMELY helpful, knowledgeable, got to know you after the first half-day, the whole nine yards. Really a different level of service than one is used to in North America. There are tons of restaurants, bars, shopping, etc nearby, not to mention all of the beautiful nature in the PacNW! Plus: piano bar at night, marble floors, take a seat and look out on the water. Spellbinding!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kamante
Reviews.Content: When I phoned the hotel for information, they offered me a same day rate of 279 $can for a Harbour View Room (their "preferred view), which was better than their online rate and unbeatable compared with the other hotel that I also was considering, the Westin Bayshore resort. The Pan Pacific was a great choice. Service was excellent, the location very convenient, close to Stanley Park , to a bike rental, to the cruise harbour, to the seabus to North Vancouver, gastown, chinatown etc, and the building is connected to a foodcourt which offers several good choices if you find the 30$ can for breakfast too expensive. The food I ordered through roomservice was very good though (vegetables and a nice risotto). Regarding roomservice; a bit ridicilous is the 4 dollar charge (besides the 17% gratuity) for everything over 10 dollars, as almost all dishes were over 10 dollars! I loved the mats in the elevator, that told you which day it was (as a tourist you can lose track of days ;-), the pool was long enough to do laps (17 m according to an employee) and although it is an outdoor pool, it was warm enough to swim in (no cold shock getting in). About the room; room 1828, harbour view, 2 queen beds, good quality, loved the lamp on the desk that had extra sockets in it to plug in computer etc, so no crawling under a desk looking for a socket. I believed that internet was dsl only, and there is an extra charge for it. The view from the room was the fantastic, everyday you could see cruise ships come into the harbour and moor next to the hotel. Also waterplanes were flying in and out (there is a small waterplane terminal close to the hotel). And I must say: usually I do not care much for the shampoo + conditioner supplied by hotels, but I really liked the brand the Pan Pacific is using (Aveda). drawbacks; the interior of the room is a little bland/understated. The bath does not have a detachable shower (but this is something I have seen in most hotels in countries with a british background), and the bath is really low. With 1.80m (5 ft, 6 inc) you can not properly soak!. There was a giant flatscreen tv in the room, but the picture was very grainy, which ruined the effect. I reported the problem, but apparently it could not be fixed. When I made the reservation the booking was made for a king size, when I arrived there were no king sizes and I got room with 2 queen size beds. Not a problem for me, but why offer a king size if it is not available? These things should not withold you from booking the pan pacific though; the views and location make up for it. Be aware of one thing though if noise is an issue for you; a new convention center is being build next door, see on of the photo's added, the building with the green roof.. According to an employee the noise should not be a problem, as they are mainly working inside the new building now. And the hotel is quite soundproof. I was there over the weekend, so I could not tell. The hotel was also upgrading some suites in the hotel, and on Monday , there were some drillings sound. So you may want to check before booking. Be aware though that in light of the Olympics 2010 there is construction going on all over Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Elegants above the cruise terminal”
Reviews.Author: Walker S
Reviews.Content: Our tour included an overnight stay at this spectacular hotel prior to departing on our cruise the next day. The room was semicular with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Vancouver. Our bed was in the middle the head situated for the best view. Elegance is just the right description. And the convenience of just having our bag moved to lobby for an early boarding of the ship was certainly convenient. Highly recommend even if you are not taking a cruise the next day.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: vtowngirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights after an Alaskan cruise. The hotel is very conveniently located for the cruise ships and we enjoyed watching the sea planes take off and land from our window. The view of the harbor and distant mountains was beautiful! The room was very nicely appointed with a modern, slightly asian feel. Plenty of room. The service was very good, very professional, and unobtrusive. I don't recall seeing the maids' carts cluttering the halls as you often do. We did not dine in the hotel restaurant as they were quite pricy. A quick walk across the street found plenty of quick food for breakfast or lunch and a short walk down the street an very nice, upscale restaurant for dinner. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Pan Pacific and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: znck04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days. We had a wonderful time. We booked the deluxe room but when we got there they said they had no more rooms with a king size bed so we had to sleep in 2 separate beds. I was not happy with this at all, as we specified to the hotel agents what our preference was. Any way we spoke with the Manager the next morning about it and immediately he offered us a wonderful mountainview room that was absolutely "breath taking". I would like to thank the Managers there for taking care of us and making things right for us. This Hotel is in a great location, easy to get to all the fun things to see and do in Vancouver. I would gladly stay again! However one last thing....the parking is crazy expensive, so walking or public transportation is your best bet!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic for some”
Reviews.Author: corriejem
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at end of august,when checking in, reception asked if we wanted to upgrade to larger room for extra $100 per night, but after viewing our original room found it to be large enough for the four of us (2 adults and 2 children).but did feel a bit uncomfortable re hotel trying get more money out of me! found all staff to be very friendly and helpful, and proximity of hotel was ideal for sightseeing and local amenities, did not eat in hotel restaurants, found them to be very pricey, especially when local food mall is attached to hotel, where you can find loads of small food outlets and restaurants, that are very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Views, Service, Relaxed end to a Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: SweetChop
Reviews.Content: Not our original choice of Hotel to finish our Honeymoon in but delighted with this choice we made!. Our original choice of hotel that we'd stayed at before now seems to be blighted by the building work going on in Vancouver so we changed. We arrived at the hotel at 9am after saying good bye to the Diamond Priincess (a wonderful cruise). The walk from the ship through security into the hotel reception took about 10 minutes. First impressions are always important and the greeting we got at reception was spot on. We expected to just drop our bags and return at 4pm however I left my mobile number and was told I'd get a call as soon as out room was ready. True to their word I got a call at 10:15 to say our room was ready and our luggauge was waiting. Now that's good. We'd splashed out a bit and got a room with views over the harbour, mountains, Stanley park, lion gate bridge. The room was nice and high on the 21st floor, nicely appointed with everything we needed. We could just watch the world go by from our room. I'd guess if your in the lower floors you might see a bit more of the cruise ships when they are moored up. There is an outside terrace in the main reception and a pool on the 8th. We didn't use the pool but the seating area was handy. We had breakfast once in the hotel which was nice but $60 for two. We ate twice in the 5 sails restaruant, My Wife just adored the fish courses, worth every penny. Laundry service was quick, out and back in 4 hours, infact the service was good all round. The look of the hotel inside isn't swanky & glitzy but that dosen't bother us but service does and top marks here. Location is super for the cruise ship terminal, harhourside, skytrain seabus and rail. Oh and the cake delivered to us to say congratulations was a nice little touch..........

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Towel...Literally - Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KC71
Reviews.Content: This is not our first time at the Pan Pacific, but it will definitely be our last. Our family checked in on the afternoon of August 17, 2008 and decided to go for a swim. After using the pool (which was lovely) I took my 3month old son back to the room for a bath and when I used one of the towels to dry him, I noticed that there was blood on it. I was pretty freaked out and thought that he was hurt. It turns out the blood was on the towel itself. I called the duty manager immediately and she asked me what I would like to do. How about CHANGE THE TOWELS? I couldn't believe that she waited for me to give the instructions! After an upsetting night wondering about where the blood came from and what else is contaminated in the room, I called the duty manager again at 8am the next morning. I told her that we would like to check out today (we had two rooms booked for two nights). The duty manager asked me why and I explained that I can't get over the towel with blood on it. She asked me a lot of questions about it because she says the duty manager from the previous day did not log the issue. I gave her all the information and told her that I took a picture of it as well. The duty manager offered to have us switch rooms, but when I told her we had two rooms, she did not say anything about it anymore. I declined the offer and quickly looked for another hotel in Vancouver. When we checked out, I showed Akiko, the duty manager, the pictures of the towel (she requested to see the pictures) and she just shrugged and said, "Ooh...I'm so sorry," and walked away. That was the end of it. We moved to the Fairmont, which was much CLEANER. Now that I look back, it wasn't the blood on the towel that I find disturbing, it was the attitude and service provided by the Pan Pacific. The first duty manager didn't even offer to have the towels changed, I had to request it. The second duty manager tried to erase the issue with a casual "So sorry." This is supposed to be a prestigious hotel, but if the duty mangers, who are supposed to be in charge, have such laxed attitudes about hygiene and customer support, how can they possible lead the rest of the staff? Akiko could have easily turned the situation around by offering to investigate the issue and offer an explanation (my guess is that someome cut their hand and then handled the towels - there was too much blood for it to be a minor cut and the blood was not dried or old looking) via a follow-up. But she did not ask me for any contact information. She just shrugged it off-perhaps hoping to sweep this issue under the rug.

Reviews.Title: “Pan pacific was the icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: BinnsyUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Pan Pacific after a week cruising Alaska then a week on Vancouver Island. The room was pre-booked through Canadian Affair at a very reasonable rate. When we arrived we were exhausted, having spent hours waiting to get the BC ferry from Nanaimo. The friendly and helpful receptionist offered us a lovely room with no less than six windows overlooking the waterfront. It was actually part of a huge suite but had everything we needed. There was no extra charge. The bed was actually a convertable sofa but quite comfortable, and what it lacked in size made up for in facilities. The bathroom had Aveda cosmetics, there was a full size desk with internet facilities and a bar with everything one could possibly wish for. Best of all of course was the amazing view. We dined in the restaurant one evening and had the best meal(New york steak) we'd had in our travels in Canada and the service was nothing less than outstanding. We thought the breakfast was slightly expensive at $30 but there was a conveniently located Food Court (directly from the hotel via an underpass) and we found an excellent American Diner there. There's a lovely pool area at the Pacific and a pleasant bar and several shops. It couldn't be more convenient for a cruise holiday. Dont miss the astounding sunset over the mountains - it is the most incredible sight. I will definitely be staying there again if I am ever fortunate enough to visit Canada again.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the views!”
Reviews.Author: Photopedia
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Pan Pacific Hotel recently after a four year gap and would happily go back there again and again. Positives: i) the views of Vancouver harbour and the Lion's Gate Bridge from the rooftop pool are amazing ii) the breakfasts are excellent...try the blueberry pancakes! iii) its position is excellent for shopping iv) Gastown has some pretty good restaurants and is only a few blocks away v) Stanley Park is an easy 20 minute stroll away vi) Canada Place is a great spot for people watching and is always a hive of activity with cruise liners coming and going daily during the summer months. Negatives: like any big conference hotel, the Pan Pacific is expensive and rather large and impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: to_calvary
Reviews.Content: I would rate the Pan Pacific Vancouver as THE hotel to stay in at Downtown Vancouver. The staff are great. We emailed earlier for a high floor and king-sized bed and all our requests were met. (We got the 16th floor and view of Stanley park) Our 5 night stay earned us a bonus C$75 credit which could be used for internet, meals, etc. The room cost an average of C$300 per nite, excluding taxes. Expensive yes, but worth it esp if you are celebrating a special occasion and wld like somewhere really special. The location is very central - just 2 minutes away from Waterfront Seabus and Skytrain station. There's a stop for the BIG BUS and Trolley Bus tours o/s the hotel. The view is simply breath-taking - Stanley Park, Grouse Mountain, Northshore and everyday we see the sea planes landing there. The cruise ships didn't bother us much - they "horn" upon arrival but the time is always during waking hours and we didn't bump into any crowds of people landing / boarding the cruise ships. In fact we liked the view of the cruise ships coming in. Also walking distance (about 30 min) to Boat Cruises and marina where you can take boat tours. We took the Boat Cruise Also 1min away from taxis, Aqua Riva restaurant (excellent pan seared duck there!) and about 10 min away from Robson St. Besides the great location and view, the service was excellent too. COunter staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a choice of 5 types of pillows which is great cos' I didn't have to miss my Tempur orthopedic pillow!! The restaurants there are good too. Cafe Pacifica offers an excellent angel hair pasta with scallops. Don't bother with the seafood sampler though - it's expensive and the portions are so small. When we needed anything (eg missing newspaper for just 1 day, needed a kettle and of course, request for pillows), just a call and the staff were quite prompt to respond. In all, worth every cent we paid. No doubt the hotel is relatively expensive and mini bar items are exhorbitant but the free gourmet coffee, excellent view, service and location, etc, make up for it. To save some money, go to the Waterfront foodcourt (linked to the Hotel by underpass - saves you from the morning chills! or SinClaire Centre for breakfast. (I recommend the French crepes at Sinclaire Centre)

Reviews.Title: “No children allowed, please.”
Reviews.Author: DurhamJaps
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were high looking foward to a 5 star hotel experience, harbour view charging an extra $50 per night this was the first of many little extra charges the Hotel would try to apply during our stay. We ellected to stay on the opposite side of the Hotel which looks onto the cargo port and nearby heliport area. The rooms were pleasant and larger than most hotels, overall all staff were heplful and had a nice manner. Unfortunately the Hotel lags behind most over it's "family friendly" approach, we were moved from the main bar area because the Hotel were unable to cater for children in a designated 'bar area'. We were given a table around the corner out of view from the main bar area totally isolated from other residents enjoying the live entertainment in this area. The internet room is located next to the shops and sighted well away from the main lounge so children could not be seen and monitored, a major concern in such a large Hotel, a further charge of $8 for 20 mins was required, again another disgrace considering it was a 5 star Hotel. Swimming pool too small, any more than 10 in it and you were just standing around, however first class views from there. Overall the Hotel was nice and the concierge service excellent, however my impression was the Hotel was geared towards the wealthy one / two nights stayers coming off cruise ships and the elderly hence the stuffy and cold atmosphere within the Hotel. I would not recommend this Hotel for families irrespective of its 5-star status.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels...”
Reviews.Author: pbaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific before and after our cruise. Our first room was a city view we had an "07" room which was much larger than our in-laws harbor view room. I am very picky and the room exceeded my expectations. The beds were super comfortable and the bathroom had Aveda products. The room and public areas were very clean. We also enjoyed the bar and outside areas-great views! After our cruise we returned to the Pan Pacific, they had overbooked and we were asked if we were interested in going to the Fairmont Waterfront on them for the night. Since we had just gotten our on ship bill we happily went across the street. When looking on-line the Fairmont was much more expensive. It was a very nice hotel but I liked the Pan Pacific a little better. When we went back to thePP we were given a deluxe harbor-view room. It was one of the most spacious and beautiful rooms we have ever stayed in. We also enjoyed the turn-down service. Unfortunately we were in Vancouver during the power outage. The PP had no power (or water on our floor) for two days. I think they went above and beyond trying to help everyone. They put out a free buffet with snacks and drinks ( best sweet tea I ever had!) The entire staff never lost their patience during this. Even our room and bathroom were cleaned even though housekeeping had to do it all in the dark. I was very impressed with this. We decided to change hotels and they were able to get us a room at the Westin Bayshore. We paid $225 at the PP (with a $25 internet credit) and the Westin was $209. As we were leaving the PP the man getting the cab for us could not have been nicer. He had been there since the morning, you could tell he was tired but he was SO NICE. He showed my daughters the clock that stopped at 10:16 and took a picture of them, he then RAN to get us a cab. I felt everyone at the PP were so nice and very professional. We then moved on to the Westin- what a difference. I found the staff to not be as nice and service was so slow. The room was below average at best. The wall paper was bubbling up, the carpet was stained and the lamp shade was frayed. The room also had a "musty" scent. The room was in need of a MAJOR renovation in my opinion. Also, the room had a harbor view in the tower section, it was a good 5 minute walk from the lobby. One time we waited over 5 minutes for someone to get us a cab. This room did not even come CLOSE to either thePP or the Fairmont, but the price was very close to what I paid at the PP. I was happy for electricity, but the room was a HUGE disappointment, plus I felt the staff had an attitude. I would rate the three hotels (on a 1 poor-10 excellent scale) as follows: Pan Pacific 10, Fairmont 9 Westin Bayshore 2. If I am ever in Vancouver the Pan Pacific would be the only hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “"Cruise me" in to the Pan Pacific!”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I opted to stay here after a 7-day Alaskan cruise on Regent that disembarked in Vancouver. We wanted a little more pampering after the luxury cruise, so we read the reviews on Tripadvisor and booked this hotel through its website, not the cruise line. We were not disappointed in the least. Literally, we walked off the ship and within a few steps, we were in the hotel lobby. Unbelievable convenience. Early check-in was no problem, and with a little luck, we got a harbor view room with no extra nudging. (Super front desk!) Beds were comfy, bathroom was elegant, quiet room with a great view. (We could see the cruise ships from our room.) A bonus: rental cars are bookable in the hotel, and pick-up in the underground parking for day trips to Victoria. Great munchies at the bar and fantastic views. Room service, a tad overpriced. A caveat: the room floor elevators descend/ascend all the way to the public underground parking which was a little offsetting in a security-issue kind of way. I am sure the hotel has security walkers around for scrutiny, but it was an access that was notable. We would return without any question!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, Great Location, Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: WriterChappy
Reviews.Content: We came to the Pan Pacific for 3 nights at the end of our 2 week tour around the Rockies. For the city itself the hotel is ideally located and within walking distance of the main shopping district and Gastown. Whereas other hotels we stayed at during our holiday were a lot smaller, cosy and with a bit of 'old world' charm perhaps, the PP was entirely different. Large, cosmopolitan and a little impersonal. But this is probably to be expected at a large city hotel. Check in was swift and we were upgraded to a room with a 'partial' sea view. As you would expect from a 5 star hotel, all mod cons were present. We tried out the swimming pool and hot tub for 2 out of the 3 evenings there and found this to be a great way to finish off a busy day exploring. Again, as we found with virtually all of the hotels we stayed at during our holiday, the food was very expensive. Given the fact that within walking distance there are a myriad of restaurants catering for virtually taste there was no competition - out we went. The bar area within the hotel though is a pleasant enough place to sit for a drink and the views of the harbour, surrounding mountains and Stanley Park are pretty good to say the least. Service was very swift with all staff very friendly and attentive. Our check out was a slightly different story. As our flight home was late afternoon we negotiated, without any trouble, a check out time of 3pm. We took a walk that morning only to arrive back at the hotel at lunchtime to find our room key had been de-activated. The duty manager came up to let us back in, after asking us for some ID. We then had housekeepers knocking on our door at 2.30pm which began to make us feel as though we were trespassing somehow. We decided to go 10 minutes early to find not only the aforementioned housekeepers loitering outside our room but also the same duty manager who let us back into our room earlier. I felt like asking them if there was a problem, as we felt slightly intimidated by this. We would recommend the PP, but variety is the spice of life as they say. We've been there once and would probably try somewhere different should we go to Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NickExar
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifu hotel in a great location within easy walking distance of downtown and the historic section of Vancouver. Very large rooms. Ours was the cheapest city view, but we had a king bed, a sleep sofa for our son and a fold-a-way bed for our daughter and still had room.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wildlilac
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel even with no electricity for a couple of days (glowsticks were provided)! The staff are always ready to assist and friendly, the room is bright and clean and, the bed and bathroom are both comfortable, spacious and clean. The skytrain 'Waterfront' stop is a 5-min walk and the 'Hop-On Hop-Off' bus & tram stop is just outside the hotel - very convenient for those who like city tours. Buffet breakfast in hotel is a tad pricey but there are other cheaper options nearby (food court, Tim Hortons, Bread Garden, Mink, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Incredible View, In the middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: Was here for a social event with about 350 others in my group. This is a lovely, expensive hotel. Check-in was quick, but our Sunday 5am check-out was difficult. Auditing issues allowed us not to get a final bill, or a total cost amount, so we had to leave the property without knowing how much we owed...scary! They faxed the bill hours later though. The $29 buffett breakfast here is excellent. Our city view room was huge with a king size bed, pull out sofa, long chair, extra chair and desk/chair. The bathroom is big, too and the toilet is in a separate area than the rest of the bathroom. Bathrobes were a wonderful touch. Aveda toiletries were nice. All tour buses stop outside this mega hotel. The underground food court was nice in between meals. Our rate was $275 per night. Bellman were prompt each time. Restaurant workers friendly. TV remote control did not work, but a new one was replaced within minutes. Buffet during dinner meals were very good. View is incredible from this location. Perfect for those cruising...but beware, another cruise terminal is nearby, so you may need a cab ride, while others just take the elevator downstairs to their cruise ship! Starbucks is connected to this hotel, but free Starbucks is available to early morning risers in the lobby. The skytrian below the hotel takes you to the 500 store mega mall, "metro town" for $3 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with stunning views!”
Reviews.Author: MrsTokes01
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked into the century plaza - but when we got there it was so awful we checked out immediately - we called up the pan pacific and despite being canada day weekend we got excellent rates and had a front row view of the canada day fireworks. The hotel has stunning views over the water to stanley park. The service was fabulous as was the food, and for the smokers amongst us has one of the few patios where you can smoke - albeit not at your table but at least you dont have to stand in the road like everywhere else in canada! The rooms were a good size and well appointed with very large comfortable beds. All in all I would say that it has THE location in Vancouver and although it is a large hotel it still has not lost its personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TexasChick31
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference last June and absolutely loved it. It reminded me very much of a Four Seasons. Room: I had a room that faced the water, which I think maybe all of them do in one form or fashion. The beds were very soft and comfy, but I think my favorite thing was the chaise long that faced the window, so you could sit and look out over the water and mountains. The bathroom was also pretty large and stocked with wonderful Aveda products that were replenished daily. Everyone in the hotel from the housekeepers to the room service delivery guys were very, very nice. Location: The hotel is right in the heart of everything. You can walk to virtually any restaurant or store that you need to get to. I, like a dummy, forgot to get Canadian dollars before I left, but I found an ATM right across the street in the food court that accepted my Visa bank card. All in all it was a great stay. I don't know what the normal rate of the hotel is, but we paid right around $250 CD a night. When I go back to Vancouver, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: bgsub
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a post cruise stay in Vancouver. Fantastic location, very close to Gastown and public transport links. It's an easy 5 min walk to the train or the ferry to the North Shore. Not the best location for downtown shopping, but thats only a 15 min walk or short bus ride away. Our room was huge (especially after having been on a cruise) and very comfortable. Only downside is seeing the cruise port is in the hotel it is Mayhem outside if there is a cruise leaving that day (but you can avoid all this by sleeping in).

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners512
Reviews.Content: Definitely not as good as the Pan Pacific in Seattle, but it seems that all of these Pan Pacific Hotels are simply great. Front desk was accomodating and the room clean. There were big windows allowing us to have a beautiful view of downtown Vancouver on the 21st floor. The shower drained well, and the bed covers were delightfully soft. The room service food was not that great, and took longer than stated. About the same price as the Sutton Hotel, but much better.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: familylikes2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 2008. It is right on the water walking distance to everything dowtown Vancouver and Stanley Park. We had a harbour view...spectacular! The windows are large so you can watch the beautiful sights on the water. The rooms are bigger than most and immaculate. It is a very busy hotel, with lots of convention rooms and sits at the port for cruise ships. Restaurants and lounges are nice with large windows that look out on the water. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The outdoor jacuzzi and pool are nice, but the best part is the huge area adjacent to the pool with lounge chairs where you can sit and relax without being splashed. If you walk on the seawall towards Stanley Park you will pass a pub called The Mill Marine Bistro. It has excellent food and service and is just above a water park where the kids can play on a hot day and parents can enjoy a refreshing drink and keep an eye on them. The negatives for us at this hotel is the lack of wall-plugins (had to iron my clothes in the bathroom), the parking was expensive, and not secure (it's a public parkade) and the harbour planes start at 7 a.m. so if you have a harbour side room and you are a light sleeper be prepared to be awakened. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ronnyber
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the PP for three nights on a business trip. I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. The first and most important being the size of the rooms. Almost 50% larger than most rooms I have stayed in. Service was excellent and the views of the harbour from the Atrium were stunning. I had a city view room and can only imagine how much better my stay would have been if I had a harbour view. It was also an easy 5-10 minute walk to the restaurants of Gastown. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Judicious
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked to visit Vancouver, and finally decided that we would stay the first couple of nights at the Pan Pacific and then move on to a small boutique hotel downtown called The Wedgewood. The Pan Pacific is located right on Vancouver harbour, and is basically on top of the cruise ship terminal. It is a very big and impersonal hotel, but if you are an independant traveller and are happy to be left alone and blend into the background like we are, then this is a great hotel. It does get busy at times, especially when there is a cruise coming or going, but it isn't really a problem because of the size of the hotel. One thing I would recommend to anyone planning to stay there is do book a room with a view of the harbour and Stanley Park. It is better than any TV. We sat for ages watching what was going on, without realising how the time was passing. You have the ships coming and going, the seaplanes taking off and landing as well as the wonderful views of the park. The room was smaller than we have experienced at other hotels, but it was very clean and the bed was very comfortable, but those views certainly made up for it. We found the food to be very good, and as always in Canada, excellent value. We didn't bother with the fine dining restaurant as the bar or restaurant where you have breakfast (I can't remember its name) were both good. We booked a B & B package direct with the hotel, and this is a good idea, as you just hand over the little vouchers you receive on check in, to the restaurant host/hostess as you enter, and you can have as much as you want from the very good buffet, or you can pay a bit more and choose from the menu, but to be honest, alot of the food on the menu is in the buffet anyway, you just pay to have it delivered to your table. As I said at the beginning of this review, we had booked the first couple of nights of our stay at the Pan Pacific, and then we were moving on to the Wedgewood. Well, we did move on to the Wedgewood, and two nights later we came back to the Pan Pacific for the rest of our holiday. The Wedgewood is not a hotel I would recemmend to anyone. It is not in a very nice area to be in at night for one thing, and you can't get into the bar because of locals flocking in there after work. The food is also over priced and over rated. They think they are something special, but they're not! Anyway, I doubt I will return to Vancouver in the near future, as we had 11 days there, and thats quite a long time to spend in one city. However, if I do go back, I would have no hesitation in booking the Pan Pacific again. It is in a good location, and you can walk along the waterfront, all the way to Stanley Park. It is also ideally located for the downtown shops. I love Canada, and have been lucky enough to have a number of holidays there in various locations, and this hotel was definately one of the best if not THE best I have stayed in during my visits.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, great location for the city”
Reviews.Author: Fingermouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Pan Pacific for 12 days on business in a standard city view room. The room was excellent, good size, very comfortable and well serviced. The hotel is very busy with lots of people arriving and leaving all the time, mainly from conventions and cruise ships. This did not really matter once you were checked in but if you time it wrong there can be a log wait to check in. The hotel has nice bar area, with an outside section with wonderful views. There is also a couple of restaurants, however we never used these as there is so much choice in Vancouver. Probably the best thing about the hotel from a business traveler’s view was the location. It was a short walk to the center of Vancouver, or Yale Town or even Gas Town. This meant we could easily eat out every night either on foot or with a short taxi ride. Also there is a Sky Train station pretty much under the hotel which is great if you need to get around the wider city. Had a very good stay there any would come back for both business travel and personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but not stuffy”
Reviews.Author: pickypickypicky
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay and it was equally comforting and satisfying. While it is expensive, it delivers the quality. My last name is not pronounced as it appears in print and yet the staff had recorded in the computer its correct pronounciation - I appreciate that effort. We ate in all of the restaurants and even the top rated 5 Sails was worth the money and this was on Mother's Day! I like that they have included the exercise room into the room fee. It is awkward to find and relatively small but it has everything you need for an excellent workout. This area includes private lockers, showers, towels, and an excellent attendant. The hotel is centrally located to other great restaurants, shopping, etc. that one would expect at this level and you can certainly save money and eat well in the surrounding area. Both times we have stayed on the ocean view side but the noise of the float planes and cruise ships (even on the top floors) can get to be a little annoying if you are sensitive. I will try the city side next time. I do wish they carried the Golf Channel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishdollIreland
Reviews.Content: what a hotel. i have never seen a view quite it! whenever we arrived the staff were so friendly they could not do enough, the lady on the desk was even better when she heard we were from ireland she upgraded us to a wonderful sea view room. well worth any extra money, every morning you saw the float planes and snowey mountains and the huge cruise ships. the room was delightful with lovely furshings and a huge bed, but for me it the bathroom was excellent the only prob was i spent so much time soaking in the bath. this hotel is wonderful in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: fayesuave
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start. This hotel was beautiful on the inside and out, had an amazing view of the ocean and the mountains and the rooms were large, clean, comfortable and posh. I don't think I've ever stayed in a better hotel. The location is perfect if you want to walk to the main attractions in Vancouver (Stanley Park, Robson Street, Downtown), and the staff are so polite and helpful. There is also a heated and a regular pool outdoors on the second floor. You will have to pay for underground parking though. I suggest booking through hotels.com as myself and 2 other friends got a very nice room for $125CND per night.

Reviews.Title: “This is an Incredible Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SHOWHOST
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible. it sits atop a pier. The view of my room was over looking the beautiful harbor and coastal mountain range. The room was spacious and modern. The bathroom was huge and exquisite. Wish i could've stayed longer. i also dined at their seafood restaurant called five sails. it was amazing. The banquet food was also exceptional. Walking distance to shopping and dining. Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Go to the seafood restaurant called, the lift. It’s only 4 blocks away and is amazing!!!! Excellent job!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel, with chic well appointed rooms. Nice views from the lounge -- and convenient location if on a cruise. Service was ok. Good location for shopping and dining. Location part of a convention centre so pretty busy place during the day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mindstorm72
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, nice view. Would use again when in VAncouver

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and great views but slightly sterile.”
Reviews.Author: SandyMaidstone
Reviews.Content: Basically a very good hotel having excellent rooms that have lots of nice touches, but it is let down by the somewhat sterile atmosphere of its public areas. The hotel sits over an Exhibition and Conference Centre with access by escalators, or elevators, from a common entrance. It is in an excellent location and has great views over either the harbour to the mountains of the North Shore or the bustling Downtown area of the city.The eating area that serves breakfast and lunch is fine but it is not open of an evening leaving only the lounge area (crowded when Conferences and Exhibitions are on) and a very expensive restaurant to eat at. However ,it is only a few min. walk from Vancouver's downtown area so many guests seem to eat-out, as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Too Popular!”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful location, right on the harbor and you are steps away from where the cruise ships depart. The hotel is very popular with cruise passengers and groups. It's downstairs area shares it's space with the cruise port and convention center. The lobby is a few floors up. The lobby is always busy. The staff at times seems worn thin with so many people. We found some staff to be helpful and pleasant and other's who were just over all the crowds and people. The lobby is stunning and the large glass windows offer a breathtaking view of Vancouver harbor, the ships and the mountains. We had a deluxe mini suite, but the first room given was small, sparse and had a view of an industrial area. We asked to change rooms and the desk clerk was nice and helpful. He gave us a much larger room with a nice harbor view. Sometimes you just have to ask for what you want! I liked elements of this hotel, but the crowds and popularity of the hotel took away from it's beauty. It is hard to get a cab here, you have to wait in lines for the breakfast and often it's hard to get up to the front desk just to ask a simple question. A lot of cruise passengers and tourists who are not staying here, use the lobby as ground zero. The rooms were okay, but not great. I would rate them average. If you can get a view do so, it makes the room. One side of the hotel has city views and another has awful industrial views, two sides of the hotel give you wonderful water and mountain views. You have to ask if you want a room with a view! The rates are expensive and I thought it was pricey for what you actually got for your dollar. The best part about this hotel is that you can check-in for your cruise inside the hotel. It's very easy and I would strongly suggest this hotel for anyone leaving on a cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price view”
Reviews.Author: lillydoll1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two day trip at the Pan Pacific Vancouver. The hotel is beautifully located on the water and conveniently close to downtown. The service from the hotel reservation desk and concierge was average. The house keeping service was the best we have ever experienced. It was so lovely that we spent New Years Eve night in our hotel room, overlooking the pool area, city, mountains, and ocean. We stayed on the 15th floor with a Mountain/Harbor view. We went to downtown for all of our meals. We paid $219 per night for a room with a Mountain/Harbor view and a King sized bed. It was perfect for a romantic getaway for a couple of 23 year-olds. The room was definitely nice and comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. A scale was included under the sink, which you don't see too often.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the adventure”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: I stayed prior to an Alasakan cruise. The location is great and very convenient to the ships. It is walking distance to Stanley park and the great areas of downtown Vancouver. The hotel is big, when you walk into the lobby it is almost overwhelming, but still enjoyable. The front desk was very responsive and helpful. The room we had, had a great view of the harbor and the ships arriving. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms large with powerful showers. The gym was large with great equipment. The restaurant had great food and the price was reasonable for a hotel. I am staying here on my next stay in Vancouver. Vancouver is worth a visit for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great views but needs a new look.”
Reviews.Author: chef082
Reviews.Content: This is a very grand and prestigious hotel on the waterfront in Vancouver. I have stayed here twice and I have the same opinion from both visits. This property is very clean and very well serviced but it needs to be redone inside. The guestrooms are in need of a changeover to the current era. The furniture and fixtures just make it feel boring and old. The view from the breakfast buffet is spectacular and that makes up for a great deal. Overall, I would like to see a better interior before I stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific in a gem on the ocean”
Reviews.Author: cruisingaunt
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver as part of a pre-cruise stay through Carnival Cruise Line. We were there for one night before our cruise. We have stayed in Vancouver at least twice before so that we were familiar with the location of this hotel. It is pricey but I believe you get what you pay for. Check-in was flawless. We had called a few days before to request a king-bed room. Even though we arrived before check-in, our room was ready. We had a city-view room and it was beautiful. It was large and very well laid out. In addition to the bed, there was a desk and chair, a sofa with table, a dresser (armoire w/tv) and most impresively-a chaise! There were plenty of lamps for good reading and an extremely well laid out bathroom (with Aveda products!!!!). Service was wonderful. Staff was very friendly. Location to the cruiseport was the best. Checkout is noontime. We had a nice breakfast (not at the hotel-too expensive) at the diner. We then were able to relax in the room until about 11:30 when we went downstairs to our ship. Checkout staff were friendly and efficient. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, particularly if you are going to be using the cruiseport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic For Cruisers!”
Reviews.Author: Phamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for 1 night after debarking from a short cruise and before embarking on another short cruise. For cruisers, this hotel is absolutely fantastic. As the hotel is located on the foot of the pier at Canada Place, the location could not be any better. After getting off ths ship, it was only a short walk and an elevator ride to get to the check-in desk. As we were checking in at around 9 am, our room was not ready, but the hotel did take our luggage and had it automatically delivered to our room when we returned later in the afternoon. I really enjoyed wandering around Canada Place and watching activities on the bay around Vancouver. As a cruise-obsessed person, watching two ships sailaway in the late afternoon was a treat. Another great feature of the hotel is that you can call down and have a bellhop come up to your room and automatically have your luggage transfered to the the ship. As we had 2 kids and quite a bit of luggage, this was an especially nice treat. The room we had was really nice. It was quite large and was on the corner, so we had one window to view the bay and another to view downtown. The bed was plush and very comfortable - almost as good as the Westin heavenly bed. The staff was very nice and personable, helping us with directions. Also, we did call down for turndown service in the evening (a previous poster said the hotel did not offer this, but all he had to do was ask). The hotel had a nice heated pool that we used in the evening. The hotel is also next door to the Waterfront station, convenient to the Skybus and the Seabus, which we used to travel to Capilano Bridge. So, in every way, this hotel met or exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: millacanada
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel directly through their website for one night, July 9, 2007. The hotel adverizes itself as an aeroplan partner. As a collector I gave my card. Two months later the aeroplan miles were not credited to my account. I called the hotel to inquire. After several calls, they finally got back to me saying that it was a promotional rate and they are not going to give me any points for that. There was no mention of that at the time of reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views and rooms”
Reviews.Author: rmh66
Reviews.Content: Stepping into the Pan Pacific Hotel is like stepping into a mall or arena. Because the complex is shared with a convention center and cruise ship terminal, it's just enormous, loud, busy, and impersonal. This was still cruise season, so there were lots of cruise ship tourists there, which added to the mayhem. We were a bit concerned about we got ourselves into after the first 10 minutes. Thankfully, once we got to our room, everything changed. Our room was on a corner, which a panoramic view of the harbor, Stanley Park, mountains, etc. In contrast to the lobby, our floor was quiet and the room was very peaceful and quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable and bathroom was small, but nice with Aveda amenities. If you are sensitive to sound, then there might be some problems for you at the Pan Pacific. There's construction next door, which starts pretty early and ends pretty late, cruise ship horns, and seaplanes taking off and landing. I'm from an urban area, so none of this bothered me. Room service was very friendly, but the food itself was pretty average. (It made us miss Sutton Place or Metropolitan.) Service was sometimes slow, but for the most part, it was on time. There was a mini-bar, though the refrigerator wasn't on, so we never used it. Parking was overall pretty good (given that this is basically a convention center), but there are a lot of reserved spots, so finding a parking spot wasn't quite as simple as it seems. It's also not cheap ($25/day). I'm not sure that we're coming back, even though the view was spectacular. It's a bit too touristy for my taste. Accessibility: If you are wheelchair bound, this hotel is pretty good, but not great. Most areas are accessible by elevator, though because the parking garage elevators stop at 10pm, if you arrive later, it could be a challenge. Also, getting from the hotel to mall area (underneath and across the street) is difficult. It requires going across the street to the Fairmont and taking an elevator (versus steps and an escalator in the Pan Pacific). If you want to get to the Sea Bus or Sky Train, then you have to get to the station at street level, since the mall entrance to the train station is not accessible. Vancouver is a good city for wheelchairs, but there are a lot of quirks.

Reviews.Title: “Good views all around”
Reviews.Author: Branstone8
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is a nice hotel, you wont be disappointed. Now I don't ask much of my hotel, but the staff was always friendly and the room was perfectly clean. We had a city view, and it we was spectacular. The whole area is quite scenic. Now you should know that the Pan Pacific is attached to the convention center and it is a dock on both sides for cruise ships. It didn't bother us but I thought you should know its not a stand alone hotel. The elevators are super fast and efficient. I would definately consider staying here again. We walked all over the city, and this was a good spot for foot travels. I will warn you to read up about E. Hastings St.. its near Gastown and you can easliy stumble into this area (we did). Dont let it happen to you. Make sure to google it and read about its problems.

Reviews.Title: “Super experience at the Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: ThanomsMom
Reviews.Content: Hotel deserves its five-star rating. Several items "wrong" were corrected within minutes. For example, t;he batteries were low on the TV remote. We called and had a new one within minutes. The bedding is luxurious. Location is superb for anyone who wants to use public transportation or who wants to walk. We did not have a car but were able to use public transit to get to Granville Island and other tourist sites. Recommend this hotel highly and wish we could have stayed more than the one week e had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BigSausage
Reviews.Content: Stayed the day before our cruise and had a great experience, I wish I had the forethought to book a couple of extra days because Vancouver has much to offer. I didn't have much interaction with the staff but the little I did have was very good. Don't listen to those stuffy so called experienced travelers, this is a top shelf hotel and you will be completely satisfied at this location. The only negative I could offer is the slow check in when a tour comes in but that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ceri&Pete
Reviews.Content: Great location Great views Good room Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: clydesmith
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel. Remodeled rooms. Right in the heart of Vancouver at the departure dock for Inside Passage cruises. Walking distance to Gastown and great restaurants. Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Boston-Travel-Diva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific before and after our Alaska cruise in August. I found a fabulous rate advertised on Travel Zoo, and to my surprise, when I called the hotel to book the discounted web rate they actually had rooms available and were more than pleasant about booking them for me. Upon arrival I half expected to be treated like a second class citizen as we were paying less than half the regular room rate. Not so. We were greeted with enthusiasm and shown to a exceptionally nice room. The staff at this hotel were professional, helpful and always smiling. I don't believe you can get a room with bad view in this hotel. Half the rooms face the harbor and the other face the city. We had city view rooms and enjoyed people watching from our windows as well as the twinkling lights at night. The new convention center is being built next door, which was fascinating to watch and noise was not an issue. Our windows actually opened for fresh air - a real plus in my book. The pool and jacuzzi deck on the 8th floor was well planned with attractive landscaping. Rooms were large with comfortable furniture. Marble bathroom was tastefully decorated with lux towels and amenities. Bed sheets were sensational - better even then Westin's 'heavenly bed' - felt more like silk than cotton. I expected this to be a large impersonal convention hotel. I was way off the mark. It's one of the nicest properties I've stayed in. It has an ideal location for anyone taking a cruise out of Vancouver - you can walk your luggage right on and off the boat. We walked right by several hundred people waiting in line for cabs and transfers and were in our room within 10 minutes from exiting the ship. Best of all, treat yourself to one of their delicious martini's in the lounge at sunset - perfect. They have earned their 5 stars - we'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, shame about the cruise ships.”
Reviews.Author: Mando5569
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights off a deal from Travelzoo. Two nights at $US189 and one at $US419 plus taxes. Hotel is adjacent to cruise ship terminal and obviously has considerable business from cruisers staying before or after their cruises to Alaska and elsewhere. Given most of these ships have billions of passengers, visualise a large football stadium at the end of the game when the gates open and the crowd walks towards you. That gives you the picture of what happens to the resources of the hotel when a cruise ship arrives. So if you are looking for quick service at reception or your car from valet parking quickly, forget it. Apart from that, the rooms are comfortable, clean, quiet and many with good views. Couple of tips - If your room rate includes parking, don't think a $5 tip to the concierge will get your car out of the carpark. You will find a $28 per day charge on your bill. Don't also ask for two apples from the staff making up the restaurant for breakfast, at 9pm after seeing the sights. That will cost you $10. Overall a fair - good hotel that has some flaws. Worth $200 - $250 but not $419

Reviews.Title: “not 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Sanfrancisco820
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel, right on the water, and the views, if you get a view room, are spectacular. The service was not that of a 5 star hotel. I am a very experienced traveler. I would say that this hotel is definiately a 4 star. If this hotel was advertised as a 4 star hotel, I would have no complaint. I resent paying 5 star prices and not getting 5 star service. My objection was that there was no turn down service in the evening. The beds were made each morning, but the finishing pillows sat on the floor for the entire 4 day stay. There was a shortage of towels. We also had a sofa bed that was used each night. It was never closed in the morning as part of daily housekeeping. My real surprise at the lack of service was that the business service center charged $7 per 20 minutes to use the internet. I asked the concierge to please print out our boarding passes. He told me to go to the business center. I said that the recent hotels I stayed in, both in the US and Europe, printed out our boarding passes for us. I did not think that I should have to pay $7 to get our passes. I know of a Holiday Inn in LA where the computer for boarding passes is in the lobby and anyone, both in the hotel and off the street, can use it - free! (Hardly a 5 star hotel.) The concierge refused to help. I reluctantly went to the business center, was charged $7 only to find out that internation boarding passes from Vancouver are not available on line. I think the concierge should have known this. I did not have time to continue my complaint to the manager, as I needed to get to the airport. This was my first time staying at a Pan Pacific. If this is what they think is 5 star service, I will choose another hotel. We previously stayed at the Fairmont Waterfront across the street (twice). I will return to the Fairmont where we got much better service. I am not looking for discount service or trying to get something for nothing. I do expect to get what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FCUnitedOfManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Lovely clean room, lots of natural light coming from a very large window overlooking the cruise ship docking area. Bathroom was spotless and although not state of the art in style, was perfectly functional. The hotel is fairly central in location and Vancouver is not a particularly big city so you should be able to reach most places on foot. Just a note of warning, when we checked out we found 2 local phone calls on the bill, and we never even picked up the phone. The hotel removed these without any fuss at all, but might be something to look out for. Tips: (1) Seawall cycle hire is located just down the harbour and is definately the best way to see the city. (2) Get the bus out to Granville Island, its worth it just for the market. (3) Watch how far you wander around Gastown. The couple of blocks between there and Chinatown are a pretty depressing ghetto. We didn't actually get any hassle, but it was definately not a place for tourists to wander round.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: 99deedee
Reviews.Content: Someone had recommended the Pan Pacific to us. So we gave it a go. I have to say the room we were allocated had spectacular views of the harbour area. In fact we spent quite a while just watching the comings and goings of the boats,planes etc etc. We didn't eat in the hotel but that was down again to recommendations from friends of other restaurants. I can however recommend the cocktail bar outside! Overall would love to stay again if we ever visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pan Pacific!”
Reviews.Author: DEAToronto
Reviews.Content: 1st class hotel in every way: location, service, room, view of harbour & mountains from room, restaurant, extremely helpful concierge. What a treat to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelanytime
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day/6 night stay in Vancouver at the Pan Pacific hotel. The location was perfect and central to all the activities we took part in. Hotel staff was friendly, and very helpful. We arrived in town 4 hours before the designated check-in time, however after a quick lunch on the patio deck the conceirge called and said the room was ready for us. The city view room was a decent size, with floor to ceiling windows and a great view of downtown. We were facing an area that was not under construction, so that made a difference (much of downtown was under construction due to upcoming Olympics). The king bed was heavenly and extremely comfortable. I loved the 8th floor pool and hot tub deck. The view was nice and the hot tub was very relaxing late in the evening.
