I had a wonderful massage in the hotel spa! Tori, the massage therapist was terrific and took all the pain out of my back, shoulders and neck. The space is very relaxing and beautiful. We tried so many wonderful restaurants while in town, so I don't have much to say about the hotel's food, other than the lunch day one on the outdoor patio was delicious and a late evening dessert on the same patio was equally tasty. Cruises were coming in and out, but the hotel is spacious enough to handle the crowds comfortably. The elevators were incredibly fast and frequent. The doormen & conceirge were very friendly. All in all a very nice hotel experience. My only complaint was our closet door was stuck for several days of our visit (however housekeeping got it repaired) and the high speed internet was unbearably slow and difficult to get reception on. Luckily we weren't on a business trip, so we were able to deal with it.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: HollyBerkeley_CA
Reviews.Content: Ordinary hotel. Advertise flat screen TV, which to most of us means plasma or LCD, however, to them it means a tube TV with a sort-of flat screen in an armoir, basically just like your favorite Marriott Courtyard. In addition, the health spa was sold off to an outside company that blocked off the door to the sauna, steam, showers, etc., and left a few exercise machines available to guests. Also, to get to the exercise facility, you have to walk outside through the parking garage, since the inside entrance now belongs to the private facility ($75 daily charge to use). They do have a sleepy senior citizen security man seated in the garage,however, so you shouldn't have to worry about being beaten and robbed on your way to work out. This hotel is a churn and burn for the cruise ships. Not the place to get a real feel for Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: NJNora
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is a really nice convention hotel. Rooms are large enough to include sitting areas. Great bed with very fine linens. Rooms overlooking the harbor are worth the extra money - incredible view of the water and mountains featuring cruise ships and sea planes. Even though the property is a large one, elevators come quickly. Shops in the lobby are of unusally good quaility filled with real bargains. Best quality of this hotel is the staff. When we checked in early, there were no rooms available of the type we had reserved. The front desk clerk personally took us to view two rooms that were ready so we could decide which one we wanted. We found this helpfulness throughout the staff we encountered during our stay - a pleasant surprise especially for a property of this size.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average for Business Travellers !”
Reviews.Author: yachtsurvey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pan Pacific Vancouver during a May 2007 business trip. Having visited the city several times, I brought my wife along so she could experience all the city has to offer. We read the tripadvisor.com reviews before our trip, and based on the up and down reviews for this place, well, we were a bit nervous about it all, mainly because I had prepaid five nights. On arrival the location was perfect and the prepaid internet stay booked through the hotel website allowed for a great rate and a harborview room - no upgrades. As a very frequent business traveller, 7 years at approx 200 hotel nights a year - this hotel met or exceeded our expectations on all accounts. I have stayed at fancy waterside hotels in Barcelona, Boston, Norfolk, VA, Freeport and Nassau Bahamas, Antigua, Nice France, Cannes and elsewhere and this place was just fine and dandy. The room was quiet - and yes we were on the seaplane side, the climate control worked just fine - cold for sleeping, heat when wanted, the water was hot and plentiful - not a hint of brown, the bed perfect, room service breakfast prompt and among the best tasting I have had, the valet service prompt and personable, the check in rapid and pleasant and the maid service just great. The internet hooked up easily - with even the cable provided in the desk. The pool, while out of commission for spring cleaning, was restored and heated by the time we got around to using it. We really asked ourselves why the other reviews had negatives, and vowed to write our review in reply. My wife tried the spa to her great delight and I got to use the nearby - perhaps 2 minutes by foot - SeaBus to my work in North Vancouver, across the bay. In the mornings we were up and to our delight watched the seaplanes (these fun planes starting at 7am, all stopped by dark) taxi and take off at our feet, and we saw cruise ships on four days pull up and depart below our windows. It was fascinating to see, and we just stared out the windows in amazement from 630 to 730 am each morning, thinking about which seaplane was going where, how they would take off or land and such. Yes, you can hear them, but they are not loud enough to make you get up from bed ifr you are in it, or feel discomfited - and I am definitely a "noise fussy" traveller. We did not eat at any hotel restaurant because of all the fabulous restaurants within walking or taxi distance, (Carderos, Sand Bar, Tojo, Yoshis) so we cannot say how the hotel restaurant service or food might be. My wife walked to the Vancouver Harbor seaplane terminal and took a day trip to Victoria via seaplane - something she enjoyed immensely. Several days she took in the city on foot, by taxi and by organized tour. We were so taken in by the view and activity that we did not turn on the TV all week, so I do not know how that works at this hotel. Now, for the budget traveller, set your sights somewhere else. Yes, the car parking in downtown Vancouver at the very edge of the water under the hotel is spendy, and yes internet is charged and all the extras cost plenty too. So pry open that wallet if you expect the amenities this place has to offer. We spent $1900 US all in for five nights, including room, considerable taxes, valet parking, laundry four days, internet all five nights, room service, medium minibar consumption and gratuities. I travel well, and do not skimp, but my taste also runs to lower tier chain hotels if that is what suits. This same trip we stayed at a Hampton Inn for 2 nights and were plenty happy there too. Based on my travels, the cost of staying at a hotel like this is expensive, no matter what the city - and most hotels do not share such a fabulous location. I say if you can get a good rate, it is value for money. We say this hotel rated 4 and 1/2 stars, not five, but not four either. In most cases you will not need a car in Vancouver, taxis and metro transport are everywhere, so I will not rent one on our next trip - and save on the parking. I say do not bother with the non-waterview rooms at this hotel. The location is so fabulous that not having a waterview room is an automatic let down - unless the rate is so low as to compare favorably with an inland location......... I suggest specifying a room that faces Stanley Park and the seaplanes for best entertainment and views - short of a harbor "end suite" that we did not flake out for - There are non-agressive panhandlers in the area across the street, (and many areas of Vancouver) so best walk down the east side of the hotel or along the water side of the street to avoid them if so inclined. There is plenty of activity in this area day and night so we did not feel threatened in any way, but they are there. There is construction on the west side of the hotel that requires use of a sidewalk bypass, but the convention center expansion is low enough that it does not impede the hotel room views, and while we did not hear a single noise coming from it day or night, it remained fascinating to inspect from our room while munching breakfast or sipping wine .............. we pulled the chairs right to the window every morning and night. Try the outdoor heated hot tub. They keep the towels right there and there are changing rooms on the same floor. You will need a room key to access it. We loved it and stayed in it for over an hour, even while it rained on us ! There is general madness on the sidewalk in front of the hotel when the cruise ships are changing passengers, but it is to be expected, and we just scheduled ourselves to avoid the crowds. This heavy activity was not felt or sensed in the hotel by us - but I had to walk thru crowds on 2 occaisions and the Saturday check out while very fast at the front desk, was a challenge at the curbside where they (promptly) brought our car around to. For dissatisfied travellers, such as those with brown water or otherwise defective rooms, I say do not tolerate it in any hotel..If no joy at the hotel, check out and tell your credit card provider it was absolutely unsatisfactory for a rebate ............. and write tripadvisor !

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: CareyBerry
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived in Vancouver from a Holland America Cruise and spent two days in Vancouver on business. As soon as we arrived at the hotel there was a very friendly porter to help us with our luggage. The registration was quick and fuss free-the girl answered all of our silly questions about the exchange rate and the upgrade to our room. The concierge was absolutely wonderful. The same two people that made my reservations a month before our stay were the same two people that I actually spoke to during my stay. They were extremely helpful and patient even when I needed to make a few difficult changes. The room was superb. We had a view of the harbor and, better yet, of Stanley Park! The beds were so comfy I think I fell asleep the second I hit the pillow. The rooms were elegant and cozy all at the same time. We had a choice between Pan Pacific and two other hotels and we chose Pan Pacific-good choice!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: klever-weis
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is at the waterfront. This is great if you want harbor views or are going on a cruise. If you want to explore Vancouver, it means hiking at least 5 blocks in any direction for nightlife, shopping, restaurants. The area surrounding the hotel is mostly business oriented, or under construction. If you're not into walking, parking is tight and valet is expensive. The hotel is ok. For a five star property, the rooms are OK. Internet is expensive, and there's no WiFi. Room service is pricy. Elevators are S-L-O-W. I checked in early, and was offered the main room of a suite with just a pull-out bed. It was the only room available. While it had a great view, the bed was uncomfortable, and I could hear the couples fighting in the rooms on both sides of me. Overall, I was VERY disappointed. The only good thing was the gym on the cruise level. Very nice, good equipment, nice views. If a boat wasn't docked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views if you're lucky - Mix of elegance and not so...”
Reviews.Author: ASASG_7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pan Pacific four or five times, due to company functions. On two of those occasions we got rooms facing Coal Harbour and the view was magnificent, the curvature of the room actually adding to the feeling that it was something special. I agree with the person who wrote that the staff are strangely snobish and should add that for Vancouver the restaurants are over-priced. However, enjoy the piano bar (again, that view!), ignore the desk staff, and if you get a harbour side view, you'll enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Like a horror movie”
Reviews.Author: hwhitneyHumble
Reviews.Content: I was taking a shower in room 1234 with my eyes closed as I was shampooing my hair. When I opened my eyes I started screaming bloody murder because the water looked like sewer water. It was very dark brown with some type of sludge in it. I got out of the shower and called housekeeping. All they could say is that it happens now and then and to just let the water run for a while. I am sorry but this is supposed to be a 5 star hotel. I will never forget what it felt like to take a shower in sewer like water. It was like a horror movie where something died in the water well. I ended up using a water bottle and rinsing off from the sink because the water did not clear up after 30 minutes and I was running late for a very special night. I was very disappointed that the hotel did not take this matter more seriously nor did they show any sympathy or remorse. The view from my room was lovely yet loud as airplanes used the water like an airport. During meetings in the convention center the airplane noise interferred with the speakers presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: thongster
Reviews.Content: just got back from vancouver (2/22 - 2/26) and must say the hotel is really nice. we paid $127 US per night which i think is a great deal. here are some of the pros and cons: pros: -got upgraded to a full harbour view room - the view was beautiful even though it was only on the 10th floor. -king bed was heavenly -everything was cleaned and the overall service was above avg. -room service food was pretty good but expensive -sunday brunch was good but again very expensive -pretty good location -provided umbrella in room which i thought was a nice touch..don't know if this is standard for hotels in vancouver or not. -connected to waterfront center and skytrain; getting starbucks and fast food w/out ever stepping outside. cons: room iteself was on the smaller size but not bad. no espn - i'm from the us and watch espn all the time...LOL. expensive - restaurants, room service outdoor pool was not bad but the water was on the cool side rained sat. sun and mon - i know this has nothing to do w/ the hotel but just wanted to point that out.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good But Not For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Relton14
Reviews.Content: Wanted to splurge on our first few nights on honeymoon so booked here as its 5 star etc. When we got there the room had two beds as opposed to the double we ordered. Not a great start to our married life:) Staff said they were booked up and to be fair did upgrade us to a harbour front room when we came back for 3 nights at the end of our trip. Hotel is beautiful but not amazing enough for the price. Views are spectacular and the breakfast is fantastic. The rooms are really lovely spotlessly clean but as the hotel is located above a conference centre it misses that extra something that you expect from the 5 star hotel. Never the less it still was a lovely place to stay. Probably just being too picky.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Romantic, unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: smoghs
Reviews.Content: I had read the other reviews about this hotel before I went there, and now that I was there for 4 days and I came back 2 days ago, I am thinking why people wrote so much lies about it. Some reviews say that the room was cold which I believe they didn't know how to turn on the heater because when we were there it was very warm. The bed and the pillows are very comfortable and their housekeepers are very respectful and polite. Their customer service is amazing. We stayed on 22nd floor and that view can't be found in any other hotels. I enjoyed their outdoor heated pool & Hot Tub everyday. It is the best place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Six-day Stay, a very mixxed bag on our third stay here”
Reviews.Author: culverclan
Reviews.Content: This time around, despite the gorgeous view, we weren't quite as impressed as we'd previously been with the Pan Pacific. The original room they had us in had problems with the door lock. The second room was fine, but it was the same old view we had before and would cost, we were told, an additional $60 a night to have a different view. When we went downstairs to find out about the parking situation (yikes, that $27 a day was a shock!), the manager happened to be there and he said he would give us the living room to the Harbor Mountain View Suite, which would mean we would have to sleep on a sleeper sofa (which he assured us was the best available - after sleeping on it two nights, I'm certain he's wrong) and our son (9) would have a rollaway, which I ended up on the last three nights. The room was gorgeous (clean and lovely), but I'm tool old to be sleeping on a sleeper sofa. It just wasn't comfortable. My husband and son ended up on it and seemed to sleep well. The rollaway wasn't just a foldabed, it was more like a dorm bed, it was much better, and I slept fairly well, but it was like sleeping on a floor and I know that some people have a very difficult time with super super hard beds (which this one was). There were also issues with allergy-free linen which they never seemed to get right over the first two days (I'd sent an email asking for it several days before we arrived). The first night, they assured us it was allergy free, and I woke up in the middle of the night with horrible allergies. Turned out it was a down blanket. I wrote a note to the front desk, as well as to the housekeeping service and when we got back that night, the down blanket was still/back on the bed! We had to call housekeeping again to change linens (andm of course, tip again). Also, for the first two days, the shower would suddenly spurt out dark brown water, replete with vegetable matter. We called them the first day, and it happened again the next day. We're not talking a little rust in the pipes. We are talking nasty, nasty dark brown water with bits in it. Fairly repulsive. It was apparently an issue with the storms, but it was just gross. They suggested it might be because we were the last room in the building. Whatever it was, it was disgusting. Wireless internet is $14.95 for 24 hrs. It just seemed that it should have free wireless, at the least. This was the worst: Parking was $27 a day, which translated into $141, which was more than we paid for the rental car (which we booked through priceline for $120 for the week!). Each day, they would add bottles of Nestle Pure Life, in addition to the $5 bottles of Fiji. We never drank the Pure Life, which just piled up in the room, and just as we suspected, they cost $$ too (we finally called to ask) --- this link above shows our exact room (but the bedroom doors were always closed, because they belonged to other guests). Bottom line, gorgeous view, but so-so all around stay.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars? no way, many better places in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: walrus007
Reviews.Content: A big disappointment, but it was cheap. This hotel may technically be 4.5 or 5 stars due to the facilities available but it was far from top quality. This hotel is typical of a corporate convention center. Check in was a painful fiasco. First we had to wait in a painfully slow line up for 15+ minutes to check in, my wife went to the concierge to complain and asked to pay extra to get checked in right away but he looked at her like she was from Mars. We then walked in to an already occupied room, luckily it was my wife’s Mothers room and she and her new husband were dressed! Our key over rode their room key so now their keys no longer worked. After a lengthy wait on hold and a 10-minute wait for a call back and 15 minutes for new keys to arrive, they finally had everything straightened out. They blamed the computer system. Our room was large and appeared clean but had a musty smell. The bathroom was clean and nice with good quality toiletries and a good shower. The furnishings were hap-hazard and not really well done at all (fake brass coffee table, yuck), it could have been so much better with all the space they had to work with. The coffee maker is in the bathroom, which I hate, and the coffee condiments and supplies are 20 feet away in a dark cubbyhole under the TV, with no place nearby for the garbage. Not very well though out at all. There was a large desk with lots of space around it so it is set up well for business. We had adjoining doors to the room next door which was occupied by a family that believed children should be heard at all times and they kept it up continuously, we were woken up at 7am by screaming kids. We were relieved when they went out for an hour for breakfast. You can literally hear every word through the doors. Ask about construction noise if you plan on sleeping in, the convention center expansion is underway, other people we new in the hotel complained to us about this also. We paid $130 + taxes =$150 so we got what we paid for. You can easily get a much better room and service in Vancouver for $160+. The photos on the hotels web site were obviously taken a long time ago, our room didn’t look any where near a nice as the photos imply, neither did the lobby. A great location with stunning harbour views (for an extra charge), a beautiful area to stroll around.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Carlii1964
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. I had a harbor/mountain view and it was lovely, but small. My friend had a city view and her room was huge! VERY clean and the amenities Toiletries Were 5 *****. I tipped the housekeeper $5-$10 a night and asked for extra shampoo/lotions. I felt like a princess! We had room service twice and the food was good and the service very fast. It's pricey but I had a $200 off any hotel booked thru Expedia for 3 or more nights so my room was discounted.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nightnurse
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, almost every window has some view of Burrard Inlet. NIce piano music during evening cocktails.....watched the cruiseships leaving for Alaska. Friendly, courteous staff, would stay here anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile For The Views Alone”
Reviews.Author: SansPeur
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights with Expedia for 'City View' Room and on check in were upgraded to a higher floor corner room with Harbour View. (This always happens to me in Canadian Hotels !). This was a superb room with all modcons & excellent views over the harbour. The ingoing construction nearby was not a problem in any way and the seaplane traffic only added to our enjoyment. Meals in the Bar were excellent and reasonably priced for a hotel of this class. We did not eat in the Five Sails - there is a limit to what I will spend on food !. Cleanliness throughout the hotel was excellent, the staff were friendly and attentive throughout & staying here was a pleasant experience which I would thoroughly recommend. Certainly there was no cruise liner traffic during our stay and that probably has a bearing on how we rate this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: bearclan
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Pan on a Saturday night. The location is excellent, but the room was underwhelming. Expensive internet service didn't work properly but they charged us for it anyway. I was amazed to find inexpensive Nabob coffee in the room instead of something nicer. I don't think the property lives up to the reputation of the Pan Pacific brand. Beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Curate's Egg”
Reviews.Author: Quargil
Reviews.Content: Rather mixed feelings about this hotel (which I stayed in on two separate occasions in September 2006). It is in a lovely location, and it is worth upgrading to a harbourfront view room, as the views are spectacular (although the rooms themselves are otherwise no more than one would expect for the price and arguably the bathrooms are rather dated). There was no noticeable noise from the nearby convention centre construction site (which I had been warned might be the case). Whilst the staff were friendly, it is (as others have said) a vast and impersonal hotel that plays host to large parties of people arriving off the many cruise ships that dock outside. Nothing wrong with that per se, but it is rather disorientating to walk into a hotel only to find that the ground floor is one vast space with nowhere to check in (you have to go up two escalators before you get to the hotel level proper). On the plus side (particularly for tourists (as I was)), it does have the benefit of having a National/Alamo car rental desk on the ground floor. On balance eating at the hotel was rather disappointing. I ate twice in the flagship restaurant "Five Sails". The food was uniformly excellent (as it ought to be at the price) but sadly the service on the second occasion was so woeful as to ruin the experience (50 minutes passed from ordering before my first course arrived). They had a function in their private dining room and clearly didn't have enough staff to cope both with this and the other diners - far from the AAA Five Diamond Award experience proclaimed on their website. Eating once in the hotel bar was also a mistake - a very mediocre club sandwich. For a lovely dinner, I would recommend the Cin Cin restaurant on Robson Street - the desserts, in particular, were among the best I have tasted. On balance I would probably try a harbourfront room at the Fairmont Waterfront over the road in the event that I visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: pdchi
Reviews.Content: Great place, lots of amenities. They upgraded us to a junior suite when they learned it was our honeymoon. Friendly staff and great service for such a large place. Wonderful beds too! Decent restaurants and great room service breakfast! Nice large spa with lots of services and options. It's seems a little away from the happenings downtown even though it really only a few blocks but it was nice to be near the water for a couple of days. There is a bit too much of the convention atmosphere but that's only in the lobby and the rooms are all quiet and nice. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: martir
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in August prior to leaving for an Alaskan cruise. If you're leaving on a cruise from Canada Place, the location can't be beat. You just take the elevator to the cruise ship level. I would stay here again if going on a cruise and I could get a rate similar to what I received for this trip (around $200 US). If i was not cruising, however, I would stay elsewhere. The hotel is big and impersonal - I felt like simply a number. Additionally, we had a room with only two double beds. It seems that a hotel of this category should at least have a queen size bed. If you stay here, I should warn you. If you get a room that overlooks what appears to be a roof from another part of the building, ask for another room. In the middle of the night on both nights we were there, we were awoken by noisy sea gulls right outside the window. They congregate during the night on this rooftop and make a lot of noise all night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JMC1000
Reviews.Content: I don't know where the other reviews came from - but, the service is excellent and the price is a bargain on Expedia. If you don't get the water view, then take the city view room. The harbor view is not worth the extra money. The staff was more than helpful and extremely efficient. The food was more expensive than expected, but you are paying for convenience and great views of the harbor. The construction is unslightly - but, it is not the fault of the hotel. This was my second time staying at the Pan Pacific and I would stay again. The Fairmount is three times the price and doesn't have the great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pan Pacificl”
Reviews.Author: ogkmv
Reviews.Content: August 31,2006 The location and hotel is great for the price. However everything else is extra: vallet parking- $28.50 per day; internet- $15.00 per day; simple burger- $17.00

Reviews.Title: “NOT 5 DIAMOND”
Reviews.Author: Zboro
Reviews.Content: After standing in the Lobby for 30 mins tryng to check in, I get a room that had dust all over it AND a used condom under the bed. If that wasn't bad enough, I called the operator to complain all to no avail. No one even followed up with me, and no one came to remove it, AFTER 3 calls. The next day i went to the restaurant for breakfast and wanted to know why it said that breakfast is open at 6:30am and there was no hot food yet on the buffet. One moment the waiter said, it was coming as they apparantly had a sick call in the kitchen. I don't want your excuses, I want breakfast and do not want to be late for my meeting. I asked to see the manager to which I was told that there was not one in yet. This was now 6:45am. I asked the waiter how you coul consider yourself a 5 diamond hotel. He replied that the hotel knows when the inspector is coming to rate them so they make sure they have enough staffing and rescources in place. So does that mean the average traveller like myself gets ripped off and gets the short end of the stick because the inspector is not in town?? this should be a 3 diamond hotel...at best!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: topdown71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the pan pacific after an alaska cruise. The hotel had good reviews and I thought that it would be a nice treat for my girlfriend. The staff was friendly and helpful at check in. I had reserved the "romantic package", which is really nothing more than a rose, a bottle of wine, and dinner. However, it was appropriate for the time. The wine and rose did not arrive until after 10PM despite mentioning it to the manager several times. Obviously a little late. The room was nice, but not for the price. I did not go on priceline because I wanted a guaranteed water view. The view is superb. We enjoyed sitting on the patio with a drink and watching the cruise ships depart. Dinner was average. After our trip, I received a customer satisfaction email. I replied and voiced my complaints. Their response was essentially a pat on the back. Overall, I was very disappointed with my experience and will not stay there again. The Terminal City Tower Hotel was better.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful hotel with average "gourmet" restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jenagar
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel during the weekend of the firework extravaganza and totally fell in love with the city. The hotel was surprisingly very warm and accomodating despite being located in a ginormous convention center/ cruise ship terminal. Upon checking in at 2am, the concierge pleasantly surprised us with a complementary upgrade to a higher floor with a harbor view! Nice. Upon entering the room, we found it to be well-maintained, very clean, and large. (You never know, with the convention hotels!) The service we received from hotel staff was also excellent, with the exception of the hotel's Five Sails restaurant, where it was plain inattentive (or "european style," if you are accustomed to being totally ignored and forced to wait nearly 90 minutes after ordering for the main course to be brought out). The food was good, at least. Aside from this encounter, the experience at the Pan Pacific was wonderful and we would definitely stay again, though, we will definitely skip the Five Sails--since Vancouver has no shortage of nice restaurants that serve good food AND provide decent service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pan Pacific Fountain Valley California”
Reviews.Author: ladybug5
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Vancouver Pan Pacific Hotel. I think what makes this hotel 5 stars is the service. I even tipped the concierge for a wonderful job. They are pretty busy, but make you feel like they are there just for you. I cancelled a grey line tour early in the morning due to inclement weather, but as the day continued the weather improved and one hour before the tour was to leave, the concierge was able to rebook our tour with no penalties on either end. We had a great time on the Capilano and Grouse Mountain Dinner tour. On another occasion, my glasses were becoming loose and the front desk found a small screwdriver to fix my glasses and even delivered it to the dining room. The room was very comfortable even though the bathroom was a little small. I asked if my room could be moved a little closer to the water so I could see the ships returning from Alaska and it was done. I will never stay anywhere else in Vancouver, but The Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: rk2244
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Pan Pacific. I saw a bargain price for a 5 star hotel on Hotwire and thought for sure that it was Sutton Place since it was the hotel shown in some of their package offerings. We were a bit disappointed when we found it was the Pan Pacific. Once we got there, we were pleasantly surprised. The location was perfect and despite the Hotwire rate we were given a very large room with a harbor view. The views were stunning. I had also read about the construction and was worried about the noise. Luckily, we did not hear a thing. You can hear the floatplanes when they start flying after 8am, but this was not a bother for us at all. We would definitely stay at the Pan Pacific again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hOTEL”
Reviews.Author: EMERALDWINNER
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel- great view- nice robes, and yummy beds!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to come back soon”
Reviews.Author: freija
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay a the Pan Pacific Hotel. I arrived in the city early at 10:00 a.m. not expecting to be able to check into my room yet. But they had a room ready for me, and to top it of, it was on the 22nd floor. I had a great view of the city and the harbor with the cruise ship and was on the opposite side of the convention center construction. The room had everything I needed and more (such as a scale in the bathroom). The umbrella, for example, came in very handy on my first day there. The hotel could not have been better located. I walked everywhere from the hotel, and in the morning I went for a run straight from the hotel along the shore path to Stanley Park -- I never had to wait at a stop light. One more thing I noticed was that they changed the rugs in the elevators everyday, as they had the name of the day on them. I would definitely stay at the Pan Pacific Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and expensive”
Reviews.Author: peachwhit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and conveniently located. We found an amazing internet rate which allowed us to stay at such a pricey hotel. Parking was $25 a day, which is about average in a big city. The beds were comfortable, and the room was quite large. We found that people were quite reserved and not as friendly as we might have liked, but maybe that's how it is in Vancouver? Our American money is not worth as much anymore, so we found most everything to be very expensive. The highlight of the hotel was the Concierge. A wonderful man with much helpful information. I hope the hotel pays him well for the excellent job that he does. His advice and reccommendations helped us to plan out our short stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ziggydssp
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to a stay at the Pan Pacific as part of our 20th anniversary trip. Our experience was very disappointing. Don't let the pictures on the hotel's web site fool you. The Pan Pacific is a very nondescript convention hotel. When we arrived at the hotel and came up the escalator it felt like we were coming into a big convention center with chairs stacked on end and people walking around everywhere with convention badges. We arrived at the check in desk at about 4:30pm and our room was not ready. After about a half hour we were able to go to our room. The room had a strong cigar odor even though we had booked a non-smoking room. The view from room was not good, it faced a big crane that was being used on the new convention center. We went back down to the front desk and were informed that they didn't have any other room available. We had booked a harbor view room and were paying $375/night. That was totally unacceptable. The hotel was not able to find us an alternative room. We ended up cancelling our reservation and checked in at the Wedgewood Hotel. The difference was night and day in terms of service and accommodations. The Pan Pacific may be convenient for cruisers but the Wedgwood beats it hands down. If you are looking for something special, don"t stay at the Pan Pacific!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: nuheart
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Pan Pacific after a short cruise. The rooms were large and the beds were plush.. The view from our room was incredible overlooking the harbour and stanley park and the mountains across the bay. All views from this hotel are great. The service is good, I was surprised there was no nightly turn down service since it is rated a 5 star but everything, including the pool & spa area was top notch. It is located right where the cruise ships dock so its location could not be better if you are docking or embarking. My elderly parents were traveling with us and the hotel treated them with great respect-- They loved the hotel. There are taxis and tour buses ( try the hop on--hop off tour--esp. if you are a first time vistor) out front to take you anywhere in town. You are also very close to the train and sea bus terminals. Look for good deals on line--this is a wonderful place to stay in every way but can get quite pricey in the top summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Luxe!”
Reviews.Author: foodiesubie
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to Vancouver and I'm a hotel snob - so I was a little concerned about the location. But it was FANTASTIC -- walkable to everywhere I wanted to go -- and convenient roadside parking too! We had amazing service -- we complained the first night about a little noise -- and they immediately moved us to the 23rd floor, where we had the same spectacular view of the ocean and mountains. They even moved our bags in for us while we were out exploring. Our room was very large, stylish and new furniture, immaculate and just super plush and wonderful to relax in after a day of hiking. The hotel lobby and all had a convention hotel vibe, but don't be deceived, the rooms actually stand up to a 5-star hotel interior (even if the bathrooms could be a tad larger) We also had great, if expensive, room service, but good to know the food is decent as well. The only negative is that, as most business hotels do, there are fees to all extras: fitness center (but not pool), internet, etc... After seeing our friends' room at the Crowne Plaza in town, we felt we had gotten a superb deal -- a room twice the size, no stale smoke smell, a gorgeous view and only paid $10 more!

Reviews.Title: “My Pan Pacific Stay was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a beautiful corner room that looked out over the harbour and coastal mountains. We had lovely weather so the view was spectacular! It was truly a 5 diamond experience with very soft high-quality linens on our bed which added to the bed itself which gave me one of my best nights sleep. We had a very memorable meal in the 5 Sails restaurant. Superb service and the food was excellent. I was treated to a visit to the Spa and was pampered in beautiful surroundings. Highly recommend the Pan Pacific Vancouver to anyone travelling on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Still not sure........”
Reviews.Author: Seacruise
Reviews.Content: I stayed here January 16th 2006 and posted a review. I was not happy at that time and filled out my comment card. I was sent a letter from the hotel and offered a free 1 night stay again, which we did April 8th 2006. I was to call the Executive Asst. to make the reservations for this room. This is some ways concerned me because the hotel staff would know why this reservation was being made and would go the extra mile to make sure nothing happened this time. My suspicions were bourn out when we checked in. Arrival in the room had a small box of chocolates and a letter from the hotel manager welcoming us back. That night as we were leaving for dinner there was a knock at the door and a maid offering turn down service. This was not offered the last time we stayed. Very nice to come back to find slippers on the floor next to the bed and the robes set out and chocolates on the bed. I must also note that it was our understanding that we would get a room like our first room just higher up. This was not the case. This time the room was only about 1/3 the size of our first room. Not sure if because our first room was on the 8th floor (no real view) and our new room was on the 19th floor if this had something to do with it. The room this time had something different in the bathroom. The tub/shower wall was replaced by a window from the top of the tub to the ceiling. They did offer you a blind to pull to make it more private, not that anyone could see you. You may also make note that they are 3 months behind in pile driving for the new convention centre. They are now pounding piles 6 days a week starting at 7:00 AM and going through till after 6 PM Monday to Saturday. They are expected to finish this sometime this summer. So we are left wondering after this visit what is the norm for this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocyvr
Reviews.Content: Returned to Vancouver for a 3 night stay in February and we were suprised to get a room at the Pan Pacific for 105USD a night on Hotwire. The special rate gave us a city view room which was perfectly fine. There was going to be an extra charge of 60CAD per night to upgrade to a harbour view room at check in. Decided to stay with the city view as we were a little concerned about noise from the construction of the new convention center mentioned in other reviews. Didn't hear a thing. I requested a room on a higher floor with a king bed before we arrived. No problems...great customer service both on the phone and at the hotel. The newly renovated rooms are quite nice. The bed was extremely comfortable. Valet Parking (27CAD per day) was always efficient. The self park option is 20CAD. Make sure you check out the outdoor jacuzzi and pool...great views. Didn't have the time to try out the restaurants and spa facilities. We would definately stay here again although next time we are planning to give the Westin Bayshore a try.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: bh7h
Reviews.Content: It has been a pleasure once more to stay at this hotel. The view is just fabulous. It is close to all shopping and restaurant. Robson Avenue is a must to see. It is minutes to Stanley Park and the aquarium. 20 minutes by car to Cypress Mountain for an unforgettable view to the city. Keep it up!!! I will come back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: GillianandJames
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pan Pacific for 2 nights. The rooms are spacious and the beds are wonderfully comfortable. The hotel has all of the amenities that you could need, including shops, restaurant and bar. The lounge bar serves food which I can recommend. The views from the lobby are wonderful and worth the stay here alone. Staff are pleasant and helpful. If you get the chance pop over to the Fairmont to see their resident dog Holly, she works at the hotel from 8am to 5pm. I suggest the Boathouse restaurant in English bay for a great seafood meal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location, lacked personal touch.”
Reviews.Author: anotherholiday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in Sepember 2005 and upgraded to a corner sea/mountain view room and the views were spectacular. Location was good for getting to all the main sites including Grouse Mountain via the ferry, Gastown, Robson Street and Stanley Park. Room itself was luxurious and spacious and if you've got an AMEX card you get 5 nights for the price of 4! Swimming pool (heated) and spa have the same superb views. On the downside, as with all big hotels, it felt very corporate and lacked the personal touches, e.g. we asked for restaurant recommendations and got handed a 5 page print out to go away to read!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular setting”
Reviews.Author: lily_schultz
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific must have one of the most spectacular city settings in the world, with panoramic views of Burrand Inlet and the mountains beyond. Check-in was slow, but our standard room on the 12th floor was spacious and clean with a good bathroom and quiet, efficient airconditioning. Didn't have an evening meal, but the breakfast buffet ~ all you could eat for C$25 (around £12.50) ~ was to die for. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal with a an excellent view”
Reviews.Author: smdubowsky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific after an Alaskan cruise.The hotel is situated on top of the pier so getting there was a breeze. We had booked a standard room using an American Express special rate which was half off the rack rate or about 200 USD. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a harbor view. The room itself was very comfortable and had all of the amenities. The only downside was that there is harborside construction which might wake up a late sleeper during the week. If you can get a deal like this, grab it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, but a factory”
Reviews.Author: Happy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: I checked in for a three day weekend and am glad I picked the Pan Pacific. The location is ideal. The rooms are very comfortable. Disappointing when I arrived at midnight on September 15 to find that the room I had booked was given away (a group overstayed their plans was the excuse.) Luckily, I got a room in a lower category (with no rate differential offered) and was told I could change the next day. (I did not bother.) The lobby is always a zoo in the daytime with meeting attendees and cruise ship passengers. Sometimes the 4 hotel elevators were not enough for all of the guest movements and you had to let them pass by a few times. Bad luck for me as my forced downgrade was to the 10th floor (guest rooms start on 8) which means elevators were often full when they reached my floor. Other than that, I liked the hotel for its location and comfort. I was disappointed to often seeing guests checking in at 8:30 am and getting their every wish (mountain view high floor and 2 oversized queen beds) when they paid the cheapest rates. I guess that is what happened to my room - it was given to a discounted rate guest and not held for me (despite Amex prepayment) for my late arrival. I had breakfast in the buffet restaurant on September 18 and was very disappointed. Food and variety was good. Hostess was pleasant but service was surly at best. After being seated by the hosted and being ignored by passing waiters (and the restaurant was not full) for 15 minutes, I got my food. Then, I spotted the hostess and asked her to send a waiter to my table to offer coffee. The waiter's belated greeting was NOT "good morning, would you like coffee". It was "do you have breakfast vouchers". I did not as I was not on a cheap package. Then, another waiter came and asked if I wanted two checks for breafkast or one and I replied one. I returned to the buffet and saw the check sitting there and ignored it. The 2nd waiter returned again and told me the check was there and noted I had not signed it. I told him I would do so when I finished eating. I was holding a fork and had no place in my fingers for a pen. He replied "at your convenience I see". I do not know what he meant - I normally sign or pay the check in restaurants when I finish, not as I am eating. For C$60 for two, the waiters should be taught a lesson in basic manners. I completed the hotel comment card which had noplace to rate the restaurants and filled in my view of the bad service on the card. I have to say the rude lack of attention really annoyed me and did not let me enjoy my breakfast. The other two mornings I went to Starbuck's as I was not hungry and got much better service - thank you and good morning - the real basics. Luckily, I only had two glasses of wine on Saturday evening in the hotel bar overlooking the harbor (my downgrade did not afford me this view that I had paid for) and limited my contact with the hotel's rude F&B department. The F&B department was busy though. On Friday night, the President of China was there for a banquet and the streets in front of the hotel and the hotel entry were filled with protestors. Some were banging drums to make themselves heard, which did not bug me that much, but I am sure irritated other guests. Had I gotten the room I reserved and prepaid for and had I been treated with minimal courtesy in the hotel restaurant, I would have listed the hotel as Above Average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: CosmoKitty24
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver and were very pleased with the Hotel. We thought the location was very convenient for getting around the and seeing the city. The level of service was superior, the food was very good, but be warned you do pay for EVERYTHING when staying at this hotel, including a $3.95 delivery charge for room service, which we found a little rediculous. The pool and fitness areas are very nice and what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The hotel is located at the Canada Place Convention Center so it is in a busy location, but is within walking distance of most of the city's attaction, including Stanley Park and Gastown. One note there is loads of contruction in and around Vancouver in preparation for the 2010 Olympics, this includes the convention center, the piledriving starts around 7 am and doesn't stop until 5, so right now I would opt for the City view room vs. the Harbor view to cut down on the noise. Apart from that we had no issues with our stay and truly enjoyed our time at the Pan Pacific Vancouver. We would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Pan Pacific Vancouver
HotelInfo.Address: 300-999 Canada Place Way | Suite 300, Vancouver, British Columbia V6C3B5, Canada
